loans.name: Maria Lusmila

texts.es:
La señora María Lusmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Jazmines”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 70 años y es madre D. 04  hijos, ya independientes.

María Lusmila, es una mujer perseverante y emprendedora. Se dedica a la venta D. chamelos (mentol, agujas, hilos, pasta dental, shampoo, hisopos, tijeras), se encuentra ubicada en un pequeño ambiente, muy bien acondicionado, en el Mercado Central D. su Distrito, donD. día a día, ofrece sus productos, a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen.
Actualmente, nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio, su espíritu luchador y el gran optimismo, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará  más chamelos como mentol, hilos D. todos los colores, shampoo, pasta dental, desodorantes, tijeras, colonias refrescantes, jaboncillos.

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. María Lusmila belongs to the Comunal Bank "Los Jazmines" ("The Jasmins"), in the district of Moyobamba, province of Moyobamba, department of San Martín. She is married, 70 years old and has 4 children, all of them independent. María Lusmila is a persevering and enterprising woman. She sells personal care products (menthol, needles, threads, toothpaste, shampoo, cotton swabs, scissors). Her business is located in a small place, very well set up, in her district's central market, where every day she offers her products to her steady clientele, among which she is already well known. She tells us that nowadays her business is going very well. Her fighting spirit and great optimism helped her grow independent as a woman and she is very proud of her achievements. With this 2,000.00 PEN loan she will purchase more personal care items such as menthol, multicolored threads, shampoo, toothpaste, deodorant, scissors, refreshing colognes and soap. She is a stable and hard working woman who is thankful for the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos movement has offered her to grow as a woman and small entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of personal care items

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Jazmines”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 60 años y es madre de 06 hijos, todos ya independientes.
Bertha, se dedica a la venta de granos y lleva varios años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito. Poco a poco, fue ahorrando e invirtiendo mas en su negocio y hoy en la actualidad ya es  muy conocida por sus clientes, que día a día, acuden a su puesto a consumir sus productos. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará en sacos de cacao, maíz y maní, para luego preparar mantequilla de maní, maíz amarillo, para la preparación de chichas, fréjoles en kilos, racimos de plátanos verdes,  para preparar harina de plátano.
Bertha, se siente muy orgullosa por el trabajo que realiza durante tantos años, el buen producto que vende le ha proporcionado clientela fiel que compra todos los días y es muy conocida en el mercado. Agradace al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional a mujeres como ella.
texts.en:
. Bertha, 60, is a member of the "Los Jazmines" communal bank, which is in Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She is separated and the mother of 6 adult children. Bertha has been a grains merchant for several years in her district's central market. Little by little she saved and invested more in her business and today she is very well-known by her customers who visit her daily to buy her products. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy sacks of cocoa beans, corn and peanuts to make peanut butter; yellow corn to make chichas (alcoholic drink made from fermented corn), kilograms of kidney beans, bunches of green bananas to make banana flour. Bertha feels very proud of the work she has done for so many years; the good product she sells has produced regular customers for her that buy daily from her; she is very well-known in the market. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the unconditional support it gives women like her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: María Genara

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María Genara J. se dedica con mucho entusiasmo a elaborar deliciosos platillos de comida para ofrecerlos a sus clientes que adquieren los alimentos.

Ella inicia el negocio a partir de las cinco de la mañana en adelante y el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como lo es carne de res, carne de pollo, arroz, frijoles, plátanos, aceites, carbón, platos, cucharas y vasos descartables, entre otros. Con el crédito se beneficiará grandemente y beneficiará a su familia que mantiene.
texts.en:
María Genara J. prepares delicious meals in Managua's Mayoreo market. She starts her work-day at 5am. She will use the funding to buy ingredients like beef, chicken, rice, beans, bananas, cooking oils, charcoal, dishes, spoons and disposable drinking glasses, among others. The funding will be of great benefit for herself and the family she supports.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, chicken, rice, beans, bananas, cooking oils, charcoal, plates, spoons and disposable drinking glasses.

loans.name: Lucila Saida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Saida pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE” D. la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 50 años, es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos D. los cuales uno depenD. D. ella. Su hijo Victor tiene 18 años y estudia en la universidad la carrera profesional D. ingeniería civil. Ellos viven en el departamento del Cusco,  provincia del Cusco. 
 
Saida es profesora en la localidad D. Chincheros. Saida hace 22 años que enseñanza en la escuela D. chicheros, ella también se dedica a la confección D. chompas utiliza lana D. alpaca y hace a pedido del cliente. Ya son 30 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Saida requiere el préstamo para comprar más lana D. alpaca para confeccionar chompas con figuras representativas  D. la región.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Saida, 50, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “COMUZONE” communal bank. She is divorced and has four children, one of whom is still dependent on her. Her son, Victor, is in the university studying to become a civil engineer. They live in Cusco department, Cusco province. Saida has been a teacher in Chincheros for 22 years. She also makes alpaca sweaters to order. She has been in this line of work for 30 years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into it. Saida needs funding to buy more alpaca wool to continue making her sweaters that have figures woven into them that represent the region. She is grateful for the help granted through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Ta-Tai-Theke Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Ta-Tai-Theke' group. Mariatu S. who is on the left in the photo is the leader of the group. Thirty-year-old Mariatu is married to a soldier and they have 3 children. Mariatu owns a “cigarette box” where she sells cigarettes, mints, gum, drinks, (soft drinks and Bitter Kolo - a locally produced non-alcoholic drink believed to be good for men), matches, and so on. She has been a businesswoman for 3 years now. 

Mariatu wants a SLL 500,000 loan in order to expand her business. Thus with her share of the loan, she will buy crates of soft drinks/Bitter Kolo drink and boxes of cigarettes. Consequently, Mariatu will be able to make better sales, earn more profit so that she can repay her loan, and look after her 3 children who are attending primary school.

loans.use: Buy crates of soft drinks/Bitter Kolo drink and boxes of cigarettes

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
La señora María Andrea S. es casada con el señor José de Jesús R., y son una familia joven pero muy trabajadora ella labora para una escuela privada como asistente educativa y el trabaja para una escuela del gobierno como profesor de educación artística y cuenta con un trabajo adicional para un Instituto privado.
Ellos anteriormente ya habían solicitado 2 créditos para la construcción de una recamara amplia créditos que fueron pagados siempre con puntualidad y este seria el tercer crédito para iniciar la construcción de un nuevo cuarto, para tener mayor espacio en su hogar y para que su familia este mas cómoda.
texts.en:
María Andrea S. is married to José de Jesús R.. They are a young but very hard-working family; she works as a teaching assistant at a private school and he is an art teacher at a public school; he also has a second job at a private institute. They have received two prior loans to build a large bedroom; they repaid them both on time. This would be their third loan, which will be used to add a new room, so that the family will have more space and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: We Dae Pay Quick Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'We Dae Pay Quick' group from Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are local, small-scale entrepreneurs who want a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to boost their businesses. 

The woman on the left in the photo is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She is Isatu T., a 57-year-old widowed mother of 5 children.  Four of her children are already grown-ups and living on their own, and one is still dependent on her. For many years now, Isatu has been selling items made out of plastic – bowls, cups, plates, buckets,etc. With her share of this loan, she will travel to the capital city, Freetown, as usual and buy the above items in dozens.

loans.use: Buy items made out of plastic – bowls, cups, plates, buckets, etc.

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Juana del Socorro se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora dedicándose al negocio de venta de verduras en el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega donde a diario ofrece los productos para dar lugar a obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su hogar y su familia.
Ella ha acudido una vez más a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos tales como zanahorias, chayotes, papas, tomates y chiltomas. Ella espera que el crédito sea otorgado porque desea lograr la satisfacción de cada uno de sus clientes que a diario le visitan en el mercado.
texts.en:
Juana del Socorro stands out as a hard-worker selling vegetables in Chinandega's central market. She offers her products daily in order to earn income for her home and family's well-being. She has called upon Ceprodel once again to request funds to buy products like: carrots, prickly pears, potatoes, tomatoes and peppers. She hopes the loan will be approved because she wants to be able to meet all of her customers' needs when they come to visit her in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: María Thelma

texts.es:
La venta de cosméticos es el negocio al que muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Thelma en el mercado Central en Chinandega donde muy temprano inicia sus ventas para lograr la satisfacción del cliente. Atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en el negocio y para ello ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los cosméticos tales como shampoo, jabones, cremas, perfumes, entre otros.
Por este motivo es que ella espera que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y así logrará mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia al adquirir los ingresos de la venta de estos cosméticos.
texts.en:
Thelma sells cosmetics in Chinandega's central market. She starts her day very early in the morning in order to satisfy her customers' desires. She needs to invest in stock inventory, so she is asking for funding to buy cosmetics like: shampoo, soaps, creams, perfumes, etc. She hopes her loan request will be granted so that she can improve her own and her family's living conditions through the earnings from the sale of these cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Gine Arlesy

texts.es:
la sra. Gine Arlesy L. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en la aldea Altos de la Flor en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Gine se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo como ser cremas de todo tipo, perfumes, lociones, tintes de pelo etc. tambien vende productos para la limpieza de pisos y ventanas como ser jabon, cloro, desinfectantes etc.
Gine en estos momentos necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor ya que no tiene mucho inventario.
su producto lo vende al credito en pagos mensuales, esto no le da oportunidad de comprar mercaderia de un solo e incrementar su inventario.
las ganancias que obtenga son para el sustento de sus hijos y los gastos del hogar.
estos productos los vende ambulantemente en diferentes empresas privadas y estatales de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Gine necesita el credito para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Gine Arlesy L., 44, lives in the village of Altos de la Flor in the city of San Lorenzo. She sells all kinds of catalogue beauty products like: creams, perfumes, lotions, hair dye, etc. She also sells products for floor and window cleaning like: soap, chlorine bleach, disinfectants, etc. Gine needs funding to buy more merchandise at wholesale because her stock is low. She sells her products at credit and collects monthly payments. This leads to her not having capital available to replenish her stock all at once. The profits she earns are to support her home and children. She goes to various business locations, both private and public, in San Lorenzo to sell her items. Gine needs funding if her business is to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy skin creams, face creams, lotions, perfumes, deodorants, hair dyes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yunior Joel

texts.es:
el joven Yunior Joel R. C. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en union libre con la joven Francis Ordoñez, Yunior se dedica a la venta de tomates, papas, yuca, repollo, chiles, zanahorias, patastes, pepinos, bananos, naranjas, platanos, cebollas etc.
tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, para vender su producto se traslada en su vehiculo a diferentes municipios del departamento de valle, muchas personas le compran ya que el llega a la puerta de cada casa vendiendo sus verduras y frutas. 
su meta a corto plazo es tener un puesto de venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Nacaome, el tener un puesto en dicho mercado es muy satisfactorio ya que las ventas ahi son muy buenas, es un poco dificil conseguir un puesto en dicho mercado pero esta dispuesto a conseguirlo.
Yunior es un joven luchador y trabajador con muchas ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
Yunior Joel R. C., 27, lives with his life partner, Francis Ordoñez. Yunior has sold tomatoes, potatoes, yucca, cabbage, chilies, carrots, chayote, cucumbers, plantains, oranges, bananas, onions, etc. for the last two years. He drives to various municipalities in Valle department to sell his product. Many people buy from him because he comes to their very door selling his fruits and vegetables. His short-term goal is to have a vegetable and fruit selling stand in Nacome's municipal market. Having a stall in the market is very satisfying because sales there are very good. However, getting a stall there is a bit difficult but he is determined to get it. Yunior is a hard-working, tenacious young man with a strong will to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas, son personas responsables, honestas y luchadoras con muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. 
a continuacion se detalla cada una de las actividades que ellas realizan:
Lourdes: Es la lider del grupo, cuenta con un bonito negocio de Taller de Costura, hace tres años que tiene su negocio, vive en la Colonia Flor del Campo, cuenta con clientes fijos que le recomiendan a otros, tambien participa en ferias y con esto promociona su negocio, los clientes observan la calidad con que confecciona las prendas, entre ellas son: vestidos para quinceañeras, bodas, vestidos y trajes formales de trabajo entre otros, los fines de semana se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de Sopa de Mondogo y Res. Lourdes es una mujer muy trabajadora y carismatica, necesita el credito para la compra de una Maquina sorgeteadora y variedad de tela. 
Jessica: Se dedica a la Venta de accesorios para damas elaboradas de Plata, se dedica a esta actividades desde hace un año, cuenta con clientas fijas que le realizan pedidos mensuales, tiene  variedad para todos los gustos, como ser pulseras, aritos, cadenas, anillos, necesita que el credito para comprar mas mercaderia, no cuenta con el dinero necesario suficiente para comprar al por mayor. Su esposo es una persona muy luchadora y juntos sacan adelante su familia, esta muy contenta con este negocio ya que le permite estar al cuidado de sus hijos. 
Rosmery:  Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva como ser jeans, camisas, cremas, desodorantes, lociones y otros, actividad que realiza desde hace tres años, vive en la Colonia Flor del Campo. Necesita el creedito para poder comprar variedad de ropa para niños, adultos, accesorios para damas entre otros, es una mujer soltera con muchas ganas de superarse y hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño seria llegar a tener una tienda grande y muchos clientes y amigos.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Unidas" (Women United) is made up of responsible and honest people who are striving to get ahead and improve their quality of life. Their activities are detailed below: Lourdes is the group leader; she has had a sewing workshop for 3 years. She lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood. She has regular customers who recommend her to others. She also participates in the local fairs and in this way she promotes her business. Her customers observe the quality in the garments she produces, including: dresses for quinceañeras (15th birthday galas), wedding dresses, and formal and business dresses and suits. On the weekends she makes the garments and also sells beef soup. Lourdes is a very hardworking and charismatic woman. She needs a loan to buy a serger (a serger is a type of sewing machine that creates the kind of finished seam you see on ready made garments) and a variety of fabric. Jessica sells women's accessories made of silver. She has been carrying out this activity for a year; she has regular customers that put in monthly orders. She has a variety of products for all tastes, including bracelets, earrings, chains and rings. She needs a loan to purchase more merchandise, as she does not have enough money to buy at wholesale. She and her husband struggle to advance their family. She is very pleased with this business, as it allows her to care for her children. Rosmery sells a variety of products including new clothing such as jeans and shirts, creams, deodorants, lotions, and other items. She has been carrying out this activity for 3 years. She lives in the Colonia Flor del Campo neighborhood. She needs a loan to buy a variety of clothing for children and adults, and accessories for women. She is a single woman who has a strong desire to succeed and make her business grow. Her dream is to be able to have a big store with many customers and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a serger (type of sewing machine), fabric, silver earrings, chains, and rings, jeans, shirts, creams, deoderants, perfumes, lotions, and dyes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oscar Bonilla Group

texts.en:
The members of Oscar Bonilla Village Bank are from the city of Linares, an important urban center in the Maule region of central Chile. “Oscar Bonilla” refers to the neighborhood within Linares that the members are from. Maule is a major wine-producing region, and wine is one of the region’s most important exports. Despite the hard-working men and women in the region, Maule continues to be one of the poorest areas of Chile.

The members of this village bank work in various different independent businesses, such as hairstyling, grocery shops, decorative arts and crafts, and the manufacturing and sale of clothing.

Amanda, a member of Oscar Bonilla Village Bank, is pictured in the first row of the photo, towards the left and wearing green. She is a retired arts teacher, and she currently gives a number of specific artisan courses on distinct techniques, such as Bauer style painting, working with clay, wood working, and macramé (decorative knotting).

Amanda plans to invest the loan in the purchase of an awning, which she can use to cover all of her materials to able to present her work more professionally. Her hope is to also have more space from which she can sell her products. For Amanda, Fondo Esperanza has helped her to support and maintain a better quality of life. The rest of the members of this village bank plan to invest their loan in supplies and merchandise, so they can continue growing their businesses and reaching their goals.

loans.use: purchase of an awning to protect her products

loans.name: La Fe 1,2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Aurelia is the coordinator of her group La Fe (The Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana where the economy centers around the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their six children.

Aurelia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans, which she cites having taken for the low interest rates. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling polo shirts, pants and creams by purchasing these items in the main market and then bringing them back to her remote community to sell for a profit. She will use the profits to continue providing for the needs of her large family as well as to continue investing in her business. Her dream is to one day own her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more polo shirts, pants, underwear and creams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three cattle and build a shed

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila B. is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has three children. She raises and feeds animals with the goal of later selling them. This work creates feelings of satisfaction in her because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes feeding the animals and supplying them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and now she guides them into the field each day for feeding. Rahila makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her adorable children.  Rahila is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase more calves. Please support this hardworking woman who has dedicated her life to her children.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan A. has raised animals since he was young. He is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children. Elshan has been in this business for over 20 years. Early every morning he goes to the various grazing fields near where he lives to feed his stock and take them to rivers or nearby lagoons so they can drink water. This takes him all day (until sunset), and he returns home tired from the constant daytime sun and the terrible cold during the afternoon. But he likes his work. Elshan knows he must feed and care for his animals very well. He would like to invest in the purchase of cattle so he can increase the stock of cattle he takes to the market to sell. Elshan is counting on your help. With your support, he can improve his family's life.

loans.use: purchase four calves

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carlos Fonseca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Carlos Fonseca está integrado por cinco personas responsables y trabajadoras. Uno de ellos es Ervin Ernesto L. Pacheco de 37 años quien desde hace tiempo vende CD y en el 2000 logro obtener un tramo en el mercado. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Isabel R. R. quien desde hace siete años vende ropa, Elsa María C. desde hace tres año vende cosméticos, Marisol de los Ángeles desde 1993 tiene una pequeña pulpería y   Paula R. vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Carlos Fonseca Group is composed of 5 responsible and hard-working people. One of them is Ervin Ernesto L., 37 years old, who for some time has sold CDs, and in the year 2000, obtained a stall in the public market. His companions in the group are Isabel R. R., who for 7 years has sold clothing; Elsa María C., who for 3 years has sold cosmetics, Marisol de los Ángeles, who since 1993 has had a small general store, and Paula R., who sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CDs TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase special mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Las Responsables 1, 2 ,3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group Las Responsables (The Responsible Ones), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana which is economically based on the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Maribel is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited about the potential to continue growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a "colmado" or small corner store. She will use the capital to stock her store with rice, cooking oil, beans and refreshments. She will use the profits to invest in her family and to continue growing in the future. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, beans and refreshments for her corner store

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Carla del Socorro M. se dedica a la actividad de elaboración y venta de alimentos en el mercado central de Chinandega donde a diario vende deliciosos platillos a sus clientes que le visitan por ofrecer alimentos de primera calidad. Ella es una dama muy alegre y con muchos deseos de superación en su negocio.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima como lo es arroz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar en su actividad de comidería.
texts.en:
Carla del Socorro M. makes and sells food in the central market in Chinandega. Everyday she sells her delicious dishes to her customers who come to her because she sells top quality food. She is a very happy lady, and she has a great desire to improve in her business. She is currently asking for a loan to buy raw materials like rice, beans, oil, and others. She hopes to be granted the loan; then she will continue with her food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make food

loans.name: Lucrecia Eduviges

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia Eduviges C. se ha destacado por tener su actividad de venta de electrodomésticos. Ella siempre se ha caracterizado por estar en busca de nuevos clientes para ofrecerle los electrodomésticos y así obtener ganancias para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito porque lo invertirá en la compra de algunos electrodomésticos como lo son arroceras, extractores de jugo y planchas. Por tal motivo es que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así logrará sus metas de vender dichos electrodomésticos en el departamento de Chinandega que es donde vive.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Eduviges stands out for selling household appliances from her home. She is characterized as always looking for new customers to sell them electrical appliances. That way she gets income to improve her standard of living and that of her family. She is currently asking for a loan to buy some electrical appliances like rice cookers, juice extractors, and irons. She confidently hopes that she will get the loan. That way she will achieve her goal of selling said appliances in the Chinandega department, which is where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy household appliances to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
A la edad de 28 años, el joven Nelson C. se ha caracterizado por tener su negocio de venta de calzados tanto para damas, caballeros y niños comercializándolos en el mercado central de Chinandega donde a diario le visitan sus clientes para comprar los calzados.
Él es un joven soltero pero tiene dos hijos en edades escolares que mantener y por esta razón busca la manera de salir adelante confiando de que todo le saldrá bien y obtendrá el crédito el que será utilizado directamente para la compra de los zapatos y para la compra de cerámicas y ladrillos para mejorar el local porque se ha expandido y ahora alquila teléfonos para llamadas. De esta manera obtendrá los ingresos para el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de él y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelson Charmorro is a 28 year old young man who is known for having a business selling footwear for women, men, and children. He sells at the central market in Chinandega. His customers visit him there daily to buy footwear. He is single, but he has two school aged children to support. That is the reason he is looking for the way to get ahead. He is confidant that everything will turn out well, and that he will get the loan. He will use it to buy the shoes and to buy tiles and bricks to improve his location. He has expanded, and he now rents out telephones for calls. This way he will get the income to improve his standard of living and that of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Carla Mayela

texts.es:
La señora Carla Pastrana se dedica a trabajar en su negocio propio de venta de bolsos, fajas y gorras siendo ofertados en el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega  donde desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana inicia estas ventas con el propósito de obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
Ella vende los bolsos de diferentes marcas al igual que las gorras y las fajas y esto es lo que atrae a las personas para comprar el producto. El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de la mercadería como lo son dichos bolsos, gorras y fajas para continuar llevando a cabo su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carla Pastrana works in her own business, selling purses, belts, and caps in the Central Market of Chinandega. She starts very early in the morning with the goal of obtaining income to maintain her household. She sells purses of different brands, just as she does with the caps and belts. This is what attracts people to buy her products. The loan she is soliciting will be invested in buying merchandise, including more purses, caps and belts, in order to continue with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY PURSES, BELTS, AND CAPS TO SELL

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
En el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega en el bello país de Nicaragua, la señora Juana N. a sus 79 años de edad ha logrado ser una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada ya que toda la vida ha llevado el sustento a su hogar y se ha destacado por ser muy dedicada en el trabajo ya que a diario ella está trabajando.
Su negocio de venta de ropa actualmente requiere de inversión y por este motivo solicita un crédito para la compra de la ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños y así comercializarla y obtener sus respectivas ganancias. Ella se ha destacado porque tiene varios clientes y son sus sueños continuar desarrollándose en el negocio.
texts.en:
In the central market of Chinandega department in the beautiful country of Nicaragua, señora Juana N., in her 79th year, has become a very hard working woman, since all of her life she has taken care of the maintenance of her home and has excelled at being dedicated at her work, since she does it every day. Her clothing sales business required an investment and for this motive she is seeking a loan for the purchase of clothes for women, men and children, to sell them and obtain the respective earnings. She has achieved this because she has many clients and it is her dream to continue developing the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Ivette Del Rosario

texts.es:
A sus 25 años de edad, la joven Ivette del Rosario se dedica a la actividad de costurera realizando todo tipo de piezas para vestir así como vestidos y camisas. Ella es una joven muy trabajadora y siempre está preocupada por el bienestar de su familia y por ello ha duplicado sus esfuerzos en el negocio.
El crédito que ella está solicitando lo invertirá directamente en la compra de los materiales de trabajo y principalmente la compra de tela para elaborar uniformes escolares porque ya se acerca la temporada de clase donde aprovechará para trabajar con mayor dedicación en la actividad.
texts.en:
At 25 years old, young Ivette del Rosario works as a seamstress, making all types of pieces of clothing, such as dresses and tops. She is a very hard working young woman, and is always worrying about the wellbeing of her family, and for this she has double her efforts in the business. The loan that she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of working materials, principally material to make school uniforms, because the school term is coming when she will take advantage to work with more dedication at the activity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La venta de cosméticos es el negocio al que se dedica la señora María Eleba C. en el departamento de Chinandega donde a diario ofrece sus productos en diferentes lugares ya que visita muchos hogares y empresas ofreciendo dichos cosméticos.

Ella tiene tres hijos a su cargo y en edades escolares por lo que busca la manera de cómo suplir sus necesidades y que ellos salgan adelante desarrollándose. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de los cosméticos tales como perfumes, tintes, cremas y colonias con el fin de comercializarlas y de esta manera continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia por medio de la generación de ingresos del negocio.
texts.en:
The sale of cosmetics is the business carried out by señora María Eleba C., in the Chinandega department where she daily offers her products in different places, visiting many homes and companies offering said cosmetics. She has 3 children in her care, all school age, and for this reason she looks for a way to provide the necessities and help her children develop. The loan will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics such as perfumes, make up, creams and colognes, with a view to selling them and in this way continue improving her living conditions and those of her family through the generation of earnings from the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita tiene 25 años, vive en la compañía de su esposo Félix, de 26 años, y sus dos pequeños e inquietos hijos; Nicole de 6 y Edilson de 3 años. Ellos viven muy felices y con ganas de salir adelante en su casa que es propia.

Desde hace 7 años ayuda a su esposo en la siembra de papa, alverja, olluco y habas. La labor agrícola es un oficio cansado y la carismática Jovita lo sabe muy bien, es por eso que dedica gran parte del día a esta actividad. Desde muy temprano debe vigilar que sus tierras no se echen a perder por plagas u otros motivos, y en la tarde debe regresar a su casa para atender a sus pequeños y cocinar; que dicho sea de paso, lo sabe hacer muy bien, pues prepara todo tipo de comidas, pero su especialidad es la trucha frita (pez de río).
Así transcurren los días de esta trabajadora mujer; en el campo y atendiendo bien a su familia. Jovita sueña en tener un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer sus deliciosos platillos, además quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad para aumentar su productividad y obtener mayores ganancias.

Esta es la novena vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está segura de cumplir con todos sus pagos para no quedar mal ella y no atrasar a su grupo, que está integrado por personas responsables y trabajadoras. Jovita tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes, también comprará semilla de alverja para sembrar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Jovita is 25 years old. She lives with her husband Félix, 26 years old, and their two small, restless children: Nicole, age 6, and Edilson, age 3. They live very happily and with the desire to advance themselves in their home, which is their own.

For 7 years, Jovita has helped her husband in the planting of potatoes, peas, olluco (a tuberous vegetable), and beans. Agricultural labor is tiring work, and the charismatic Jovita knows this very well because she dedicates a large part of each day to this activity. From very early on, she has to watch that her fields don't go bad due to a plague or some other cause, and in the afternoon she has to go back to her house to take care of her little ones and cook, which, incidentally, she knows how to do very well. She prepares all types of food, but her specialty is fried trout.

Thus pass the days of this hard-working woman, in the field and taking good care of her family. Jovita dreams of having a restaurant where she can offer her delicious dishes. In addition, she wants to plant larger quantities to increase her productivity and obtain better earnings.

This is the ninth time that she has had a loan with MFP and she is sure of completing all her payments so as not to give a bad impression and not to set back her group, which is made up of responsible and hard-working people. Jovita is thinking of investing the money she is requesting in the purchase of a number of bags of compost and fertilizer. She will also buy pea seeds to plant in larger quantity.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Desde muy joven a la edad de 12 años, el señor victor T. se ha dedicado a la actividad de tenería o trabajo en el procesamiento del cuero el que sirve para diferentes funciones como elaboración de zapatos, fajas, bolsos, carteras, protectores de muebles, entre otros.
Actualmente él tiene su propio negocio de tenería donde a diario procesa el cuero y luego lo ofrece a posibles compradores que adquieren el producto para fines a su trabajo.
El crédito lo utilizará para la compra del cuero y para los materiales de trabajo para llevar a cabo su respectivo procesamiento y así darle un eficiente acabado de alta calidad y listo para ofrecerlo a sus compradores.
texts.en:
Since he was very young, at the age of twelve, Mr. Victor has been tanning leather or has worked with processing leather. The leather is used in many different ways such as in making shoes, belts, purses, wallets, covers for furniture, or other uses. Presently he has his own tanning business where he daily processes leather and then offers it to buyers who use his product to their finished work. He will use the loan to buy leather and materials used in the tanning process. In this way he can complete his work in a timely manner, offer a high quality product and have it ready to offer to his buyers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy leather.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas está integrado por tres féminas trabajadoras, responsables y con deseos de auto superarse. Una de ellas es Vilma Mairena C. de 50 años quien vende cosméticos y comida.

Esta señora educo y crio a todos sus hijos de los cuales solo las dos menores tiene con ella las cuales trabajan y estudian. Por otra parte sus hijos e hijas casadas la ayudan en el negocio especialmente en la venta de cosméticos.

Mientras Yolanda del Carmen B. R. vende cosmético con lo cual se ayuda para mantener a sus dos hijos y Lidia V. tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The Unidas group consists of three working women who are responsible and want to set their sights higher. One of the women is Vilma Mairena C., 50 years old, who sells cosmetics and food. This woman educated and raised all her children; she has only the two youngest with her now, and they work and go to school. Her sons and married daughters help her in the business, especially in the sale of cosmetics. Yolanda del Carmen B. R. sells cosmetics; her business helps support her two children. Lidia V. has a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, ingredients to make food and staple grains

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
A sus 63 años Francisco es agricultor de oficio, vive con 2 de sus 14 hijos, que son el motivo de su sacrificio, a pesar de su edad. Ellos son Olivia de 9 y Diógenes de 20 años, además lo acompaña su esposa Brígida de 57 años, juntos viven en su acogedora casa, que es propia, y está ubicada en una apacible zona de la sierra peruana. 

Aparte de sembrar oca, papa, olluco, habas, cebada y coliflor (productos comestibles naturales de la sierra), ahora desea sembrar alverja en esta época, como lo ha realizado en años anteriores con la ayuda de su amada Brígida y sus hijos, con quienes vive y le ayudan en sus ratos libres. 
Para Francisco lo más hermoso de cultivar la tierra es ver florecer sus productos y saber que serán de calidad, luego de interminables días de esfuerzo los podrá vender a buen precio con la experiencia que tiene en cosechas anteriores. Las ganancias obtenidas serán provechosas para seguir sosteniendo a su familia, además tiene en mente empezar a sembrar en otras chacras que dejó de lado por falta de dinero y así podrá aumentar su producción para las próximas cosechas.

Este es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP, según refiere, lo mejor de esta oportunidad es que ha logrado conseguir sus objetivos y trabajar en su organizado banco comunal donde es muy querido por los demás integrantes por su puntualidad y responsabilidad en los pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de alverja y fertilizantes para la tierra, asegurándose en obtener un buen producto para ofrecerlo al mercado.
texts.en:
At 63 years old, Francisco is a farmer by trade. He lives with 2 of his 14 children, who are the motivation for his sacrifice, in spite of his age. They are Olivia, 9 years old, and Diógenes, 20 years old. In addition, his wife Brigida, 57 years old, lives together with him in his cozy house, which is his own and is located in a pleasant area of the Peruvian highlands.

Besides planting oca and olluco (tuberous vegetables), potatoes, beans, barley, and cauliflower (food products native to the highlands), he would now like to plant peas this season, as he has done in past years with the help of his beloved wife Brigid and his children, who live with him and help him in their free time. For Francisdo, the most beautiful part of cultivating the land is seeing his products flourish and knowing that they will be of good quality. After endless days of effort, he will be able to sell them at a good price, based on his experience of previous harvests. The earnings obtained will useful to continue supporting his family. Furthermore, he has it in mind to begin to plant other fields that he left aside for lack of money, and thus he will be able to increase his production for the next harvests.

This is his ninth loan from MFP. As he relates, the best part of this opportunity to receive loans is succeeding in achieving his objectives and working with his organized community bank, where he is much loved by the other members for his punctuality and responsibility in making payments. The money that he is seeking will be invested in the purchase of pea seeds and fertilizers for his land, assuring that he will obtain a good product to offer to the market.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Desde hace 17 años en el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega, la señora María Auxiliadora M. se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de embases plásticos los que son ofertados en su propio establecimiento donde los vende a diferentes precios de acuerdo al tamaño.
Es importante destacar que hoy en día se le están agotando los embases por lo que debe de realizar compras para continuar ofertándolos y por esta razón es que ella muy satisfecha acude a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada con el crédito y así realizar la compra de los embases plásticos para obtener los ingresos. Estos embases son muy útiles para almacenar agua, refrescos y cualquier liquido.
texts.en:
For 17 years, Señora María Auxiliadora M. has had a business selling plastic containers in the central market of Chinandega. She sells them in her own shop at different prices according to their size. It is important to emphasize that she is now running out of the plastic containers, so she needs to make purchases to be able to continue offering them for sale. For this reason, she is very satisfied to go to CEPRODEL, hoping to be granted the loan and thus realize the purchase of more plastic containers to obtain income. These containers are very useful for storing water, sodas, or any liquid.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic containers for her business

loans.name: Pastora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pastora está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Mercedes de la Concepción S. M. quien desde los 16 años tiene una Fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos. 

Está señora con las ganancias mantiene a sus cuatro hijos menores de edad los cuales pronto ingresaran nuevamente a clases.

La señora Martha Lorena M. M. de 26 años en el 2000 con la comercialización de granos básicos y Cordalia M. de 31 años vende frescos y enchiladas.
texts.en:
The Group "Pastora" is made of three hard working women. One of them is Mercedes de la Concepción S. M., who since 16 has had a Fritanga, a popular restaurant that sells fried foods. With the earnings, she can support her 4 young children who will soon return to school. Ms. Martha Lorena M. M. is 26 years old. In 2000, she started selling basic grains and Cordalia M., 31 years old sells drinks and enchiladas.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients like basic grains, meat, vegetables, legumes…etc

loans.name: Quesillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo quesillo está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras ellas son Rosa Carolina L. quien vende ropa, Anielka P. M. tiene una pulpería y Gladis María V. José tiene una modesta tortillería.

Ellas son tres señoras que desde muy jóvenes han aprendido a ganarse el pan de cada día y que han luchado mucho por el bienestar de sus hijos. Estas invertirán el crédito para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Quesillo" group is made up of three, hard-working, women: Rosa Carolina L., who sells clothing; Anielka P. M., who has a small grocery store, and Gladis María V. José, who has a modest tortilla shop. They are three women who learned from a very early age how to earn their daily bread and have struggled mightily for their children's well-being. They will use the funds to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Nuevo Oriente Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Oriente está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras que han laborado desde muy jóvenes. Una de ellas es Rosa Virginia F. quien se dedica a hacer sartenes con la ayuda de su esposo y un nieto que vive con ellos.

Por su parte Ángela S. vende dulces, chiverías y tortillas, Ana Paulina C. vende cosméticos y Elivee Torrez M. vende perfumes de la Avon y prendas de oro laminado de la graco.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Oriente" group is made up of four, hard-working, women who have worked from a very young age. One of them is Rosa Virginia F., who manufactures frying pans with her husband's help and the help of her grandson, who lives with them. Ángela S., on the other hand, sells candies, tortillas and yoghurt snacks. Elivee Torrez M. sells Avon products and Graco gold-plated jewelry items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal.

loans.name: Verónica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Verónica está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que salen todos los días desde tempranas horas a comercializar su producto para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. 

Yanett G. de 23 años tiene dos pequeños uno de ocho años y otro de tres los cuales son su aliciente para salir a vender perfumes a las calles de Managua.

Mientras Lisveth del Socorro M. R. de 27 años vende ropa y zapatos por encargo y Arlen Yesenia Medrano Avellan vende ropa.
texts.en:
The "Verónica" group is made up of three, hard-working women who go out very early in the morning every day to sell their products in order to provide their children with a better future. Yanett G., 23, has two youngsters; one, who is 8 years old, and one who is three. They are her motivation to go out into Managua's steets to sell perfumes. Lisveth del Socorro M. R., 27, sells clothing and shoes on order. Arlen Yesenia Medrano Avellan sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 41 años, es madre de cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de tortas y dulces.  Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas y su esposo, quien es chofer de un motocarro propio. Lidia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Doncellas”, desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en productos de belleza.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido una parte en productos de belleza y otra parte en la compra de tortas y dulces para vender. La meta de Lidia es tener una distribuidora de dulces.
texts.en:
Lidia is a very dynamic woman. She lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She is 41 years old and a mother of four, three of which are already grown up. She sells beauty products and also cakes and sweets. She has her daughters' and her husband's support. He works as a driver with a three-wheeler of his own. Lidia has been part of the Communal Bank "Las Doncellas" ["The Maidens"] for 5 years. Her first loan was 500 PEN which she invested in beauty products. Now she needs a 1,000 PEN loan which will be invested partly in the purchase of beauty products and partly in the purchase of cakes and sweets to sell. Lidia's goal is to have her own sweets distribution wholesale business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: beauty products and cakes and sweets

loans.name: Sobeyda Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Sobeyda Elvira O. M. desde hace ocho años vende artesanías de manera ambulante en el Salvador. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de guallaveras, sombreros, bolsos y batas que luego comercializara.
 
O. inicio con este negocio en primer lugar por el deseo de auto superarse y de darles una mejor vida a sus hijos en esa búsqueda empezó a emigrar pero lo que ella más desea  es poder tener su negocio en Nicaragua.

Esta señora de 41 años tiene como tres años de trabajar con adim pero el año pasado se ausento un largo tiempo por problemas de salud los cuales ya supero. Ella actualmente está muy feliz porque su hijo de 17 años este año ingresa a la universidad y su pequeña cumplirá 15 años.
texts.en:
Sobeyda Elvira O. M., 41, has been a handicrafts peddler for 8 years in El Salvador. She will use the funds to buy guayaberas (lightweight man's shirt with pockets and sometimes tucks or embroidery, worn outside trousers), hats, purses, and coats to sell. O. started this business based on her desire to get ahead and to provide her children with a better life. With this goal in mind, she considered emigrating but, what she wants most, is to have a business in Nicaragua. She has collaborated with Adim for about three years but last year she dropped out for a long time due to health problems, which she has since overcome. She is very happy because her 17-year-old son begins university and her youngest daughter will have her 15th birthday.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es:
El señor José Benjamín A. S., se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como cultivo de frijol y maíz, razón para la cual utiliza este financiamiento. para comprar insumos ( 2 quintales de abono, herbicidas, y mano de obra para preparación del suelo y siembra de frijol de riego), este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos como frijol y maíz únicamente en épocas de invierno y ahora lo hace con sistema de riego, este trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de un hijo el mayor  de sus 5 hijos que él tiene los otros 4 hijos son menores de edad pero si ayudan por ejemplo la madre cocina en casa y los hijos menores llevan la comida al campo o lugar de trabajo, este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo sembrando frijol y maíz semitecnificado, con esto el espera seguir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y poder llegar a producir más y mejor algo que le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos permitiéndole alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida más digna.
Don José Benjamín A. S. es casado, tiene 5 hijos dos están en la escuela únicamente, su esposa trabaja en su casa encargándose de hacer los oficios  de su hogar como es cuidar de hijos menores preparar alimentos para los que van a trabajar al campo y los demos miembros del hogar, don José ha tenido 8 créditos  desde el año 2005 lleva 5 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos lo que le ha permitido que sus hijos puedan estudiar y tener mayores oportunidades en sus vidas.
texts.en:
José Benjamín A. S. farms beans and corn. He will use this funding to buy supplies [2 quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of natural fertilizer, herbicides, and labor costs to prepare his fields for planting beans]. He began planting beans and corn only in the Winter season but now, he has an irrigation system. The eldest of his 5 sons helps him with his work; his other 4 children are all minors but they also help out; for example, they help their mother in the kitchen and the youngest children help out by taking lunch out to the fields or other work locations. This client has always been a farmer and he still continues to grow beans and corn though now with some degree of technical assistance. He hopes to continue to improve his work and produce more and better crops so that his income will increase thereby attaining a better quality of life. José Benjamín A. S. is married and has 5 children, two of whom are full-time students. His wife is a housewife taking care of household chores like caring for the younger children, preparing meals for those that will go work the fields and for the other family members. José has had 8 previous loans since 2005 and has cooperated with Ceprodel for 5 years. The impact and benefit of these loans has been quite important in that they permitted him to improve his field activities resulting in an improved economic level which, in turn, has allowed for his children to go to school and have still better opportunities in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies: 2 quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of natural fertilizer, herbicides, and for labor costs to prepare his lands for planting.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Dina es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 7 años atrás, vive en el distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.

Dina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y comprar más carne.

Con este crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles podrá comprar carne de: alpaca, cerdo y ovino.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar  su mercadería  y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son  las reuniones con las socias y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Ms. Dina has been a member of the Communal Bank "Generación 2000" ["Generation 2000"] for 7 years. She lives in the district of Santa Rosa, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 26 years old, she is married and has one son. She studied until the 5th year of secondary education and she deals in meat. Dina tells us that with the first loan she requested from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos [Manuela Ramos Movement], 300 PEN, she was able to increase her working capital and purchase more meat. With this loan of 2,000.00 PEN she will be able to purchase alpaca, pork and sheep meat. Her dream for the future is to augment her merchandise and thus make progress with her family. What she likes best from her Communal Bank are the meetings with the other members and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat: sheep, beef, alpaca, pork

loans.name: Deida

texts.es:
Deida, es una socia nueva, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 44 años, es madre de tres hijos, dos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida típica de la región, esta actividad la realiza en la vereda de su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a la venta de madera. Deida forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Ucayali”.
Ella necesita un crédito de 200 soles, que será invertido en productos como arroz, aceite y otros productos que utiliza en la preparación de los platos típicos como el juane, patarashca y tacacho con cecina.	   
La meta de Deida es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Deida is a new member of the Communal Bank "Las Brisas del Ucayali" ["The Breezes from the Ucayali"]. She lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She is 44 years old and a mother of three, two of which are grown up. She sells typical food from the region from the sidewalk by her home. She has her husband's support, who sells wood. She needs a 200 PEN loan, which will be invested in the purchase of products like rice, oil, and other supplies she uses in the elaboration of typical dishes such as juane [rice, hen's meat, olives, boiled eggs and spices, which are enveloped in a leaf of bijao and boiled for around 90 minutes], patarashca [a whole fish, enveloped in bijao leaf and charcoal-grilled] and tacacho con cecina [a mass of roasted green banana, chorizo or jerky, oil, lard, salt and pepper, served with grilled jerky]. Deida's goal is to own a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cooking supplies

loans.name: Francisca Evelia

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Francisca Evelia Rodríguez tiene 48 años de edad, es casada con 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, esta microempresaria quien es profesora y también se dedica a vender joyas de plata desde hace un poco mas de dos años. Este negocio le permite tener algunos ingresos para los gastos del hogar.

La microempresaria Rodríguez tiene como principales clientes a mujeres amas de casa y que trabajan en instituciones del estado y privadas a quienes les oferta sus productos con facilidades de pago en varias cuotas. Este negocio es rentable, sin embargo se tiene que contar con un buen capital para poder comprar mayor volúmenes de los productos y recuperarlos en tres o cuatro meses.

Por tal razón la señora Rodríguez requiere se le financie para comprar las siguientes prendas de plata:

10 Unidades de anillo ojos de tigre le cuesta US  8 cada unidad, 10 unidades de anillos de piedra Onix el cual compra a US  8 cada unidad, 8 pares de aretes circulares grandes a US 13 cada par, 6 unidades de brazaletes decorados los que compra a US 6 cada unidad, 9 unidades de pulseras de animalitos a US 10 cada unidad, 8 unidades de pulseras de corazón a US 9 cada unidad, 8 unidades de cadenas de pelota a US 14 cada unidad, 8 juegos de gargantillas y aretes a US 15 cada juego y 8 unidades de pulseras de pie a US 7 cada unidad.
texts.en:
Francisca Evelia Rodríguez, 48, is married and has 3 adult children. She is a teacher but she has also sold silver jewelry for a little over two years now. This side business produces extra income for household expenses. Her main customers are housewives that work in State or private industry ofices to whom she offers her wares on easy installment payment plans. This is a profitable business but she must have reliable capital available in order to buy her products in quantity so that she can recouperate her costs in 3 or 4 months. For this reason she requires funding to buy the following silver jewelry items: 10 tiger-eye rings at US 8 dollars each, 10 onyx rings at US 8 dollars each, 8 pairs of large, circular earrings at US 13 dollars each, 6 decorated bracelets at US 6 dollars each, 9 animal charm bracelets at US 10 dollars each, 8 heart bracelets at US 9 dollars each, 8 ball chains at US 14 dollars each, 8 sets of necklace and earrings at US 15 dollars a set, and 8 anklets at US 7 dollars each.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted silver jewelry.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito D. Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 55 años, es madre D. seis hijos, cinco mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, quien es trabajador D. una fábrica D. triplay. Genoveva forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevas Amigas”, desD. hace siete años.
El primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta D. golosinas, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 2000 soles, que será invertido en la compra D. prendas D. vestir. La meta D. Genoveva es tener una tienda D. abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a very dynamic woman. She lives in the Callería district, in the Ucayali region. She is 55 years old and the mother of 6 children, 5 of whom are adults. She sells clothing out of her home and has support from her husband, who works in a plywood factory. Genoveva has been a member of Communal Bank "Nuevas Amigas" for seven years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles which she used to sell candy. She now needs a loan of 2000 soles which will be used to buy clothing. Genoveva's goal is to have a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Yader Antonio

texts.es: El señor Yader Antonio S. L., se dedica a las actividades de trabajo de campo al cultivo de granos básicos frijol y maíz, también al cuido de ganado, este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de media manzana de terreno con condiciones para el cultivo de granos como frijol y maíz, el tiene una parte de dienro con el financiamiento ajustara para la compra de este terreno, Yader S. L. comenzó a trabajar con el apoyo de sus padres quienes le dieron como herencia una pequeña propiedad de ½ manzana de terreno donde hiso su casa para vivir con su esposa desde entonces comenzó  con esfuerzo propio y financiamientos por parte de Ceprodel a cultivar granos básicos como frijol y maíz únicamente en épocas de invierno, todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a este tipo de trabajo teniendo experiencia ya que antes él le ayudaba a sus padres al trabajo de campo. El señor Yader S. L. es casado y tiene una hija menor de edad, únicamente su esposa es quien le ayuda a las labores de trabajo. El señor Yader tiene 4 años de trabajar con el apoyo de Ceprodel y el impacto que ha tenido es bastante bueno porque con los financiamientos que él ha recibido a comprado 3 manzanas de tierras lo que le ha permitido tener mas aéreas para cultivar este grano que es un rubro muy importante en nuestra economía y de esta forma ha venido mejorando su forma de vivir.
texts.en:
Yader Antonio S. L. farms beans and corn; he also raises cattle. He will use this funding to buy land suitable for planting beans and corn. He has part of the money already and the financing will make up the difference. Yader S. L. started farming with the support of his parents, who willed him a small, 1/2-manzana (about 0.8 acre), plot of land where he built his house and where he has lived with his wife ever since. He began with his own efforts and financial help from Ceprodel to grow beans and corn only during the Winter. He has always been in this line of work since he got experience in it helping his parents. He is married and has one minor daughter; his wife helps him with his work. He has cooperated with Ceprodel for about 4 years and the impact this has had has been very good because the loans have allowed him to buy 3 manzanas of land. This has allowed for larger cultivation area of this basic grain that is such an integral part of our economy. This has meant a better way of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es:
Lelis, de 44 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Epifanio, de 45 años; y está dispuesta a trabaja muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Su negocio es la venta de productos andinos, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado más importante del poblado de Cabanillas (Distrito de la ciudad de Juliaca) donde vende papa, quinua, oca, etc. Ella pasa todo el día en espera de que sus clientes le compren los productos que vende, es muy alegre, por lo cual su puesto es siempre muy concurrido.
A su vez, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto cuidándolo. 
Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Lelis con MFP y está dispuesta a separar una parte de las ganancias del día para pagar el crédito sin problemas. En su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que le da alegría a las demás socias. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Lelis, 44, is a cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Epifanio, 45. She is prepared to work hard to improve her quality of life. She sells Andean products. Her stall is located in one of the town of Cabanillas's (Juliaca district) most important markets. She sells potatoes, quinoa, oca (a type of yam), etc. She spends all day waiting for her customers to buy her products; she is very cheerful so her stall is always crowded. In addition, what she most enjoys about her work is chatting with her neighbor sellers and finding out everything that goes on in the market. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to stay watching over her stall all day. For later in the future, she hopes her business will grow and produce higher income. This is her first loan with MFP. She is willing to set aside a part of her daily profits to repay the loan comfortably. She is very well-liked in her communal bank because she cheers up the other members. The 800 new soles requested will be used to increase the amount of merchandise she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco, de 23 años, es un joven muy trabajador y sincero, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
Con la ayuda que le brindaron sus padres, pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios e implementar una tienda donde vende todo tipo de productos. Aunque es muy joven, es conciente que tiene una responsabilidad con sus padres y es por eso que trabaja sin descanso, ya que anhela darles una vida digna y feliz.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y más si es a clientes conocidos, ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos hasta su tienda, pero sabe que es parte de su labor. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar su tienda y hacerla más grande, para así poder vender sus productos de manera más cómoda, brindando una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo de Marco con MFP y espera no tener problemas en el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy querido, pues siempre llega muy puntual. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para mejorar su tienda.
texts.en:
Marco, who is 23 years old, is a very hard working and sincere young man. He lives in his own house and what he wants most is to standout in life. With the help of his parents, he was able to finish secondary school and set up a store where he sells all types of products. Although he is very young, he is conscious that he has a responsibility to his parents and because of this he works without resting and he yearns to give them a decent and happy life. What he likes most about his work selling and more than that, getting to know his customers. He already has been in this business 5 years and he considers moving the products from his store the hardest thing, but he knows that is part of his job. For the future he hopes to grow his store and make it bigger. He would then be able to sell his products more comfortably, giving his customers better attention. This is Marco's first loan with MFP and he hopes he won't have problems paying his installments. Within his communal bank is much loved and he always arrives very punctually. With the thousand nuevos soles is asking for, he plans to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to improve his store.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase of merchandise

loans.name: Lesbia Elisalda

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Lesbia Elisalda B. P. tiene 39 años de edad, es casada con 4 hijos quienes viven con ella y desde hace 6 años se dedica a vender ropa usada en un barrio comercial de esta ciudad de Bluefields y de esta forma ayuda en los ingresos de la casa ya que su marido trabaja como cadete de taxi y los ingresos no siempre son los mejores.

La señora B. ya ha sido beneficiada anteriormente con dos prestamos de kiva los cuales a cancelado en tiempo y forma, aprovecha a la vez para agradecer a los prestamistas que entregaron el dinero para poder ella invertirlo en su negocio los cuales le han ayudado a tener mayores productos y mejorar sus ventas. A la vez se compromete de antemano pagar este nuevo préstamo para poder seguir optando en futuras ocasiones a otros.

Solicita financiamiento para comprar las siguientes pacas de ropa:

1 Paca de ropa usada para niños le cuesta US 200 la paca, 2 pacas de pantalones blue jeans le cuesta la paca US 150 y 2 pacas de sabanas a US 125 cada paca.
texts.en:
Lesbia Elisalda B. P. is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children who live with her. For 6 years she has sold used clothing in a commercial neighborhood in the city of Bluefields. In this way she helps with the household income, since her husband works as a taxi driver and his income is not always the best. Señora B. has previously received 2 Kiva loans which were paid off on time and in full. She would like to take this opportunity to thank the lenders who provided the money so that she could invest in her business, as they helped her to get better products and increase her sales. At the same time she pledges in advance to pay back this new loan, so that she will continue to have the option of taking other loans in the future. She requests financing to buy the following: 1 bale of used children's clothing that costs $200 per bale, 2 bales of blue jeans that cost $150 per bale, and 2 bales of bed sheets at US $125 per bale.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bales of used children's clothing, pants and bed sheets

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz, de 25 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Edgar, de 25 años, y con su pequeño hijo Edu de 6 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

En una de las calles más importantes del poblado de Cabanillas, Mariluz tiene su puesto. Su actividad es la venta de gelatina con leche batida, el cual es un postre muy delicioso, motivo por el cual es muy solicitado por sus clientes, quienes no pueden evitar comerse más de uno. 
Ella ya tiene una reputación ganada y es por eso que se esfuerza mucho en la elaboración de su delicioso postre.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes mientras saborean la gelatina con leche batida, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo los inclementes rayos solares todos los días. Pero aún así, desea trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante su negocio.

Este es el primer préstamo de Mariluz con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en todas sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para elaborar su delicioso postre.
texts.en:
Mariluz is 25 years old and is the mother of a family. She is very affectionate and hardworking. She lives in a rented house together with her husband Edgar, who is also 25 years old, and her young son Edu who is 6 years. Edu is the reason for all of their hard work. In one of the most important streets in the village of Cabanillas, Mariluz has her stall. She sells gelatin with whipped milk, which is a very delicious dessert and is in high demand from her customers who can't avoid eating more than one. She has already gained a reputation and it is because of this that she puts so much effort into making the delicious dessert. What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers while they savor the dessert. She has been in the business for 2 years and finds the most difficult thing is staying under the harsh rays of the sun all day. But despite this, she wants to work really hard to take her business forward. This is Mariluz's first loan with MFP and she hopes to be very punctual with all her payments since she doesn't want to give problems to her communal bank which she is very happy with. With the five hundred nuevos soles she is asking for Mariluz will buy more ingredients for making her delicious dessert.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make her desserts

loans.name: Valerie

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Valerie S. N. tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija la cual actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la universidad y desde hace mas de 30 años la señora S. se dedica a impartir clases como profesora.

Esta profesora desde hace dos años a estado administrando un centro de bachillerato por madurez, el cual consiste en formar a personas adultas en niveles de bachillerato, este centro es intensivo y se da los días domingo y tiene demanda partiendo que los alumnos son trabajadores que no tienen tiempo de estudiar en los otros días de la semana.

Sin embargo el gobierno esta solicitando a través del ministerio de educación algunos requisitos mínimos como lo son que los estudiantes tengan acceso a la tecnología, por lo que la profesora S. necesita se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:


Una computadora que esta valorada en US 450 dólares y una impresora que esta valorada en US 250 dólares.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Valerie S. N. is 59 years old. She is a single mother. She has a daughter who is now studying at the university, and for 30 years, Señora S. has been giving classes as a teacher.

For two years, she has been administrator of an adult education center, which educates adults through the completion of secondary school. The classes at this center are intensive and are given on Sundays. There is demand because the students are workers who do not have time to study the other days of the week.

However, the government is requesting through the ministry of education some minimum requirements, such as the students having access to technology. For this reason, Señora S. needs to be financed to buy the following: a computer that is valued at US $450 and a printer that is valued at US $250.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, es una socia muy puntual, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 55 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas refrescantes, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es trabajador de la Municipalidad. Marina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevas Amigas”, desde hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de bebidas refrescantes.
