Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será reinvertido en la venta de bebidas refrescantes. La meta de Marina es tener una fuente de soda bien implementado que le permita generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marina is a very punctual member. She lives in the Callería district in the Ucayali region. She is 55, and she has three grown and independent children. She sells cold drinks in her house. She has her husband’s support; he works for the municipality. Marina has been part of the Nuevas Amigas Communal Bank for six years. She bought cold drinks with her first loan for 300 PEN. Now she needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy cold drinks. Marina’s goal is to have a well equipped soda fountain, which would allow her to generate greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cold drinks to sell

loans.name: Gloria Yovana

texts.es:
La señorita Gloria  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 6 año atrás, del distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Se dedica a la compra y venta de lencería.
Gloria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar ropa interior al por mayor como: medias, trusas, brasieres, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es ampliar su negocio a otros rubros. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Gloria has been a member of the Santa Bárbara 2 Communal Bank for six years. It is in the Chucuito district in the Puno province and department. She is 25, single, and does not have children. She buys and sells lingerie. She tells us that she used her first loan for 500 PEN from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She will ask for a loan for 1,500 PEN to be able to buy wholesale lingerie like hosiery, underwear, and bras, etc. Her dream for the future is to increase her business to include other items. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hosiery, bras, and underwear

loans.name: Josefa Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 7 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene 04 hijos, 2 de ellos son independientes. Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa.

Josefa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ahora requiere un crédito  de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar ropa al por mayor.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de ropa en Tacna.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Josefa has been a member of the Generación 2000 Communal Bank for seven years. It is in the Santa Rosa district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 48, married, and has four children. Two of them are independent. She has an elementary school education. She buys and sells clothes. Josefa tells us that she was able to increase her capital with her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement for 300 PEN. She now needs a loan for 3,000 PEN, which she would use to buy wholesale clothes. Her dream for the future is to have a clothing store in Tacna. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Milagro De Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. Milagro de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 39 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Milagro de Jesús, lleva  04 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos y sabanas, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su pequeño taller de costura y teniendo habilidad  para este tipo de actividad, no dudo en hacerlo y gracias al apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, logro implementarlo y que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa, para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Milagro de Jesús, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Milagro de Jesús belongs to the Esmeralda Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 39, single, and she has three dependent children. Milagro de Jesús has been making clothing and sheets for four years. Little by little, she has been generating her own income and saving her money. She wanted to set up a small seamstress shop. Having the skill for this type of work, she had no doubt in doing so. Thanks to the support from the Manuela Ramos Movement, she was able to set it up. The shop is in her house in an area that is very well equipped to wait on her customers. She tells us that her sales are going very well. She works on advance orders from her customers. She currently continues with the same business. She has loyal customers who come to her house everyday for her work and orders. She personally waits on them with her characteristic kindness. She will use this loan for 2,500 PEN to buy meters of different types of fabric and instruments that she uses like scissors, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Milagro de Jesús now feels like a fulfilled woman, and she has a great desire to make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and also for helping a lot of women who want to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 5 años atrás (reingresante), del distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la artesanía.

Irma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio y seguir progresando. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Irma has been a member of Communal Bank "Santa Bárbara 2" for 5 years (re-joined), in the district of Chucuito, Province and State of Puno. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. She completed primary school and sells handicrafts. Irma tells us that with the first loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 300 soles, she increased her capital. She is requesting a loan for 500 soles which she will use to purchase baize and wool wholesale. Her dream for the future is to improve her business and continue progressing. What she likes best about her Communal Bank are the savings and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baize and wool

loans.name: Afras

texts.en: Afras A. has a great passion for breeding sheep and has been in this business for thirteen years. He is 36 years old and married, with two children. Afras would like to expand his business by adding more sheep to his herd. This is because he recently acquired out-of-town orders to supply mutton. Afras is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN in order to buy twelve sheep and fodder. With additional income, Afras will be better able to meet his family's financial needs and especially to provide for the education of his children.

loans.use: Purchase additional sheep and fodder

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La Sra. Manuela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos en las fueras de su casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 6:00pm. Lleva aun poco tiempo trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Manuela, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Manuela belongs to the Esmeralda Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, Region of San Martin. She is single, forty-two years old and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom she still supports and are in school. The fighting spirit that she has always had and the desire to get ahead using her own means have been valuable to her in starting her own business selling anticuchos (meat skewers) outside of her home. Little by little she has become more well-known among her customers and today she tells us that this type of work is going very well for her. She begins selling every day starting at 6:00pm. Although she has not been doing this type of work for very long, she feels very content with it. With this loan of 2000 soles, Manuela will buy supplies like bags of rice, eggs, chickens for her tamales and butchered chicken for her anticuchos (meat skewers), as well as cooking utensils in order to offer quality service to her customers. Manuela feels very happy and peaceful in her work and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to fulfill her dreams and her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
La Sra. Yrma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años  y es madre D. 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.

Su carácter y su anhelo D. cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desD. su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa. Hoy en día, cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa, a comprar porque en ella encuentran todo los productos que el ama D. casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atienD.  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Yrma, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Yrma belongs to the Esmeralda Comunal Bank in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, Region of San Martin. She is married, is 50 years old and has 2 children who she still supports. Her character and her desire to fulfill her dreams motivated her to launch her own business selling groceries, with whose profits she contributes to the household income. From when she started until today, Yrma has been gaining customers. Her business is located in her house. Today, Yrma has many regular customers who come to her house daily to make purchases, because there they find all the products that a housewife needs and someone who waits on them personally with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of 2,500 soles, she will buy bags of rice and sugar, crackers, noodles, packets of salt, milk and boxes of various brands of canned fish, cartons of eggs and personal hygiene products, in order to continue giving the best service to her customers. Yrma is very happy to continue working and is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women like her to have opportunities to develop in the areas in which they work.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to expand her products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 ya son independientes.

Martha Elizabeth, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió implementar su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 100.00 y empezó comprando 07 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Martha Elizabeth, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Martha Elizabeth belongs to the Esmeralda Communal Bank, Tarapoto District, San Martín Province and Department. She is married, is 42 years old and is the mother of three children who are now grown. Martha Elizabeth is a hard-working and determined woman, so she decided to start her own business selling soft drinks in a well air-conditioned space, located in her own house. She runs the business herself, without a fixed schedule or a boss. She tells us that she began with 100.00 soles and began by buying 7 cases of soft drinks. She saw that it went very well for her, so little by little she began investing more. Today she continues with the same business and is now well-known to her customers, who are her neighbors, relatives and friends. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, she will buy more drinks like: cases of soft drinks in different flavors, sizes and brands, as well as carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Martha Elizabeth is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva's field partner) for helping her when she needed it most. She is responsible with her payments and expects to keep being so.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 41 años, 01 hijo que aun estudia y depende de ella.

Rosa, es una mujer trabajadora, que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas y sueños, hace varios años, que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, siempre contando con el apoyo de su pareja. Y con su primer préstamo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, le brindo; implemento mucho más su negocio, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado. Hoy en la actualidad ya cuenta con  mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Esmeralda Communal Bank, Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, San Martín Department. She has a live-in partner, is 41 years old, and has 1 child who still studies and is dependent on her. Rosa is a hard-working woman who feels capable of reaching her goals and dreams. Several years ago she began to sell groceries, always counting on her partner's support. And with the first loan that the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva's field partner) gave her, she greatly expanded her business, located in her own house, a very well air-conditioned space. She now has a lot of experience with this type of activity and is very well-known and loved by her customers. She has a very loyal customer base. They come daily to shop at her store, where they expect to find everything a housewife needs, and she personally assists them with the charisma that characterizes her. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, milk and several brands of canned fish, housecleaning tools and personal hygiene products to continue giving better service to her customers. Rosita, as she is affectionately known, feels very fulfilled and desires to go on to make her dreams reality. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and also for helping many women who want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to supply her business

loans.name: Victoria Lili

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria Lili, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Victoria Lili, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos y lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, y cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria Lili, 36, is a member of the “Esmeralda” communal bank, which is in the Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She has two children who still are dependent on her. Victoria Lili, as she is affectionately called, sells anticuchos (grilled meats on skewers). She has been in this line of work for several years; she tends to her customers in her own home in an area that is set up for this purpose. She tells us that her daily sales are good because her dishes are very tasty; she is well-known and well-liked. She continues in this line of work and she is very happy with her daily tasks. She, herself, tends to her customers with her characteristic good humor and charisma. She will use the 3000 sol loan to buy ingredients for her meals like: kilos of rice, liters of cooking oil, crates of chickens, vegetables as well as some utensils to provide better customer service. She feels full of life and the will to continue forging ahead; she has many dreams and goals in life like setting up her own, well-stocked and equipped grocery store. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora FELICITAS, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia trabaja en el mercado de Túpac Amaru, ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 40 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, 4 de ellos son mayores y cada uno es independiente y tiene su propia familia, nuestra socia vive con 2 de sus hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, ella trabaja en el mercado vendiendo frutas, nuestra socia es natural de la provincia de Sicuani, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, nuestra socia alterna el cuidado de sus hijos y otras responsabilidades del hogar con el comercio de frutas al por menor, ella solicita el préstamo debido a que deberá incrementar su negocio y comprar al por mayor frutas de los proveedores. 

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicitas is a member of the “United Women” Community Bank. She works in the Tupac Amaru market located in the San Sabastîan District, in Cusco. Our member is forty years old, has a partner and five children. Three of the children are adults and each one of them is independent and has their own family. Our member lives with two of her children, ages 5 and 3 years. She works in the market selling fruit. Our member is from the province of Sicuani, located three hours from the city of Cusco. Our member divides her time between caring for her children and her business of selling fruit as a retailer. She is asking for a loan in order to grow her business and buy fruit wholesale from the suppliers. Our member appreciates and is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing her own business. She promises to pay all of the payments on her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member is asking for a loan to buy fruit on a wholesale level and in this way support her business..

loans.name: Angel Ramon

texts.es:
El Señor Ángel Ramón García Z., tiene la edad de 50 años, Labora en la limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del Techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y su esposa. 

Ángel dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha mejorado y ahora cuenta con más seguridad para sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Señor Ángel Ramón García Z. is 50 years old. He works as a cleaner in Managua’s Mercado Oriental (Eastern Market). He cares for three children, two of whom are of school age. He is married. He has arranged loans with CEPRODEL for three years. In this period, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, he has invested the three loans in the improvement of the dwelling in which he lives. He is an excellent client.

The loan applied for is for investing in the payment for labor and the purchase construction materials such as zinc, metal beams, etc. This will be used for the renovation of the roof of the house in which he lives, with the goal of giving greater security and a better quality of life to his children and wife.

Ángel said that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL his home has improved and now his children and wife can count on more security.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and expansion of a home

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
La Sra.  Camila,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia del San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 70 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, ya independientes.

Camila, se dedica a la venta D. comidas preparadas hace 08 años atrás, donD. poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo D. actividad, y nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, hoy ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, por la rica sazón que le pone a sus comidas.  En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente les atienD., con el carisma y amabilidad que siempre le ha caracterizado. 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios D. cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Camila, se siente muy segura y con ganas D. seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Camila, 70, is a member of the "Las Golondrinas II" communal bank, which is in Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has 3 adult children. Camila has sold prepared meals for the last 8 years and has been acquiring work experience bit by bit. She relates to us that she's done well with her sales; she is well-known and well-liked by her customers, thanks to the great flavor she puts into her dishes. She continues to this day in her work and it is she, herself, who tends to her customers with the good-humor and charm that have always characterized her. She will use this 3000 sol loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar, various vegetables, crates of eggs and chickens. She will also buy some kitchen utensils to replace some of the ones she has so that she can offer better customer service. Camila feels sure of herself and with the desire to continue working to get ahead and secure for herself a peaceful life. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora JUANA, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia se desplaza entre Bolivia y Cusco, trayendo libros a bajo costo hacia la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 39 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, (13, 11, 5) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene 4 años en este negocio y lo conoce muy bien, nuestra socia viaja al mes 2 veces a la paz-Bolivia y trae libros para venderlos en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene un stand en el mercado del baratillo, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su negocio de compra y venta de libros.
 
La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member is Ms JUANA. She belongs to the communal bank “MUJERES UNIDAS” (Women United). She travels between Bolivia and Cusco, bringing low cost books to Cusco. Juana is 39, lives with her partner and has 3 children (13, 11, 5). She alternates her household chores with the retail business. She has been working in this business for 4 years and knows it very well. Juana travels twice a month to La Paz, Bolivia, and brings the books to sell them in the city of Cusco. She has a stand in the Baratillo Market. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business of buying and selling books. Our member appreciates and expresses her satisfaction in being able to continue growing her own business, and she promises to complete her payment of the loan by the established deadline.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requests a loan to invest in her book-selling business

loans.name: Jani

texts.es:
La Sra. Jani, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas II”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Anteriormente, Jani se dedicaba a la Venta de Productos de Belleza. Sus ganas de salir adelante, con sus propios medios le han valido para implementar su propio negocio de Alquiler de habitaciones, ubicada en su misma casa.  

En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, que vienen de otras zonas por estudio o trabajo. Sus ganancias los obtiene cada fin de mes, con los pagos de sus habitaciones, nos cuenta que es muy responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así e implementarse en otro tipo de negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará accesorios, para modificar los servicio higiénicos (baños y duchas) de los cuartos y valdes de pintura, para dar una mejor infraestructura a sus habitaciones.

Jani, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una vejez tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Jani is a customer of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas II" in the Tarapoto District of San Martin Province. She is 28, married and has a son who is still her dependent. Jani used to sell beauty products. However, her will to prosper on her own has inspired her to set up her business of room rentals, located in her own home. She has an established clientele who come from other areas of the country to study or work. She receives her earnings at the end of the month from the payment of the rental fees. She tells us that she is very responsible with her payments and plans to start another type of business. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy bathroom accessories (for the toilets and showers) and buckets of paint to modify and improve the infrastructure of the rooms. Jani feels she is full of strength to continue working in order to ensure herself a peaceful retirement. She is very thankful for the Manuela Ramos movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Wright, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing-construction materials

loans.name: Brenda Geraldin

texts.es: Brenda tiene 21 años de edad es soltera, ella vive con su madre en casa de sus abuelos, ella se dedica como azafata, actualmente esta laborando en un restaurant como azafata, ella esta laborando hace 2 años en el mismo lugar, es una persona muy joven con muchas y metas y objetivos, una de ellas es poder realizar estudios superiores,  con el dinero que solicita invertira para poner un pequeño negocio de la venta de ropa, para que se pueda ayudar.
texts.en:
Brenda is 21 years old and single. She lives with her mother in her grandparents’ house. Currently, she works as a hostess in a restaurant. Brenda has been working in the same place for two years. She is a very young person with many goals and objectives. One of these is to be able to obtain higher education. With the money that she is applying for she will invest in starting a small business selling clothing so that she can help herself.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a small business selling clothing

loans.name: Cecilia Giuliana

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia Giuliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Gaviotas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 19 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Cecilia Giuliana, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa y nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Cecilia Giuliana belongs to the "Las Gaviotas II" Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, San Martin Province. She is 19 years old, single, and has one son, who is dependent on her. Cecilia Giuliana is a perserverant and capable woman. She sells clothing out of a well equipped space in her home and reports that it is going very well. She counts on clients who know her and her business. Her strength and perserverance have helped her grow as an independent woman and she is very proud of her achievements. With this loan of 1000 soles she will buy merchandise to increase her stock, such as: pants, shorts, all sizes and styles of blouses, polo shirts and dresses for adults and children. She considers herself an established and hard working woman and appreciates the opportunity that the Movimiento Manual Ramos has offered her to develop as a woman and as a small entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora NIEVES, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es natural de la provincia de Calca exactamente de Taray – Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos, (15, 14) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un restaurante en el distrito de San Sebastián, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en el negocio, ella necesita comprar platos y algunos accesorios para el restaurante,
 
La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nieves belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" ("United Women") Community Bank. She is a native of the province of Calca, more precisely the Taray-Cusco area. She is 36 years old, married and has two children, ages 15 and 14. Nieves divides her time between her household responsibilities and her job as retail merchant. She has a restaurant in the district of San Sebastián. She is requesting the loan to be able to reinvest in her business by purchasing plates and some other restaurant accessories. Nieves is grateful and expresses her satisfaction with being able to keep growing her own business, and she promises to fulfill her payments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and reinvest in her restaurant.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos García C., Labora como encargado de limpieza en el Mercado Israel Lewite  de Managua (Higienista), el tiene Cuatro hijos a su cargo, tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado ocho créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 8 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Hierro y piedra la construcción de un baño.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos García C. is in charge of cleaning Managua's Israel Lewite Market. He is married and has four children under his care, three school age. He has received eight loans from Kiva partner CEPRODEL over six years and has invested the credit in improving his home. He has been an excellent client, and is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron and stones to build a bathroom and provide more security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements and expand his home

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
La señora Lady, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las orquídeas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 31 años y es madre de 01 hija, que aun depende de ella.

Lady, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida.  Poco a poco, fue ahorrando y generando su propio capital, logrando así establecer su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos y nos cuenta que hoy en día le esta yendo muy bien, por lo que ahora, cuenta con clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y mensualmente acuden a su casa, para realizar sus pedidos por catálogos. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su aumentar su stock como: perfumes y colonias para damas, caballeros y niños; cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas.

Lady, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres, que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Lady belongs to the "Las Orquiedas II" Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province. She is 31 years old and is single; she has one daughter, who is dependent on her. Lady is a woman who has overcome many challenges in the course of her life. In the past, she worked in food sales. Little by little, she earned and saved up her own capital, and in so doing was able to establish her own cosmetics business. She tells us that it is now going very well, as she now has loyal clients who know her and who come to her house on a monthly basis to place their catalogue orders. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy beauty products to augment her stock, such as; perfumes and colognes for ladies, gentlemen and children; creams; powder compacts; lip pencils; and nail polish. Lady can be seen as a role model for many women who begin a business and who, through perserverance, make their dreams come true. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her begin her own business and for helping other women to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Marnith

texts.es:
La señora Marnith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 27 años y no tiene hijos. 

Marnith, decidió implementar su negocio de ventas de salchipapas, se inicio desde muy joven por iniciativa propia y ya lleva años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las noches. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como: aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios para remplazar a sus utensilios antiguos, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Marnith, se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar más su salchipaperia al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marnith belongs to “Las Orquídeas II” Community Bank, located in Tarapoto District, San Martín Provence, San Martín Department. She is single, 27 years old, and has no children. Marnith decided to set up a business selling salchipapas (french fries with fried hot dogs). She started it on her own at a very young age, and now has years of experience in this activity. She is located in her own house, in a well equipped environment, where she serves her clients. She tells us that she regularly has good sales because of the flavorful seasoning that she puts on her food. Today she continues in the same business, and she is very happy with her job that she does day after day, selling during the night. She personally helps her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of 1,000.00 soles she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of her food such as: gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, chicken, and vegetables. Also, part of the money will be invested in new utensils to replace her old ones so that she can better attend to her clients. Marnith, feels full of life, and desires to continue moving forward. She has many dreams and goals in her life, such as expanding her business while also appreciating the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to set up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and utensils.

loans.name: Jose Eddy

texts.es:
El Señor José Eddy Martínez Suárez, tiene la edad de 48 años, Labora como METROLOGO (Inspector) en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo, los cuales  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 7 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El cual utilizara para remodelar el piso de su de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
José dijo que los préstamos obtenidos por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
José Eddy Martínez Suárez is 48 years old and works as inspector in Managua's Mayoreo Market. He is married and has two children under his care, both of whom are school age. He has received loans from Kiva partner CEPRODEL for six years, and over this time has invested seven loans into the improvement of his home. The loan he is requesting is to invest in the purchase of construction materials to remodel the floor of his, with the goal of providing more security and a better quality of life for his children. José said that the loans he has received from CEPRODEL have greatly helped him make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements and expand his home

loans.name: Norma Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. Norma  tiene 37  años de edad. Es conviviente  tienen 4 hijos menores de edad de 18, 16,8 y 2 años. Tres  de sus primeros hijos de su primer compromiso y el ultimo  de su compromiso actual.Ella cuenta con casa propia de material noble recientemente construido aun sin acabados. La Sra Norma  cuenta con un negocio de una pequeña tienda en su domicilio, se inicio en este negocio hace 4 años, ella  tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener un negocio mucho mas grande, La Sra. Norma es una persona muy activa y emprendedora, con el dinero que solicita invertira en hacer algunos acabados del local de  su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma is 37 years old. She has a partner and four minor children ages 18, 16, 8 and 2. The first three children are from a prior relationship and her last one is with her current partner. Mrs. Norma has her own house made of good material. It is recently constructed but is not finished. Mrs. Norma has a small store in her home. She has had this store for four years. She has a lot of dreams, one of which is to have a much larger store. Mrs. Norma is an energetic and enterprising person. With the money that she is requesting, she will finish with the construction of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will improve her home.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
EL Señor Oscar Danilo  López, Labora como conductor en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres  hijos, estos se encuentran en edad escolar, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en ese lapso ha invertido  5 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales requerido para el cambio del sistema eléctrico de la vivienda, para Brindarle mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a su hija. 

Oscar dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ahora cuenta con una vivienda segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar works as a driver in the eastern market in Managua. He has three children that go to school. He has had loans from CEPRODEL in the past four years. During this time he has had five loans which he has used to improve the home in which he lives. He gives thanks to CEPRODEL for providing him with these loans. He is an excellent customer. With the money from the loan he is requesting, he will buy the necessary materials so that he can change the electrical system in his home. This will provide better security and conditions for his daughter. Oscar said thanks for the loans given to him by CEPRODEL. They have helped him provide a secure home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his home and make it better.

loans.name: Reyna Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Reyna del Socorro D., Labora como Maestra en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua, ella tiene a su cargo una hija, este se encuentran en edad escolar, es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en ese lapso ha invertido  1 crédito en la mejora de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darle una mejor condición de vida a su hija. 

 Reyna dijo que gracias a los préstamos obtenidos por ceprodel ha logrado mejorar su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna works as a teacher at the National Independent University of Nicaragua. She has a school-age daughter under her care. She is single. She has had loans with CEPRODEL over the past two years. During this time she has used one loan to improve her home. She is an excellent client. With the loan she is requesting she will invest in materials to replace the roof of her house and to pay for construction workers. She would like to provide a better quality of life for her daughter. Reyna said that, thanks to the loans that she has been given through CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her home and enlarge it.

loans.name: Violeta Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Violeta Azucena L. tiene ya más de seis año dedicándose a la venta de joyería de oro y plata. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía ya que en la temporada de navidad de le termino. Esta solicitando un préstamo para realizar la inversión y así tener más inventario que ofrecer a sus clientas. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor Ramos Ruiz quien trabaja en una agencia aduanal como atención al cliente.
texts.en:
Señora Violeta Azucena L. has been selling gold and silver jewelry for over six years. Her inventory is running low now that the Christmas season has ended. She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase more inventory and offer a wider selection of jewelry to her clients. She plans to pay for the loan with her earnings from her business since the household expenses are paid for by her husband, señor Ramos Ruiz, who works in customer service at a customs agency.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 73 años y es madre D. 08  hijos, 01 que  aun depenD. D. ella y esta estudiando.

Esmeralda, es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz, nos cuenta que poco a poco ha ido cumpliendo algunos D. sus  metas y sueños que quería realizar,  en la actualidad se dedica a venta D. ropas usadas y le esta yendo muy bien, en este tipo D. actividad, ya que tiene clientes fijos que la conocen y saben D. su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un lugar muy bien acondicionado. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará mercaderías D. ropas como: pantalones, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para niñas. Ella manifiesta que siente mucho orgullo por ella misma, por lo que logro y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me ofrece el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos,  D.  contar con los préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Esmeralda belongs to “Las Orquídeas II” Community Bank, located in Tarapoto District, San Martin Provence, San Martín Department. She is a 73 year old widow, and mother of 8 children, one of which is a student and still dependent upon her. Esmeralda is a happy woman who is persistent and capable. She tells us that little by little she has been achieving her dreams and goals. She currently sells used clothing, and is doing very well at this job now that she has regular clients that know her and her business. The business is located in her house which is well-equipped. The fortituD. and perseverance that characterizes Esmeralda has helped her to become an independent woman, and she is very proud of what she has accomplished. With this loan of 1,000.00 soles, she will by clothing such as: pants, shorts, sneakers, blouses of all sizes and styles, polo shirts, and girls dresses. She expresses with enthusiasm and optimism how proud of herself she is for what she has achieved. She says: I am grateful for the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos Movement has offered me, to be able to count on the loans that help me to become a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothing.

loans.name: Sidney Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo Solórzano Méndez, Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene a su cargo dos hijos, uno se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado ocho créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en ese lapso ha invertido  8 créditos en la mejora de la vivienda en la que habita gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de  6 pliegos de  Zinc, el cual utilizara para su casa de habitación ya que las que tenía estaban en mal estado y se pasaba el agua en invierno.
 Para Brindarle una mejor condición de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Gerardo S. M. works as a janitor in the wholesale market in Managua. He is married, and has in his charge two sons, one of which is school-age. He has had eight loans with CEPRODEL over six years, and has invested the eight loans in the improvement of his home which he lives in thanks to the financing provided by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent borrower.

This loan is to invest in the purchase of six sheets of corrugated roofing which he will use for his house as his current roofing is in poor condition and leaks in the winter. He wants to provide better living conditions for his son.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
La señora Miguelina,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, que aun depenD. D. ella.  

Miguelina, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, alegre y carismática, cualidad que le ayuda bastante en el negocio que ejerce. Se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. la línea: Esika y ya lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo D. actividad.
En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, venD. sus productos D. belleza al contado y al crédito, con pagos D. manera diaria, semanal, quincenal o mensual.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1000.00, comprará productos D. belleza como: colonias refrescantes, perfumes para damas y caballeros, billuteria como aretes, collares y anillos. Anhela implementar más su negocio y contar con una buena cantidad D. productos D. belleza en stock, D. esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes fijos.

Miguelina, sueña con crecer en el negocio y llegar a ser una vendedora estrella. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Miguelina, is a customer of the Communal Bank “Las Orquideas II”, Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, San Martin Department. She is married, 48 years old and mother of 3 children all of whom are still her dependents. Miguelina is devoted to her family, joyous and charismatic. Her qualities help her in her line of business, the sale of beauty products from the “Esika” brand. She has many years in this and has an established clientele. Her sales are paid in cash or credit, payments are maD. on a daily, weekly, biweekly or monthly basis. With a loan of 1000 soles she will buy beauty products such as: aftershaves, perfumes for men and women, fashion jewelry, earrings, necklaces and rings. Her goal is to strengthen her business and have a good stock of products to satisfy her regular customers. Miguelina’s dream is for her business to grow and be a top seller. She is grateful with the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her and other women like her start their business and grow personally and professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Wright, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha C. tiene ya más de tres años con su negocio de venta dulcería.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta más variedad de producto pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo para realizar las comprar de la mercancía que desea vender.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que los gastos de la casa se encargara su esposo el señor Nicolás Banoni, quien se dedica a la venta de tacos por las mañana en diferentes partes de la cuidad. 
Es un matrimonio ya mayor de edad que viven de sus negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha C. has been in the business of selling candy for more than three years. Her business lacks a variety of products, but she does not have the money at the moment to make additional investments. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase the merchandise she wants to sell.

She plans to repay this loan using the earnings from her business. The household expenses are covered by her husband, Sr. Nicolás Banoni, who sells tacos during the morning in different parts of the city. As a married couple, they must live off their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: William Alexander

texts.es:
El Señor William Alexander R. R., tiene la edad de 53 años, Labora como Guarda de Seguridad  en el Mercado Israel Lewites de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 11 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Ladrillos, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del piso de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. William Alexander R. R. is 53 years old and works as a security guard at the Israel Lewites Market in Managua. He is married and has three dependent children, two of whom are in school. William has worked with CEPRODEL for eight years and has received eleven loans to make improvements to his home. He is an excellent client.

This loan will be used to pay for labor and construction materials such as cement, bricks, etc. He plans to have the floor of his house repaired in order to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor and construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor Gilberto G. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a mejorar su negocio. Compraron mesas y sillas para que sus clientes ya están mucho mejor al consumir sus deliciosos tacos. 
Nuevamente están solicitando un préstamo para poder acondicionar la camioneta para la venta de tacos, pero en este momento no cuentan con el capital necesario para está remodelación. 
Desean contar nuevamente con su cooperación para este préstamo, ya que planean pagarlo con las ganancias del negocio. 
Don Gilberto también trabaja en un supermercado en el departamento de abarrotes, con este ingreso será para los gastos de la familia.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Maria Del Rosario Silva esposa del señor Gilberto.
texts.en:
Sr. Gilberto G. is very grateful for the assistance provided through his previous loan which helped to improve his business. He bought tables and chairs so that his customers could feel comfortable while eating his delicious tacos.

Gilberto is requesting a new loan in order to restore the truck he uses for selling tacos. At the moment, he does not have the capital needed to pay for these repairs. He wishes to receive your assistance again with this loan and plans to repay it with the profits from his business. Don Gilberto also works at a supermarket in the department in charge of provisions. His income from this job will be used to pay for his family’s expenses.

The person who appears in the photo is Sra. Maria Del Rosario Silva, Don Gilberto’s wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his business vehicle

loans.name: Alejandro Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Alejandro José  Sánchez O., Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene cuatro  hijos a su cargo, tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado diez créditos con CEPRODEL durante Siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 10 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, por lo que comprara dos ventanas de madera para su casa de habitación ya que las que tenía se encontraban deterioradas.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Alejandro dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. Alejandro José Sánchez O. is the head of sanitation at the Eastern Market in Managua. He is married and has four dependent children in school. Alejandro has worked with CEPRODEL for seven years. He used the ten loans he received to make improvements to his home. Alejandro is an excellent client.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials. Two of the wooden window frames on his house were damaged and need to be replaced. His main objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Maria Concepción G. tiene ya mas de doce años dedicándose a la venta de juguetes y aparatos de electrónica.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía ya que se le termino y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder hacer la inversión, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir de mercancía el negocio y así tener mas ingreso.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Concepción G. has been selling toys and consumer electronics for more than twelve years. Her business lacks a variety of merchandise, but she does not have the money necessary to make additional investments. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise so that she can restock her business and generate more income. She plans to repay this loan with the profits from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Benjamin Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Benjamin José M. Núñez, tiene la edad de 24 años, Labora como Oficial de Mantenimiento en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene un hijo a su cargo, este se encuentran  en edad escolar, es Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 5 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El que utilizara para la remodelación y cambio de una parte del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a su hijo.

Benjamin dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sr. Benjamin José M. Núñez is 24 years old and works as a maintenance official at the Roberto Huembes Market in Managua. He is married and has one dependent child in school. Benjamin has been working with CEPRODEL for five years and has received five loans that were used to make improvements to his home. He is an excellent client.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials for a remodeling project and to change out part of the roof on his house. His objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his son. Benjamin says he thanks CEPRODEL for providing loans so that he can make these home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor José Ernesto L. Cáceres, Labora como Higienista ( limpieza) en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene a su cargo dos hijos, se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en ese lapso ha invertido  2 créditos en el mejoramiento de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

José dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda y darles mejores condiciones a sus hijos y esposa
texts.en:
Sr. José Ernesto L. Cáceres works as a janitor at the Roberto Huembes Market in Managua. He is married and has two dependent children in school. He has worked with CEPRODEL for two years and received two loans that were used for making home improvements.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase materials for refurbishing the roof of his house and pay for labor. He wishes to provide better living conditions for his children.

José says he is thankful for the loans CEPRODEL has provided so that he can improve his home and provide better conditions for his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en: Vergenia Y.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting mango for sale. She is 44 years old, married and has one school-age child. They are from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Vergenia has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2004, Vergenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Vergenia has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Vergenia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her eleventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth R. is from the village of Tabuan in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Bernadeth is married and has four young children. To make a living, Bernadeth sells food in the local community. Bernadeth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Bernadeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase ingredients to make products to sell. This will be Bernadeth's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Romy

texts.en:
Romy O. is from the village of Lower Langcangan in Oroquieta City. He is 31 years old. Romy is married. To make a living, Romy works in someone else's business providing transportation services to local community members. Romy has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Romy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be Romy's first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en:
Orepa V. is 25 and married with 3 children (ages 2-months - 6).  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Orepa has 6 years of experience in this business.  Orepa needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 355 tala or US $148 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Orepa joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Orepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Orepa V. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva R. is a 56-year old married woman who lives in Had. San Jose in  Barangay Mabini, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and sell fruits, soft drinks, and gasoline to passing motorbike drivers.

Eva’s husband, Roberto, is a laborer in sugarcane plantation. They have 10 children between 13 and 40 years old, seven of whom have their own families. Two of her children work with her in her business and one goes to school. The children living at home also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Eva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 with the hope that she would bring in additional income and be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF she has been able to bring in extra money for the family, with an average monthly income of Php 2,400 from her business.

Eva is a member in good standing. She used her previous loan of Php 11,500 to fund her business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. She intends to use her current loan of Php 12,000 to buy additional inventory for her store. Eva is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita D. is a 55-year old married woman who lives in Prk Consing Brgy Daga in Cadiz City in Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating  a general (sari sari) store and running a pig fattening business.

Anita’s husband, Florencio D., is a pensioner.  They have 6 children who are between 17 and 33 years old.  Three of her children have their own familes. The three remaining children help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores, and one of them is currently going to school. 

Anita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the amount of money they bring in every month, earning an average monthly income of Php 12,000 from her business activities.

Anita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,500 was used to fund operations of her general store.  It had a positive impact in both maintaining and growing the business, as well as improving the family’s living conditions. Now Anita is borrowing for her 14th loan, the amount of Php 22000, which she intends to use to buy supplies for both her sari sari store and the pig fattening business. Anita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites L. is a 31-year old married woman who lives in Prk Consing Brgy Daga in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general (sari sari) store and a bakery.

Marites husband, Razel, is a baker who co-owns the business with his wife.  They have 2 children, 6 and 7 years old.  One is currently going to school, and both help their mother sell goods in her general store.

Marites joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the amount of money the family brings in, earning an average monthly income of Php 6,000 from her business activities.

Marites is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations and buy stock for her general store.  It had a positive impact in maintaining the business and the family’s living conditions. Now Marites is borrowing her 12th loan, in the amount of Php 18,000, which she intends to use on the general store and the bakery.  Marites is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia S. is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Punta Cabahog Brgy Zone 1, Cadiz City Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari sari (general) store.

Letecia’s husband, Alfredo S., is a fisherman.  They have 3 children, 2 of whom are adults.  One child currently goes to school and helps his parents with the business as part of his daily chores.

Letecia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with the profits from her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6000 from her business activities.

Letecia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 13000 was used to fund operations and buy inventory for her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now Letecia is borrowing her 15th loan, in the amount of Php 13000, which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store. Letecia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba V. is a 54-year-old widow who lives in Hda. San Jose Brgy Mabini in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and selling vegetables in the community.

Melba has six children, from 24 to 34 years old. All are adults, and five of them have their own families. The remaining one works in a sugarcane plantation, helping to support Melba financially and assisting in taking care of their vegetable plantation.

Melba joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to improve the quality of life of her family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase her profits, earning an average monthly income of PHP 1,600 from her business activities.

Melba is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 was used to fund the operation of her vegetable-selling business. It had a positive impact both on the business and in improving the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking out her fifth loan, for the amount of PHP 9,000, which she intends to use to continue to pay the daily expenses associated with her vegetable-selling business. Melba is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.
