loans.use: Additional capital for her vegetable vending.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia T. is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Purok Consing, Barangay Daga, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling the furniture made by her husband, a carpenter, and also by selling fish. Cadiz is a coastal city with a vibrant fishing industry, and many women have small businesses selling dried fish.

Alicia’s husband Jose Jimmy is a carpenter. They have five children from 13 to 22 years old, three of whom are working and help their parents with their household needs and two of whom are currently in school. All of them help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores.

Alicia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to earn an average monthly income of PHP 16,000 from her business activities.

Alicia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 was used to fund the operations of her furniture and fish vending. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking out her 14th loan, for the amount of PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to buy supplies for her furniture-selling business, and also to maintain operations in her fish vending business. Alicia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. The photo above shows Alicia with her husband standing at the place where the furniture is made.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her furniture and fish vending business.

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthol K. is 52 years old, and a village bank president. She has been selected as president by the group members, who will use the loan for different purposes. This village bank loan group consists of 21 members who all live in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Chanthol K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land for growing rice. Her husband, Mr. Sem Som, owns three trucks for transporting soil to resell. However hard this family tries to earn money with their business, they still earn less income than is needed to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Chanthol K. decided to request a loan to start a new career in buying piglets for breeding. This couple has four children who are studying at a local public school. All the members are shown in the picture but some of tH. are blocked.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Srey Mao's Group

texts.en: Nineteen people, all living in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Srey Mao S. was selected as village bank president by the group members, who will all use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she grows rice for a living and her husband, Mr. PhearU. Phoem, owns one truck for transporting soil to resell. This family faces a problem: because their truck’s wheels are too old to work, they need to exchange them for new ones. Thus, Mrs. Srey Mao S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase two new truck wheels. This couple has three children. The oldest one is a staff member in a casino club while the other two are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To purchase two new truck wheels.

loans.name: Ros' Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of nine people who live in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province. Each member will use their part of the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Ros N. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a mother of a child who attends the local public school. She sells fruit. She also grows rice on her farm. Her husband, Mr. Lun Lang, is an electrician in Phnom Penh. Although this family tries to work hard in their rice field and other business, they still earn only a little income from their work. 

Mrs. Ros N. has decided to apply for a loan to expand her business by purchasing more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyneang S. is a laborer in a garment factory and her husband, Mr. Sot Meang, is a taxi motorbike driver. (Her husband is on the right in the photo.) She is 30 years old and lives in Preak Doung village in Kandal province. She is the mother of four children: three are enrolled in the local public school while the youngest is too young for school. 

Mr. Sot Meang has a problem because his motorbike is too old to use for taxi motorbike driving. Thus, Mrs. Sreyneang S. decided to apply for a loan to purchase a new motorbike to exchange with the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhan K. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to grow rice and crops to support her family. She is 42 years old and lives in Preaek Ta Nob village in Kandal Province. She is the mother of four children: two are attending the local public school while the other two are too young for school. Her husband, Mr. Vout Phuong, is a fisherman and has another job as a palm juice collector (he is on the left in the photo). 

This family now faces some obstacles with their rice field. Thus, Mrs. Sokhan K. decided to apply for a loan to purchase additional hoses to water her crops.

loans.use: To purchase additional hoses

loans.name: Nurila's Group

texts.ru:
Кадырбаева Нурила – лидер данной группы. Нурила – из г. Кант. Слово кант в переводе с киргизского означает «сахар». Но, однако, в последние годы в городе жизнь оказалась не совсем сладкой. Многие жители города уехали на заработки в ближнее и дальнее зарубежье. Эта же судьба грозила и Нуриле. К тому же у неё с мужем четверо детей, которые только начали достигать юношеского возраста. Путешествовать с четырьмя детьми было бы нелегко и муж Нурилы, не раздумывая, решил заняться частным извозом. Нурила в свою очередь, на накопленные от заработной платы средства взяла в аренду контейнер и начала продавать продукты питания. Приобрести контейнер в родном городе не получилось, зато получилось в селе, которое находится в двадцати километрах от Канта. Дети уже подросли, а бизнес позволил им остаться в родном городе. Старшая дочь только окончила школу, а остальные дети всё ещё учатся в школе. В своё время Нурила вложила восемь тысяч сомов ($180), чтобы начать торговлю. Теперь она в месяц зарабатывает десять тысяч сомов ($220). Нуриле нужны средства, чтобы вложить их в закупку новой партии товара и увеличения товарооборота. Она надеется получить этот кредит и осуществить задуманное. В планы Нурилы также входит в ближайшем будущем купить домой мебель, и кое – какую живность.

У Нурилы три партнёра по группе:

Айжан сорок четыре года. Муж Айжан – строитель. Айжан – мать троих детей. Две дочери – замужем. Сын учится в школе. Айжан – домохозяйка. Она разводит скот, и продаёт его на скотном рынке. Айжан ежемесячно зарабатывает до десяти тысяч сомов. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить бычка для откорма и продажи. 

Нуржан сорок шесть лет. Муж Нуржан работает электриком. У Нуржан одна дочь. Нуржан раньше занималась пошивом национальных изделий, но знакомые посоветовали ей заняться торговлей мукой. Нуржан решила попробовать и купила на накопленные средства несколько мешков и начала торговать. Нуржан нужен кредит, чтобы вложить средства в закупку муки. 

Гульнаре сорок лет. Муж Гульнары разводит скот. Гульнара торгует в с. Ивановка продуктами питания, конфетами и печеньем. Гульнара – мать троих детей. 
Все дети ходят в школу. Старший сын уже заканчивает в этом году школу. Гульнара просит предоставить ей кредит, чтобы купить несколько коробок конфет и печенья.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
K. Nurila is the leader of this group. She lives in the city of Kant. In translation from Kirghiz the word “kant” means “sugar”. However, in the past couple of years life in the city has been far from sweet. Many residents left the country in hope of finding stable employment elsewhere. The same fate was threatening Nurila and her husband. Additionally, they had four children to take care of. Traveling with them would have been uneasy at best and so Nurila’s husband decided to stay and become a taxi driver. Tapping into her savings, Nurila rented a container and started to sell foodstuffs. Finding a container in her home city proved problematic, however, they were able to rent one in a village twenty kilometers away. Her children had already grown and this business allowed them to remain in Kant. Her eldest daughter has already finished high school, while the rest of the children are still in school. In order to start her business, Nurila invested eight thousand soms ($180). Today her average monthly income is about ten thousand soms ($220). Nurila needs capital to invest into new products and increase her goods turnover. She also plans to buy some furniture and livestock for her household. Narila has three partners in her group: Aijan is forty-four years old. Her husband is a construction worker. They have three children. Their two daughters are married and her son is in school. Aijan is a housewife. She raises livestock and sells it on the market. She makes up to ten thousand soms per month. She is requesting a loan in order to buy bull to fatten and sell. Nurjan is forty-six years old. Her husband works as an electrician. She had tailored ethnic clothes and products but her friends recommended that she become a flour salesman. Nurjan decided to try it out and bought a couple bags of flour. Nurjan needs a loan to invest her capital in more flour. Gulnara is forty years old. Her husband raises livestock. Gulnara works in the village of Ivanovka where she sells foodstuffs, candy and cookies. She is a mother of three children, all of which are attending school. Her eldest son will graduate this year. Gulnara is asking for a loan to buy some boxes of cookies and candy. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some household goods and groceries for the convenience store

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mr. Yon Y. (pictured on the left next to his wife, Mrs. Veansey Bech) is 49 years old. He lives in Preak Doung village in Kandal province. 

Yon Y. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land they use to cultivate rice. When they have free time, they work as laborers. They have three children who are laborers in a garment factory. 

Mr. Yon Y. faces the problem that the soil in his field is infertile. He decided to apply for a loan to purchase fertilizers in the hope that this will increase his crop yield in the current year. He will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support his rice field.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Mr. Sambo P. (pictured on the right, next to his wife Mrs. Saream Oung) is 34 years old. He lives in Ponley village in Takeo province. Mr. Sambo P. is the father of two children, both of whom are students in the local school.

Sambo P. and his wife are farmers who own a 1.5-hectar field which they use to cultivate rice. Aside from his farming, Sambo P. is also a duck breeder in the local village. Since his duck-breeding business is going well, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food.

loans.name: Meripa

texts.en:
Meripa F. is 40 and married with 3 children (ages 2 - 12 years).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Meripa has many years of experience in this business. loans.name: Zinagul's Group

texts.en:
S. Zinagul, who is 47 years old and a widow, is the leader of this group. 

When Zinagul lost her husband, she was left with three children. For her, the question was "to be or not to be." However, as her life itself has proven, Zinagul courageously withstood all the obstacles in her way and has safely made it through. 

Zinagul set a goal to help all her children get firmly on their feet so that they would never feel need. To accomplish this, she undertook two jobs. She worked as a high school teacher during the day. At home after work, she started manufacturing handicrafts for sale in Kyrgyzstan. 

She has continued this way for six years. Now her children are grown and earn their living themselves. Her eldest daughter goes to college. One of her sons works as a builder. Recently he bought a car. Another son works in an electric station. Zinagul is happy that her children are gradually getting on their feet. 

Zinagul still manufactures handicrafts for her permanent long-term customers. Her monthly income from selling the items, though, is only $65.00 US dollars. 

Zinagul decided to apply for this loan to buy a cow for milk and for breeding. She wants to sell milk to create an additional income source for her family. Her next plan is to help her son get married. 

Zinagul’s partners are: 

--Gulmira, 42, has one son and a set of twins. Her husband works as a stoker at school. Gulmira is a housewife, but because of frequent electricity outages, she has been selling gas in plastic bottles. Gulmira needs a loan to buy coal. 

--Berdibek, 34, has two children. Berdibek makes iron gates for homes and works as a welder. He needs a loan to buy metal for making gates.

--Karyibek, 34, is a father of four children. He trades in coal and grows potatoes. Karyibek needs a loan to purchase ten tons of coal. 

--Taalaigul, 27, has two children. Her husband works as a builder. Taalaigul is a housewife. She rears her children. Taalaigul and her husband need a loan to purchase coal for winter.   

--- Where did this loan come from? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to learn more about and support Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our lending team "Supporters of Kyrgyzstan" at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Mol Bulak staff and from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.name: Salamat's Group

texts.en:
C. Salamat is the leader of this group. 

Salamat is 58 years old. Her husband for the last several years has been retired. However, Salamat has a daughter, who is 20 years old. Therefore, there is nobody to provide for Salamat’s family except herself and her husband, who sometimes offers welding services. Besides, Salamat’s daughter is temporarily unemployed. 

Salamat has a job as a seamstress in a sewing section. At the same time, she raises cattle together with her husband. Thus they provide for themselves, not depending on anybody’s support. 

They started out keeping cattle, just as most people do in their village. Then Salamat’s husband decided to start trading in cattle. He used his entrepreneurship skills to start trading in sheep. Later, they obtained a loan and started increasing their herds. Now they have eighteen sheep and four cows. However, Salamat only manages to earn $45.00 US per month from selling milk. Salamat decided to apply for this loan to buy four sheep for breeding. Now they are making preparations for the feast in honor of their grandson. 

Salamat’s partners are:  

--Iygilik, 30, is a father of two daughters. To provide for the family, his wife works as a saleswoman, whereas he is an operator. They need a loan to buy coal. In the near future, Iygilik hopes to buy a car as he has been planning for quite a long time.

--Sveta, 33, is a mother of two sons. She works as a schoolteacher and her husband is a leading specialist in an organization. Sveta hopes to obtain this loan and buy two sheep for breeding. Sveta wants to raise sheep because her and her husband's salaries (hers is $45.00 US; his is $90.00 US) are not sufficient for the family's needs. 

--Tolokan, 44, has a son. Her husband also raises cattle, trades in them in a cattle market during weekends and works as a tractor driver. Tolokan works as a nurse in a kindergarten. Tolokan has applied for this loan to purchase some cattle for feeding and resale. 

--- Where did this loan come from? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to learn more about and support Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our lending team "Supporters of Kyrgyzstan" at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Mol Bulak staff and from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine S. is from the village of Bangen Dap-Dap, Bamban, Tarlac. She is 39 years old. Catherine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Catherine owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $170 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Catherine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catherine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to develop her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Tauinaola G. is 45 and married with 4 children (ages 8 - 21).  She owns a business venture, providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Tauinaola has many years of experience in this business.  Tauinaola needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 220 tala or US $92 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Tauinaola joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tauinaola's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tauinaola G. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.99 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
S. is 58 years of age and lives in Siem Reap province. She is the mother of seven children: the oldest two are married and live separately, the second two are single and work with Saroun in her business, and the last three are students. Her husband’s name is Aiy and he earns a living fishing along the Mekong river. S. gets up early every morning to gather the fish from her husband and other fisherman in bulk and then hurries them to the market. Along with her fish sales, she also feeds many ducks, which she then will sell. 

S. requests her second loan to purchase a motorcycle for her children to ride to study or work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vy N. is 43 years old and she lives in Ponley village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field where she cultivates rice. In order to make her rice crop more productive, Mrs. Vy N. decided to ask for a loan to buy irrigation equipment to water  her crop. The remainder of the loan she would use to buy rice seed. 

She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions through this loan. Her husband, Mr. Kouy Sok, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Vy N. is the mother of four children who are all students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a machine to water her crop, and to buy rice seed.

loans.name: Matale Group 2, Lugazi.

texts.en:
A. Christine is a hard-working lady who runs a general store. She is married with four children, all of whom are in secondary or primary school. She also takes care of her other siblings. 

She is able to use her loans to restock her shop with more goods, and it is the profits she makes out of the shop that help her take care of almost all her family needs. She hopes to transform her shop further with a hope to turn it into a wholesale shop, where she will be able to make more profit out of it, for her children’s continued education. Christine needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Mrs. Savat P. is 30 years old and she lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a four-hectare field where she cultivates rice. She has a small problem because her field is infertile, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, She also wants to buy pesticides to kill all the insects in the field. Aside from being a farmer, she is a grocer. 

Her husband, Mr. Chhoeurn Tith, is a teacher in the local village. He also can earn a small income to support the family. Mrs. Savat P. is the mother of two children who are all students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Loung

texts.en:
Loung S., 45, is married and the mother of six children. Two of her sons help provide the family with food by fishing around the river, while the other two sons attend school. Her husband, Saveth, age 43, earns a living fishing along the Tunle Sap River. 

To earn a living, Loung S. either gets fish from her husband’s fishing, or buys from other fishermen, and brings the fish by boat to sell at the local fish market. Recently, many of the fishing tools were ruined, and the family’s income was affected. Therefore, Loung S. is taking out her loan to purchase essential accessories, such as nets, traps, and a boat for fishing activities.

loans.use: To purchase essential accessories, such as nets, traps, and a boat for fishing activities

loans.name: Mr. Pon Sam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of nine people is located in Pech Changva village in Takeo province. Mr. Pon S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, and they will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. 

Mr. Pon S. and his wife, Mrs. Chek Cheng, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice. On this farm, they face a problem because their field has infertile soil. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Pon S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make his crop more productive. He would use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects. Mr. Pon S. is the father of two children who are both farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is a married man of 47 years who is married to Mary Njeri, who is also in business. They have a daughter who is in college and they live in Dagoretti, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi town. 

Glenn runs a livestock farming business and he has done so for five years, accumulating a great deal of experience. He sells the cattle to the local butchers who buy them for slaughter. He also sells to other small scale traders for livestock farming and also for milk production.
 
Glenn is among the founder members of his group, and has influenced his group members to join KADET. He has received other loans from KADET and paid them off without delay. He has currently applied for a loan which he will use to add another cow to increase his herd.

He wants to become a major livestock dealer, buying and selling cattle in trucks, so that he can effectively meet the market demand.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to increase his herd

loans.name: Mrs. Kao Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Mom is the village bank president of a group of five who all live in Pech Changva village in Takeo province. She is a cart maker. Since her cart-making business is doing well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more supplies to make more carts to sell. 

Mrs. K. Mom is a widow with two children, one of whom is a fruit seller while the younger one is attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more cart-making supplies

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mr. Him H. is a villager in Thmei village in Takeo province, and he is 26 years old. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he grows rice to make a living.

His wife, Mrs. Sorn Ton, is a silk weaver. In her weaving business, she faces a problem because she does not have enough silk to weave. Thus, Mr. Him H. decided to ask for a loan for purchasing additional silk for his wife's business. 

He is the father of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school, while the other two are too young to go to school or work. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase additional silk for his wife's business.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy A. is 46 years old and he lives in Thmei village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows a rice crop to support his family. 

His wife, Mrs. Saret Chum, is a silk weaver. Since she now has more customers, she wants to expand her business. Thus, Mr. Thy A. decided to apply for a loA. to purchase additional silks. He would use the rest of the loA. to buy a watering machine and hoses to water his field. 

Mr. Thy A. is the father of four children, one of whom is a silk weaver while the other three are attending the local public school. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase additional silks and to buy a watering machine and hoses to water his field.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn C. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Brgy Gil Montilla, Sipalay City Negros Occidental. Her business is buying and selling rice, operating a farm shop, a piggery and a restaurant/carenderia.

Emelyn C.’s husband helps her run the business and they have two children who are 17 and 22 years old, respectively. The children are currently going to school and helping their parents run the business as part of their daily chores.

Emelyn C. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the family income by maintaining and growing her various businesses.  Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000 from her business activities.

Emelyn C. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 was used to fund the operations of her various businesses, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use for additional working capital and to purchase farm equipment. Emelyn C. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital and to purchase farm equipment

loans.name: Channary

texts.en: Mrs. Channary B. lives in Chonloat Da village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to make a living. She is pig breeder also. Her husband, Mr. Pech Tob, is a laborer. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Mrs. Channary B. wants to start breeding cows so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow. With the rest of the loan, she will buy additional piglets and pig food. She is a mother of three children. One of her children is attending a local public school and the other three are laborers in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow, piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Amélie

texts.fr: Née le 09 Septembre 1966, A. Amélie réside depuis sept ans au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Amélie est mariée à ANADI Dominique, un professeur de sport, et vit ensemble avec lui. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant. Le mari de Amélie assure surtout les charges de la famille ; mais Amélie lui vient parfois en aide grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Il y a environs 4 ans que Amélie s’est lancée dans la vente de charbon et de fagots de bois à son domicile. Amélie vend également des œufs, ce qui lui permet de diversifier ses sources de revenus. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Amélie s’approvisionne. Amélie a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. La clientèle de Amélie s’accroît au jour le jour ; et Amélie n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles. C’est la raison pour laquelle Amélie sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Born on September 9, 1966, Amélie A. has lived for the past seven years in the Zogbo district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Dominique Anadi, a PE teacher, and lives with him. They do not have any children. Amélie's husband usually takes care of their household expenses, but Amélie helps out sometimes with the money she makes from her business. Approximately four years ago, Amélie started selling coal and bundles of firewood at her home. She also sells eggs, which has given her an additional source of income. She buys her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already received one loan through Alidé, which she repaid in full. Her customer base is growing day by day and Amélie is unable to keep up with demand because she does not have the financial means to do so. This is why she is requesting a second loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase trays of eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. Tha N., who lives in Sophi village in Takeo province, is 40 years old. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family's living costs. Her husband, Mr. Mory Khoeum, is a palm juice collector. He is presented on the right of the photo. 

Mrs. Tha N. has obstacles in her rice farming as she has to spend more money on hiring a laborer with two cows to plow the field. Thus, Mrs. Tha N. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows so they could plow the field themselves. Mrs. Tha N. is the mother of three children two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy two cows so they can plow their field themselves

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella S. is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in the Brgy 2 in Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling frozen products (chicken, hot dogs, etc.) to her community. Her husband helps her in running the business.  They have three children aged between 12 and 26. One child is already working and helping to support the rest of the family. The other two children are currently going to school and also helping their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Bella S. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000 from her business activities.

Bella S. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to fund the operations of her business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 19th loan of Php 29,500 which she intends to use to buy inventory (frozen foods) for her business. Bella S. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.name: Sèkinatou

texts.fr: S. Sèkinatou est née en 1989 à Abomey-Calavi au Bénin. Mariée à AHOUANMAGNIMON Lawal, Sèkinatou est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Il y a un an que la famille vit à Houénoussou à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Sèkinatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Sèkinatou n'a fréquenté que le cours primaire. Depuis près de 5 ans, Sèkinatou vend du charbon de bois au marché de Sainte Rita à Cotonou. Sèkinatou vend également des bijoux pacotilles, ce qui lui permet de diversifier ses sources de revenus. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sèkinatou s'approvisionne. Sèkinatou a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé et qu'elle a bien remboursé, malgré le vol de ses marchandises dont elle a été victime au 2ème prêt. Sèkinatou souhaite rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Mais Sèkinatou ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y parvenir. C'est la raison pour laquelle Sèkinatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sèkinatou S. was born in 1989 in Abomey-Calavi in Benin. Married to Lawal Ahouanmagnimon, Sèkinatou is the mother of one child, who is in school. For the past year, the family has lived in Houénoussou in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Sèkinatou helps her husband take care of the family's expenses, thanks to the money she makes from her business. Sèkinatou only attended primary school. For nearly five years, Sèkinatou has sold charcoal at the Sainte Rita market in Cotonou. She also sells costume jewelry, which has given her an additional source of income. She buys her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Sèkinatou has already received two loans through Alidé that she repaid in full, despite being robbed of her merchandise after she received her second loan. She would like to bolster her business and better meet her customers' needs. However, she does not have the financial means to do so. This is why Sèkinatou is requesting a third loan through Alidé.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.name: Abduvosit

texts.en:
Abduvosit is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He is a humble farmer, dedicated to the production of such crops as potatoes, onions, wheat, and corn. He is encouraged when the harvest of his land is plentiful, and he wants to increase his harvests in order to attain better results. He is also aware that his vegetables have to be of a better quality in order to be able to sell them for more income. However, in order to do that, he needs to invest large amounts of money. In addition to his crops, Abduvosit is also engaged in raising livestock. He has applied to IMON International for a loan in the amount of 5,000 Somoni, which will be used both to increase his crop production and to purchase more cattle to breed.

loans.name: Abdusamat

texts.en:
Abdusamat is dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells at commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, since raising animals is the trade he has enjoyed most ever since he was a young boy. Nevertheless, Abdusamat has other jobs as well, and one of these is farming. He grows potatoes and onions in their respective seasons, and he is diligent about taking into account the bad weather that could damage his crops.

Abdusamat requires a certain amount of money in order to increase the number of his cattle. His goal is to increase his herd and thereby not only remain solvent but actually increase his household income. He wishes to continue his trade in buying and selling animals.

loans.name: Bekmat

texts.en:
Bekmat is 62 years old and the father of three children. Since 1996, he has had a livestock business. His wife and elder son help him with caring for the cows. 

Bekmat wants to increase the family's income in order to be able to improve their living conditions. He wants to purchase an additional two cows and is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD. Bekmat is a hard working man and will be able to repay the loan without any violations.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Naem

texts.en:
Mr. Naem S. is 44 years old and lives in Sam Raong village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Choeurn Brarch, are farmers who own two hectars on which to cultivate rice for living. Aside from being farmers, they are duck breeders who earn a small income to support their family. 

In order to improve and expand their breeding duck business, Naem S. is applying for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. 

Naem S. is the father of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, three who are students in the local school, while another one is too young to study or work. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim is a farmer who has been working the land for the past 11 years. There are six people in his family, including his wife and four children, all of whom are his responsibility. Educated through secondary school, he farms as his principal business activity, a job in which he has formal training. Farming has helped him financially. As you can see in the photo, Naim also is engaged in the business of raising and selling cattle. 

With the upcoming season arriving, he needs to grow potatoes and onions. This requires money, and he does not have enough. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Somoni to stock seeds and fertilizer for a successful harvest. The income will allow him to take better care of his children's health, nourishment, and schooling.

texts.en:
Hasan has owned a spare parts shop since 1985. He is married with four children, and he is the only provider of the family. He has a great demand for his spare parts, thus he wants to buy more spare parts in order to meet the demand of his clients. 

Hasan wants to take out a loan of $1,200 to buy more spare parts and expand his shop to meet the demand of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and expand his shop

loans.name: Mutahira

texts.en:
Mutahira is a hardworking entrepreneur from Istaravshan, a city in the northern part of Tajikistan. Together with her husband they have three children. She runs a business where she sells kids' shoes at the busy central market in Istaravshan. Mutahira started her business 11 years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. It is an important source of income for her family of five, considering her husband is currently unemployed.

Mutahira has requested a loan of 5,000 Somoni so that she can purchase additional inventory of winter boots for kids and to continue developing her business. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi is 54 years old and he is a hard worker. He is marrid with 3 children. Nabi has been farming since 2004. He has six years of experience, and he has been able to support his family by learning how to take care and manage his crops in the short growing season. 

Nabi aspires to have more farming equipment and more farming supplies so that he can work his land much more productively. Due to lack of funds has not been able to do so. He is asking for a loan to purchase more farming supplies, such as herbicides, fertilizer and other necessities, in order to appropriately manage his crops, and, in the end, make a profit. This request is in support of making his dream come true, and Nabi is asking for help from your generous heart.

He grows potatoes, onions, carrots, and other kinds of vegetables in his garden. O. dreams of all of his children being well-educated with a bright future. That’s why he works from early morning till late at night. He wants to borrow a loan of 4500 Somoni so he can buy mineral fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants. This request is in support of making his dream come true, and O. is asking for help from your generous heart.

loans.name: Tilov

texts.en:
Tilov is 37 years old and married with four children. Tilov is a farmer. He has been working in agriculture for four years. In that time, he has gained much experience and a love for the land. Tilov began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. He has been producing crops such as potatoes, onions, carrots and vegetables. Each year, he produces a yield sufficient for his family's consumption and for selling. At the same time, he runs a business of raising and selling cattle. 

Today he is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,500 Somoni. Tilov would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale. Tilov and his family are counting on your help. He thanks all who support him and promises to repay the loan in time.

Boikuzi has improved his financial situation because he has been able to use the loans he has received from IMON International wisely to breed his animals. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to offer animal derivates (as dairy products) in the areas surrounding his community. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows.

loans.name: Said

texts.en: S. Said is 40 years old. He is married and has four children. Said specialized in his education. His specialization is engineering but he went into agribusiness because his salary was small. Said works hard to cultivate his products such as potatoes, carrots, onions, etc. He also has a cattle shed in his house and, together with the help of his family, he raises cattle. Said works from early morning till late at night hoping to have a rich harvest. He sells in the market where his products are always in high demand due to their good quality. Said’s work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and to grow his business. Today Said is requesting a loan of $3,000 USD to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants and also some small cattle. Let's help Said as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family. loans.name: Kitto Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
M. Ibrahim is a determined man and the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is married with three children ages 2 - 13 years old and he also takes care of his parents. Ibrahim has a retail shop in the Kito trading centre and although he has a lot of competition from other traders, he is able to make profits that sustain his family as well as paying his children’s school fees.

Ibrahim is so grateful for his loans because they enable him to have increased stock as well as having quality products for sale. He wishes to become a wholesaler in future with the hope to build rental properties for an increased monthly income. Ibrahim needs a loan to be able to restock his shop with more goods.

loans.name: Valijon

texts.en: Valijon is 36 years old and living with his wife and two children. He became involved in agriculture twelve years ago, since his parents were farmers. For this reason he is giving his very best to his land, where he is busy all day long. The harvest is what gives him the most pleasure from his work, since he can pick the products that cost him so much work cultivating and caring for. Nevertheless, the most difficult thing is acquiring the mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants necessary for his plots, since these things are very expensive and they raise the level of investment required in production. Valijon draws strength from his two children, whom he supports so that they may become professionals. He wishes to invest in the various fertilizers he needs for his crops, so that he can increase his production and his profits. texts.en: S. Giyos is a very responsible man. Since his youth, he has raised livestock, specifically cows on his farm. He is a family man who is very attentive to his children. Since the Giyos have been through a difficult financial situation, he has struggled to provide an education for his 4 young children. He currently lacks the resources to buy more cows. For this reason, he has sought the support of IMON International – to obtain a loan that would allow him to purchase two cows to raise and sell meat in the region where he lives.

loans.use: Purchasing of the cows for expanding the business

loans.name: Inaya

texts.en: Inaya owns an electric motor that provides electricity for her town and its surroundings. A mother of one child, she decided to open this business because her husband is an electrician. Inaya is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase diesel fuel for the motor. She appreciates your help.

loans.use: purchase diesel fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase drinks in bulk

loans.name: Rabbim

texts.en: S. Rabbim is 49 years old. He is married and has two children. Rabbim is a hard-working man who has fought educate his children and provide for his family. His children are now working adults thanks to his example. Rabbim has much experience in sheep breeding because he observed it from a young age. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance in the form of investing in his business to allow him to buy more sheep. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow. Rabbim applied for a loan to buy small sheep. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you will provide them by helping him continue his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchasing small sheep to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old single man living with his parents and three brothers. He has owned a car repair shop since 2008 where he provides services to his village and the neighboring villages. In addition, he sells engine oil in his shop.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,200 to buy more engine oil and needed repair tools.

loans.use: To buy more engine oil and needed repair tools

loans.name: Sifatmo

texts.en: Sifatmo is the divorced mother of two adult children. She has been selling women’s clothing in the central city market for about five years, running her own small venture successfully. The secret of her success is simple: she tries to not only let her customers know the benefits of her products, she also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, Sifatmo doesn’t want to stop where she is at with her venture. She is seeking a loan of $800 USD to re-stock the merchandise in her store. We believe that Sifatmo’s desire to excel in pleasing her customers will encourage new customers to buy from her and determine her further success. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: R. Gulbahor is 33 years old, is married, and is the mother of three children. Gulbahor’s lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as a taxi driver didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her children. This was the reason that she decided to start her own business four years ago selling the fabrics of the national dresses. Little by little Gulbahor has made her business grow and, by allowing her clients to pay in installments, her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally. However, Gulbahor would like to continue bettering her household so that her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of $800 with which she will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses. The power to help her business to grow is in your hands. loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela, vive en la avenida Florida de la zona Munaypata de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres.

Trabaja en una empresa de servicios como cajera, en una de las zonas céntricas de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de medicamentos y operación de una de sus hermanas menores la cual se encuentra muy delicada de salud y debe ser operada con urgencia.

Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito, además del carácter social del mismo.
texts.en:
Pamela lives on Florida Avenue in the Munaypata area of the city of La Paz. She is single, and she lives in her parents’ house. She works as a cashier for a service business in one of the central areas of the city. The loan is to buy medicine and pay for an operation for one of her younger sisters. Her sister is in very delicate health, and she urgently needs the operation. This is her third loan with Impro. The completed evaluation and her good character qualify her for the loan

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Ali Aboubakrine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ali Aboubakrine D.  sociétaire  d’U-IMCEC Thiès  sollicite  un crédit de 100 000 FCFA  payable sur 10 mois pour entamer une activité en bonne marche dans la ville. Il compte  se lancer dans l’aviculture, un domaine qu’il maitrise assez bien et qu’il a géré pendant longtemps  pour  les affaires d’un de ses frères. Pour ce montant, Monsieur D. va construire un local et démarrer l’activité avec 50 poussins.  
Cet homme, Monsieur Ali Aboubakrine D., célibataire et père d’un enfant de 07 mois, est un mécanicien de formation et il est âgé de 37 ans.
Depuis qu’il a quitté le service militaire, il y’a 9 ans, Monsieur D. a abandonné la mécanique pour se trouver du boulot dans les entreprises. C’est ainsi qu’il est devenu  aide-agent  commercial dans une société qui a une antenne à Thiès ville située à 70 Kms  de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal. Il est également agent de sécurité pour les  week-end et jours fériés dans un organisme international  sis à Thiès. 
Ainsi, avec ce premier financement, Monsieur Ali Aboubakrine D. verra ses revenus augmentés et s’auto employer afin d’être indépendant par rapport aux contraintes rencontrées très souvent dans ses lieux de travail.
texts.en:
Ali Aboubakrine D., a member of the U-IMCEC Thiès, requests a loan of 100 000 FCFA, to pay back in ten months, in order to start a new business. After working for years for one of his brothers, he has developed a considerable experience in poultry, so he wants to build a chickens coop and start the business with 50 poussins. Ali Aboubakrine D., single and father of a seven months child, is 37 and a trained mechanic. After leaving the army nine years ago, he stopped working as a mechanic to find a job in a company. So he has become commercial assistant agent for a company branch in Thiès, 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Week-ends and holidays he also works as security agent for an international organization based in Thiès. Thank to this first loan Ali Aboubakrine D. will be able to increase his revenue and become self-employed and free from the constraints he has to face in his working place.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a chickens coop and purchase poussins.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 21-year-old single man. He has owned a car repair shop since 2002. He received training for this job when he has young, from a friend. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,000 because he is planning to expand his business by buying more tools.

loans.use: For buying more tools.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El banco D. Emprendimiento " RENACER "  se encuentra en su cuarto  ciclo  todas las integrantes han demostrado ser personas responsables, cumplidas  y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias:
Como Presidenta esta la Sra. Daysi quien es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. shampu y  ambula en la cancha los dìas D. feria, Esta casada  y tiene 3 hijos con esta actividad ella mantiene el hogar y el estudio D. sus hijos. 

Como Tesorera esta la  Sra.Donata esta casada y tiene 3 hijos su negocio es  venta D. verduras  quien demostrò ser  una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas.

La secretaria es la Sra. Mirian quien es casada y  tiene un hijo,  tiene el negocio D. venta verduras,  y es una persona  activa y motivadora.

Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The "RENACER" communal bank is in its fourth loan cycle; all of its members have shown themselves to be responsible, hard-working people. The group is represented by the following: Daysi, president, is the leader and founding member; she sells shampoo and, on feast days, she peddles her wares in the square. She is married and has three children. Her work supports the household and provides education for her children. Donata, treasurer, is married and has three children. She sells vegetables and has demonstrated being a very responsible and punctual person with regard to repayments. Mirian, secretary, is married and has one son. She sells vegetables and is an active and motivating person. They are grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for trusting them enough to grant the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Ayya

texts.en:
Ayya S. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts paste in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell. Ayya is 35 years old and she is widowed. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a groundnut store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Tako

texts.en:
Tako A. is currently in the business of selling sugar in the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar to sell. Tako is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 27-year-old man. He has been working as a farmer since 2002. His region is specified I agriculture. He learned this job a long time ago. Today, Jean is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy agriculture products and supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To buy agriculture products and supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Kiko

texts.en:
Kiko M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, groundnut paste and beer. She is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and bags of charcoal to sell. Kiko is 35 years old and is widowed. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business.

loans.name: Zalfa

texts.en: Zalfa is a 24-year-old, married woman with one child. She has owned a clothes shop since 2008 in her village. After being well known in the whole region, Zalfa is asking to borrow $1,000 to expand her inventory for the winter and to provide a bigger choice of clothes to her clients.

loans.use: To expand her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Tania Gloria's Group

texts.es:
EL banco de emprendimiento AMAZONAS esta formado en la zona de Alto Seguencoma (la rinconada) ingresan en su quinta secuencia de trabajo sin tener problema de pago.

Las reuniones la realizan en la casa de la presidenta la Sra. Tania quien tiene su tienda de barrio en la misma zona  vive con su hermana quien tambien integra el grupo la Sra. Ingrid que es ejecutiva de ventas en una empresa. Conforman su mesa directiva Mery que trabaja en una pension, Jhudith que es trabajadora del hogar. Son personas que se conocen entre si y con distintas actividades como la sra. Sabina que da servicio en el preparado de comida, la sra Miriam  se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y otros, y el sr Eduardo que hace trabajos de cerrajeria en el mismo domicilio. tambien son parte del grupo Salome que realiza trabajos como empleada del hogar, Martha que trabaja como cocinera en la policia, Edgar  se dedica al mantenimiento y reparacion de computadoras, el Sr Juan que trabaja como chofer y por ultimo la sra Erika  que reparte viveres por la misma zona.  						
				
Todos los integrantes estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The AMAZONAS communal bank is in the Alto Seguencoma zone (La Rinconada) and is starting its fifth loan cycle; they have never had a problem with their repayments. Meetings are held in Tania's house. She has a neighborhood grocery store and lives with her sister, Ingrid, who is also a group member; Ingrid is a sales executive with a company. The governing board is made up of Mery, who works at a boarding house, Jhudith who is a domestic worker. They are all people who are well known among themselves and have different lines of work. For example, Sabina prepares meals, Miriam sells salchipapas (French fries with fried hot dog sausages) and others, and Eduardo, who is a locksmith in the same location. Also members of the group are: Salome, who works as a domestic, Martha, who is a cook at the police station, Edgar, who services and repairs computers, Juan, who is a taxi driver, and Erika who distributes groceries in the same area. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting them and granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Gladys Esther

texts.es:
Gladys A. de 31 años, vive en una casa de cemento solo con luz como servicio básico, su casa esta ubicada en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja como mecánico con el tiene 4 hijos de 15, 11, 8 y una niña de 6 años todos estudiando en escuelas particulares.

Gladys hace 1 año atrás empezó ha adecuo su casa para poder vender los productos de Yanbal y Avon, poco a poco comenzó a tener buenos ingresos e implemento cosas de bazar. Ahora ella trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, su hijo le ayuda atendiendo el bazar mientras que ella sale a vender algunos productos. Una de las mayores dificultades son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere perfumes, maquillajes, peluches para tener más variedad en el negocio. En el futuro ella aspira a tener otro bazar y así poder ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys A., 31, lives in a cement house in an outlying area of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Electricity is the only basic service. Her husband works as a mechanic, and they have four boys aged 15, 11, and 8, and a 6-year-old girl. All the children study in private schools. One year ago, Gladys began to adapt her house to be able to sell Yanbal and Avon products. Little by little she increased her earnings and added household products to her inventory. Now, she works every day starting very early. Her son helps her, attending to the store while she goes on sales calls. One of her biggest difficulties is the rain. With this loan, Gladys will buy perfumes, makeup, and stuffed toys, to offer more variety in the business. In the future, she would like to have another store and in this way help her children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, makeup, and stuffed toys

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora YOLANDA, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 37 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos, (14, 13, 4, 4 meses) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de quinua con trotas, la elaboración de la quinua es un todo un proceso,  (se escoge los granos, se lavan en 4 aguas limpias, se coloca en la olla y se deja hervir por al menos 30 minutos, después se licua con manzana verde picada y esto es acompañado caliente con leche, es un desayuno nutritivo a esto nuestra socia prepara tortas de diferentes sabores y sándwich para acompañar esto se vende en varios barrios en las esquinas desde las 6:00 am de la mañana hasta las 9:00 a.m.), resultando un delicioso desayuno y energético. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio
 
La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our borrower is YOLANDA, who belongs to the “MUJERES UNIDAS” ("Women United") communal bank. She comes from the city of Cusco. Yolanda is 37 years old and married, with four children who are 14, 13, 4, and 4 months old. She divides her time between her household activities and her retail business. She has a small sales stand where she sells quinua and cakes. Preparing the quinua is an involved process (sorting the grains, washing the quinua in 4 changes of water, placing it in a pot and boiling it for at least 30 minutes). After that, it is processed in a blender with chopped green apple and served hot with milk. It is a nutritious breakfast, and Yolanda also prepares cakes of various flavors and sandwiches to go along with the quinua. This food is sold in various neighborhoods on the corners between 6 and 9 in the morning. The result is a delicious breakfast that provides plenty of energy. Yolanda is requesting a loan so she can reinvest in her small business. Yolanda reports that she is grateful and happy for the opportunity to continue expanding her business, and she is committed to making her loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies for her business

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora MARISOL, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, (16, 13, 4) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con  la administración de su combi, ella es empresaria tiene en la ruta de Cusco Cabildo una línea de combis que prestan el servicio de transporte a los ciudadanos, ella está en este negocio desde hace 7 años y le va muy bien, ahora ella socita el préstamo para hacer mantenimientos de sus trasportes, deberá comprar algunos repuestos entre otros.

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marisol belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women). She is originally from Cuzco. Marisol is 32 years old, married, and has three children (aged 16, 13 and 4). Marisol alternates her domestic duties with running a fleet of minibuses that help transport local people around the city. Marisol has been running this business for 7 years and it is going very well. She needs a loan to help with maintenance of the vehicles and to buy some spare parts, amongst other things. Marisol is very grateful and happy for the opportunity to expand her business and is committed to the stipulations of the loan repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her transportation business.

loans.name: La Solucion 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Wanda is the coordinator of her group, L. Solucion (The Solution), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican Republic (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients in general. Her group is located in the Samana penninsuL., a lush mountainous area with a budding tourism industry. The running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable in this area. Wanda makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child.

Wanda is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She will be purchasing men's and women's shoes as well as pants and shirts. Her business model is to carry these items on her head and seek out her clients in the street. She has several regular clients but also makes one-time sales. She plans to use the profits to invest in her family and business by purchasing a "passoL." or scooter. This purchase will facilitate mobility. She will also purchase books and notebooks for her child. Her long-term goal is to own her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Women's and men's shoes, shirts and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora ISABEL, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, (28, 26, 12) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con  la administración de su combis, ella es empresaria tiene sus combis en la ruta de Cusco Cabildo, prestan el servicio de transporte diarios a los ciudadanos, la socia tiene este negocio desde hace 15 años y lo conoce a la perfección su deseo es incrementar un par de combis mejorados. Nuestra socia socita el préstamo para hacer mantenimientos de sus carros y comprar algunos repuestos.

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
