Isabel was born in the city of Cusco and is a member of the Mujeres Unidas Communal Bank. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children, aged 28, 26, and 12. Isabel alternates her household activities with the administration of her rickshaw business. She operates rickshaws along the Cusco Cabildo route, offering daily transportation services to the citizens. Isabel has had this business for 15 years and she knows it to perfection. Her goal is to expand with a pair of improved rickshaws. Isabel is requesting a loan to pay for maintenance of her rickshaws and to purchase replacement parts.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY REPLACEMENT PARTS FOR HER RICKSHAWS

loans.name: Imad El Dine

texts.en: Imad El Dine is a 21-year-old single man, living with his parents. He has owned a barber shop since 2007. He cooperates with his father to support the household. The young man caters to a wide range of clientele in their village and neighboring villages. Today, Imad El Dine wishes to improve the decor of his barbershop and buy more tools. In order to do so, Imad El Dine is requesting $1,200.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his barbershop and buy more tools

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora ZULMA, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos, (18, 12, 10, 6) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con  la compra y venta desde hace 5 años de cosméticos de belleza para damas y artículos para caballeros, nuestra socia vende por catálogos sus productos, en está ocasión la socia solicita el préstamo para poder apoyar a su esposo con la compra de una maquinaria de soldadura, el esposo tiene un taller y están comprando poco a poco las diferentes herramientas de trabajo. 

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Zulma belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas." She is a native of the city of Cusco. She is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 18, 12, 10 and 6. Zulma alternates her activities in the home with the purchase and sale of beauty products and cosmetics for women and items for men; she has had this business for 5 years. She sells her products through catalogs. At this time she requests a loan so that she can help her husband with the purchase of a welding machine. Her husband has a workshop, and little by little, he is acquiring various tools for his work. Zulma is grateful, and expresses her satisfaction in being able to continue growing her own business. She pledges to make the payments on her debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she requests a loan to help her husband buy machinery for his welding workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Amira Saturnina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora AMIRA, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, (15, 12) años de edad, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con  la compra y venta de zapatos y ropa al por mayor y esta a su vez la vende todos los sábados en el baratillo, lugar dónde se encuentra absolutamente casi todo, nuestra socia tiene 3 años trabajando con este negocio, Ella solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en este negocio y de este modo seguir sacando a sus hijitos adelante y cubrir los gastos que se vienen con relación a los estudios y otras necesidades básicas. 

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our business partner is Amira. She belongs to the community bank "Mujeres Unidas" ("Women United"). She is from Cusco. Amira is a 33 year-old single mother with two boys, ages 12 and 15. She alternates her work as a homemaker with buying and selling shoes and clothes wholesale. She sells them every Saturday at the flea market, a place where you can find absolutely anything. Amira has done this for three years. She is asking for a loan to invest in her business so she can keep bringing up her children properly and cover the costs related to their studies and other basic needs. Amira appreciates and expresses her satisfaction with being able to continue growing her own business. She promises to fulfill her loan payments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes and clothes wholesale to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein has owned a car repair shop in his village since 1994. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his two children's needs. Today, Hussein is requesting $1,000 to buy additional tools for his job.

loans.use: To buy additional tools

loans.name: Carla Lilian

texts.es:
La Sra. Carla vive en la zona de San  Pedro de nuestra ciudad, en la calle Julio Sanches, ella trabaja como cajera de una entidad financiera y aprovecha su contacto con las personas para dedicarse a su segunda actividad que es el comercio de ropa. Ella es madre soltera de tres hijas mujeres y trata de salir adelante por ellas, es una persona que esta activa y esta siempre con las ganas de hacer todo tipo de negocio con ropa de temporada y de muy buena calidad. esta muy contenta de poder incrementar su capital de trabajo comprando mercaderia.						
						
La Sra. Carla esta agradecida con Emprender y  Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Carla lives in the San Pedro area of our city, on Julio Sanches Street. She works as a teller at a financial services institution. Contact with people in this job allows her to engage in another business, specifically, clothing sales. She is a single mother, with three daughters, for whose sake she would like to be successful. She is active, always looking for business with seasonal, high-quality clothing. She is happy at the prospect of increasing her working capital by purchasing merchandise. Carla is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their faith in her, shown by granting her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nelly Ludgarda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora NELLY, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 66 años de edad es viuda, tiene 3 hijos, (35, 34, 30) años de edad, La socia es profesora cesante, ella alterna sus actividades cotidianas con la venta de ropa y hoy en día para seguir en actividad laboral vende productos de belleza por catálogo, nuestra socia es una señora muy alegre y optimista, la socia solicita el préstamo para adquirir productos de belleza y almacenarlos de este modo siempre tendrá lo que le pidan en cuanto a perfumes y otros cosméticos. 

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our business partner is Nelly. She belongs to the community bank "Mujeres Unidas" ("Women United"). She is originally from Cusco. Nelly is 66 years-old. She is widowed with three children, who are 30, 34, and 35 years old. She is an unemployed professor. She alternates her day-to-day activities with clothing sales. Currently, she is selling beauty products from a catalog to continue her business. Nelly is a very happy and optimistic woman. She is asking for a loan to acquire beauty products and store them; this way she will always have the perfumes and other cosmetics her customers request in stock. Nelly appreciates the ability to be able to continue growing her own business. She promises to repay her loan payment in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cosmetics from a catalog to stock and sell

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es: Don Isidoro es un padre de familia muy dedicado a su familia, casado y con cinco hijos que su esposa dio, de los cuales solo dos estudian ya que los otros ya se casaron, el señor Isidoro  tiene un taxi que es su fuente de trabajo desde hace quince años, cuando inicio lo hizo con un taller de mecánica, pero luego nace la idea de comprar el carro el cual, día a día recorre la capital de Managua ofreciendo su servicio de taxi, el cual en los últimos meses están malas las carrera debido a la alza del combustible ya que los clientes a veces no quieren pagar la carrera cara. A si como hay día muy buenos. Su esposa vende fritanga por las noches para mejorar los ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos del agua y luz. Con este préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como: cerámica, zinc y perlines para construir la cocina y poder gozar de las mejoras y esfuerzos de trabajo. Sus mejores deseos es poder cambiar de unidad de taxi para poder atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Isidoro is a father very dedicated to his family. He is married with five children, of whom only two are in school studying as the other ones have already married. Mr. Isidoro has a taxi, which has been his source of income for the past fifteen years. When he started to work he worked in a mechanic shop, but then he got the idea to buy a car. Every day, he drives around the capital of Managua offering taxi services. For the past few months, business has not been going well because the rise in gas prices has made some customers unwilling to pay the increased trip costs. But there are still very good days. Mr. Isidoro's wife sells fried food at night to increase the income and allow them to cover the household costs of water and electricity. With this loan, the couple wants to buy construction materials like ceramic, zinc, and metal beams to build a kitchen so they are able to enjoy the benefits and efforts of the wife's work. The couple's biggest desire is to be able to change the unit of the taxi so they can attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: Luz Carlota

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora LUZ CARLOTA, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años de edad es casada, tiene 5 hijos, (35, 31, 30, 26, 22) años de edad, La socia es profesora cesante, ella alterna sus actividades de rutina con la venta de ropa, nuestra socia viaja a traer del norte mercadería y así vender en la ciudad del Cusco, trae también según le hagan pedidos a sus clientas como alguna prenda en especial y diferentes artículos para combinar sus prendas, la socia es una señora muy cariñosa y después de pasar a jubilarse decidió mantenerse en actividad física y quiso poner este negocio el cual le trae muchas satisfacciones, ahora requiere el préstamo para capital de negocio, ella traerá nueva mercadería para este invierno en Cusco. 

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our business partner is Luz Carlota. She belongs to the community bank "Mujeres Unidas" ("Women United"). She is from Cusco. Luz Carlota is 55 years-old and married with five children, who are 22, 26, 30, 31, and 35 years-old. She is an unemployed professor who alternates her daily activities with clothing sales. She travels to bring merchandise from the north to sell in Cusco. She also brings things based on her customers' requests, like a special outfit or different pieces to combine with outfits. Luz Carlota is a very caring woman. After retiring she decided to maintain good physical shape and go into this business, which has brought her a lot of satisfaction. Luz Carlota needs a loan to increase her capital. She will bring new merchandise for winter in Cusco. She is very grateful to be able to continue growing her own business and promises to complete her loan payments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes wholesale to sell

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Doña Ana  es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo, se caso joven, procreo tres hijos, que cursan los estudios. Su esposo trabaja como contador y ha sido muy bondadoso, cuando inicio su negocio era de recorrido para estudiante ya que tenia un bus pequeño que su esposo había comprado con ahorros.  El cual con las ganancias comenzó hacer frescos para vender en su casa de todos los sabores para obtener otros ingresos y poder ajustar con los pagos básicos del hogar como: agua, luz, teléfono, estudios entre otros gastos del bus. Mas tarde nace la iniciativa de vender comida a los trabajadores de la empresa que queda en frente de su vivienda. Lo cual fue hablar con el propietario y trabajadores para ofrecer sus servicios de venta de comida el cual la empresa le da el local del comedor para poder atender en las mejores condiciones a sus trabajadores, el cual fue un buen inicio ya que no le cobran el alquiler y vende su comida el cual da la quincena a si como al contado. Lo que desea con esta inversión es poder aumentar la venta de variedad de comida, comprara: carne, pollo, arroz, frijoles, aceite, condimentos, lacteos, gaseosas, desea comprar repostería, golosinas, comprar utensilios nuevo para preparar los alimentos y poder dar cada día un mejor servicio. Siendo su primer crédito en la institución da las gracias por apoyar al pequeño comerciante.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman very dedicated to her work. She married young and had three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is an accountant and has been very generous. When she began working, her husband bought her a small bus with their savings so she could drive a route for students. With the revenue made from the bus, she started selling different flavored drinks out of her home to have another source of income to help pay basic household costs like water, electricity, telephone, and school as well as bus costs. Later she had the idea to sell food to the workers of the office in front of her house. She talked to the owner and the workers in the building and offered her services. The business let her use the cafeteria to be able to attend the workers. It was a good start because they do not charge her rent and she can sell her food, which allows her to get paid biweekly and with cash. With this loan Ana hopes to be able to increase the variety of food she sells. She will buy meat, chicken, rice, beans, oil, condiments, dairy products, and soft drinks. She wants to buy baked goods and sweets and new utensils for preparing the food so she can give better service each day. This is her first loan, and she is grateful for the support given to a small businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food to increase sales

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 49-year-old married man with seven children, four of whom are unemployed. He has been working as a building contractor since 1974. Because of his experience, he has become very well-known in the whole region. Today, Mohamad is requesting $600 to buy wood to improve the quality of his construction projects.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Fatima Raquel

texts.es:
Fátima F. de 33 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil su vivienda es mixta de caña y ladrillos. Ya hace 2 años no esta casada pero tiene 2 hijos todos estudiando en escuelas particulares.
  
Fátima empezó estudiando belleza en un curso, después de eso pudo conseguir trabajar en un gabinete de belleza. Fátima con todos los conocimientos adquiridos se independizó. Ahora ella trabaja todos lo días de las 08h30 hasta las 22h00 prestando los servicios de tinturados de cabello, tratamientos, etc. Las dificultades que tiene en su negocio son las lluvias y los racionamientos de energía que hace el gobierno.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  144 tintes, 150 shampoo y 80 tratamientos para poder agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere tener otro gabinete de belleza a las afueras del  sector por donde vive.
texts.en:
Fatima F. is 33 years old and lives near the Perimetral highway that circles Guayaquil. Her home is built with a mixture of reeds and bricks. She has not been married for 2 years, but she has 2 children who are studying in private schools. Fatima started studying beauty in a class, after this she was able to get a job in a beauty parlor. With this knowledge, Fatima became independent with her own salon. Now she works every day from 8:30 in the morning until 10:00pm, providing services such as hair coloring, hair treatments, etc. Some difficulties in her business are the rains and also the rationing of energy by the government. With this loan she wants to buy 144 hair dyes, 150 units of shampoo, and 80 units of hair treatments so that she can expand her business. In the future she wants to have another beauty parlor in the outskirts of the neighborhood where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, hair treatments and shampoo

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: La señora Inés tiene 47 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería y venta de cosméticos, el cual ha vendido durante dieciocho años, casada y con tres hijos que procreo dos estudian y uno trabaja,  ella trabajaba en una empresa de Nicalit y con su liquidación fue que puso la pequeña venta. En estos meses las ventas han sido baja por eso desea aumentar la variedad de productos como: carne, pollo, lácteos, gaseosas, verdura, frutas y cosméticos. Para poder elevar las ventas y poder atraer la clientela con el objetivo de poder ver mejores ganancias. A futuro desea remodelar su casa ya que le falta poner el piso ya que aun es de tierra y no le ha alcanzado para hacer las mejoras.  Este es su onceavo crédito y esta sastifecha por que ha logrado, mantener su pequeño negocio. También desea apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan lograr terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Inés is 47 years old and has a small local store. Also, she sells cosmetics, which she has done for 18 years. She is married with three children, two of whom study and one who works. She used to work for a company called Nicalit, but after she was let go, she set up her business. In recent months, her sales have lowered. Therefore, she wishes to increase her variety of products, such as: beef, chicken, dairy products, soda, vegetables, fruits, and cosmetics. In this way she will be able to attract a greater clientele and elevate her sales and earnings. In the future, she hopes to remodel her house, since it has an earthen floor, and she has not been able to afford the improvements. This is her eleventh credit, and she is satisfied because she has managed to maintain her small business. She also wishes to support her children, so that they can finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beef, chicken, dairy products, soda, vegetables, and cosmetics to increase sales

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El Sr. German, tiene un taller de chaperio, ubicado en la zona de chasquipampa, él juntamente con su esposa se dedican a este trabajo, ellos tienen dos hijos pequeños en edad escolar, son una pareja joven, que con sus ahorros y los créditos se compraron una movilidad, que lo trabaja el Sr. German en sus ratos libres, especialmente por la noche, ellos viven por la zona de Coqueni en un terreno dotado por los padres, donde construyeron una pequeña vivienda, son clientes antiguos y buenos con sus pagos.						
El Sr. German esta agradecido con Emprender y  Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Sr. German operates a metal shop in the District of Chasquipampa. He and his wife manage this business together. They have two young children in school. German and his wife are a young couple who used their savings and some loans to purchase a vehicle that he uses in his free time, especially at night. They live in the District of Coqueni where they have built a house on a plot a land given to them by his parents. German is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motor for his car

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora LUZ MARINA, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 61 años de edad es casada, tiene 3 hijos, (39, 37, 31) años de edad, La socia tiene un pequeño hospedaje , que apertura en su casa propia ubicado en el barrio de Quispicanchis en la misma ciudad del Cusco, nuestra socia está terminando de ampliar dos baños en su casa para mayor comodidad y solicita para ello el préstamo, el cual le permitirá terminar con los acabados de los baños, nuestra socia trabaja con turismo y le encanta recibirlos en sus casas, ella recibe especialmente voluntarios que viene al país hacer sus aportes y conocedora de lo que les gusta trata de cubrir con los deseos de sus huéspedes. 

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member is Señora LUZ MARINA, belonging to the communal bank “Women United”, living in the city of Cusco. She is 61, married, with 3 children ages 39, 37, and 31. She has a small guest house opening into her own house in the Quispicanchis neighborhood of Cusco. She is requesting a loan to finish enlarging the bathrooms in her house for increased convenience. The loan will allow her to put the finishing touches in the bathrooms. Working in tourism, she enjoys receiving people into her house, especially volunteers who come to invest in the country. She is expert in pleasing her guests and tries to satisfy their requests. She is grateful and satisfied to be able to grow her own business, and she commits to repay her loan within the agreed period.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the upgrade of two bathrooms in her guest house

loans.name: Ivan Marcelino

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es el señor IVAN, el pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, el socio es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 25 años de edad es soltero, y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, el socio desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar, el era cobrador (boletero) de combis y el trabajo arduo le dio la oportunidad de ahorrar un capital de trabajo para comprar su propia combi de segunda mano y es así que el mismo empezó a conducirla y sacando todos sus papeles en regla se dedicó al transporte local en servicio de la sociedad, nuestro socio ahora solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de sus carro y comprar aceite y estas cosas que le permitirán mantener su carrito en optimas condiciones. 

El socio  agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señor Ivan belongs to the communal bank “Women United”, he lives in the city of Cusco. He is 25 and single, and very eager to get ahead. He started working at a very young age as a ticket collector on a mini-bus, and hard work gave him the opportunity to accumulate working capital to buy his own second-hand mini-bus. He started driving it, taking care of all the paperwork properly, becoming a provider of local transport. He is requesting a loan for the maintenance of his vehicle, to buy oil and those things that will enable him to keep his van in the best condition. He expresses his gratitude and satisfaction to be able to grow his own business, and he commits himself to make the payments on the agreed schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the maintenance of his commercial vehicle

loans.name: Eleazar Rafael

texts.es:
El joven Eleazar tiene 25 años de edad, desde joven aprendió hacer sastre ya que ha sido el negocio de la familia. Es soltero y viven en Villa Reconciliación, junto a sus padres, sus deseos es poder seguir estudiando en la universidad como muchos jóvenes para lograr mejores condiciones económicas. Leva nueve años de experiencia en la costura hacen todos los estilos en general negocio que ahora solo administra con su mama ya que anteriormente eran varios socios con la familia. Quiere compra muchas telas variadas de colores, para hacer los trajes de dama como pantalones de hombre, niños a si como también comprar ziper, botones, madeja para los bordes, hilos, tela para manteles y
Cobertores todo con el objetivos de mejorar las ventas, también en este mes hace uniforme ya que se venden mucho por los estudiantes que entran  a clases. Su meta es poder invertir cada día en el negocio de su costura para mantener un buen margen y así poder cubrir sus gastos de estudio.
texts.en:
Young Eleazar, 25, learned tailoring in the family business while still young. He is single, living in Villa Reconciliación with his parents. His wish is, like many young people, to keep studying at the university in order to better himself economically. He has had nine years of sewing experience, making every style. Currently he runs the business with his mother, although formerly other family members helped out. He wants to buy fabrics of varied colors to make womens dresses and pants for men and children. He also needs to buy supplies such as zippers, buttons, borders, thread, and fabric for table cloths, all with the objective of improving sales. This time of year he also makes uniforms, which he sells a lot of to students beginning their studies. His goal is to invest every day in his tailoring business for a good profit to cover the expenses of his education.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics  to make clothing for women, men and children, as well as zippers, buttons, borders, thread, and fabric for table cloths

loans.name: Yanet Doris

texts.es: La Sra. Yanet Doris H. F. de 27 años de edad, es madre soltera con una hija menor.Tiene casa propia de material de adobe ubicada en el Caserío de San Antonio. Trabaja como obrera de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 2 años de experiencia. Adicionalmente recibe otros ingresos de una pensión mensual por parte del padre de su hija. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Senora Yanet Doris H. F., 27, is a single mother with a young daughter. She has her own adobe home in the town of San Antonio. She has 2 years experience as a farm laborer in an agroindustrial business. She also receives monthly support from the father of her daughter. She is a hard-working person who has earned what she has through hard work. She needs a loan to finish the construction of her home. Her dream is to complete her home with the goal of a better quality of life. She is very thankful for the help we are able to give her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Maribel  Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maribel  del Carmen M. R., de 30 años de edad habita en  el barrio Pilas orientales, es casada y su esposo se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, el cual le brinda un aporte mensual para los gastos del hogar, en los tiempos libres le apoya en los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tiene 3 hijos entre las edades de 12, 10, 8, los hijos estudian la escuela primaria, la familia ha considerado la posibilidad de emprender un negocio de venta de carnes, estos planes serian a un futuro inmediato, pero para poder idealizar esto la señora M. que se dedica al cultivo de la piña, desea invertir este capital a la finca en la compra  cultivos mejorados, tales como fertilizantes, con el objetivo de mejorar el manejo agronómico a su cultivo, con esta ayuda la señora Maribel podría realzar la ideas de abrir su propio negocio el que les traería mejores condiciones económicas para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Señora Maribel del Carmen M. R., 30, lives in the Pilas Orientales area. She is married, and her husband works as a security guard, providing the monthly income for household expenses. In his free time he helps with the farm work. They have 3 children ages 12, 10 and 8, attending primary school. The family is considering the possibility of opening a meat-selling business in the near future, but in order to realize this, Señora M., who grows pineapples, needs to invest capital in the farm for improved crops and fertilizers, with the goal of improving the agricultural management of their farm. With this help, Señora Maribel will be able to open her own business, which will bring better economic conditions to the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señora Maria Cristina F., de 45 años de edad vive en la comunidad Sandino, es soltera y a futuro planea viajar a Panamá para traer mercadería y venderla a precios accesibles, con esta ayuda ella podrá abrirse a un campo laboral y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, actualmente ella se dedica a la agricultura y desea solicitar de un crédito para comprar fertilizantes y brindarle a la producción un mejor mantenimiento que lograría la venta rápida del cultivo trayéndole la recuperación del capital invertido, lográndole la oportunidad de abrirse un camino hacia nuevos negocios.
texts.en:
Miss Maria Cristina F. is 45 years old and lives in the Sandino community. She is single and in the future she is planning to travel to take some products to Panama and to sell it at accesible prices. With this aid she will be able to move into the workforce and have her own source of income. Currently she is devoted to agriculture and she is asking for credit to purchase fertilizers to improve the quality of her produce which would allow for a quick sale, giving her a return on the capital invested, and the opportunity to take on new businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural products

loans.name: Achachairu Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento ACHACHAIRU fue fundada el dia miercoles 15 de julio del 2009 en las oficinas de emprender del plan 3000 cuando se reunieron 11 señoras todas ellas de la zona del Quior que viven entre la calle numero 1 y 2 que actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo, todas ellas se agruparon y pagan cuotas quincenales y las reuniones lo realizn en las oficinas de Emprender del plan 3000 a horas 15:00 PM. 
La Señoras desean aumentar capital a sus negocios muchas de ellas son ambulates que no tienen puesto fijo

La Sra. Yessenia es una de las socias fundadoras es casada sus hijos ya son mayores de edad su marido trabaja en COPAAGUS. ella se dedica a la elaboracion de empanadas, salteñas, Pan y ella lo vende en la puerta de su casa y los hace ambular a algunos muchachos de su barrio. 

La Señora Ana Maria tambien es una socia fundadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa interior ella compra de la feria de Barrio lindo y va ofreciendo barrio por barrio y algunas veces deja a credito y de esta manera cuadyuba en el bienestar de su familia, no solamente se decica ha eso tambien es promotora de cosmeticos.

La Señora Seli  es una socia nueva que ingreso en el segundo ciclo es soltera y tien un hijo ella es muy dinamica que se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños que va ambulando y dejando al credito en cada barrio de la ciudad de Santa Cruz esa es su actividad principal y como una actividad secundaria es promotora de portones que conbina esta acividad con la venta de ropas y a al vez va ofreciendo las dos cosas   						
						
Todos los integrantes estan agradecidos con Emprender  y  Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Achachairu Communal Bank was founded on Wednesday, July 15, 2009 at the offices of Emprender as part of “Plan 3000”. The group consists of eleven members who are from the district of Quior and live between #1 and #2 Streets. They are currently in their second loan cycle and get together every two weeks to make their loan payments and conduct their meetings at the Emprender offices at 3PM. The members greatly desire to increase their operating capital. Many of them are traveling vendors who do not have established retail locations.

Sra. Yessenia is one of the founding members. She is married and has adult children. Her husband works for COPAAGUS. She prepares empanadas, salteñas, and bread and sells them from the doorstep of her house. In addition, she provides these items to a few young men to sell in the neighborhood.

Sra. Ana Maria is also a founding member. She sells undergarments that she acquires from the Barrio Lindo Fair. Ana Maria travels from neighborhood to neighborhood to offer her products, sometimes selling them on credit. This is not the only business she manages. In order to provide for the welfare of her family, she also sells cosmetics.

Sra. Seli is a new member who is participating in this second loan cycle. She is a single mother with one child. Seli is a dynamic woman who sells children’s clothing as a street vendor and offers her merchandise on credit. She visits each district in the city of Santa Cruz. Selling clothes is her main business, but she also runs a second business selling doors. Sometimes she is able to run both businesses as the same time.

All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena E. de 59 años de edad vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino, es modista desde mucho tiempo atrás, hace poco tiempo tuvo la mala fortuna de haber perdido a su madre, este deceso  le ha  traído a su vida la decisión de terminar con las remodelaciones en su vivienda y que le pueda brinde la seguridad y la comodidad necesaria para vivir en  un mejor porvenir, con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción para continuar con la reconstrucción de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Elena E. is 59 years old and lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood, and she has been a dressmaker for a while. She recently had the misfortune of losing her mother, this has brought her to take the decision to finish with the remodeling of her home so that she has the security and comfort to live better. With this loan she will purchase construction materials to keep rebuilding her home.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel her home

loans.name: Alexis Genaro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es el señor ALEXIS, el pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, el socio es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 23 años de edad es soltero, y siguiendo el ejemplo de sus primos y hermanos, el empezó trabajando de boletero (cobrador de pasajes), en la ruta Cusco, y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró ahorrar y pedir préstado un capital para comprar su propia combi de último modelo, el socio cubre la ruta del Sr de Cabildo y en uno de los viajes sufrió un accidente pequeño que le ocasionó un golpe fuerte a lado lateral del carro y este requiere ahora un planchado y pintado, para seguir operativo, el socio dice que este es el amor de su vida y lo cuida como su propio hijo, Él solicita el présatamo para poder arreglar su combi starex. 

El socio  agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is Mr. Alexis, he belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" communal bank. The partner was born in the city of Cuzco, is 23 years old and single, and following the example of his cousins and brothers, he started to work as a ticket seller in the Cusco route, and with a lot of effort and dedication he managed to save enough and to borrow some capital to buy his own brand new VW bus. The partner covers the route from Sr de Cabildo and in one of the trips he suffered a small accident that banged the side of the car and now requires straightening and painting to keep operating. The partner says this is the love of his life and takes care of it like his own son. He is asking for a loan to be able to fix his bus. The partner is grateful and expresses the satisfaction of being able to keep his business growing and is committed to fulfill the payment of the loan in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fixing and painting of transport after an accident

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señorita GLORIA, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 18 años de edad es soltera, la socia comenzó a trabajar hace 2 años atrás en el centro comercial el molino con una señora que trae ropa del país de Bolivia, nuestra socia aprendió el negocio a la perfección y conoce los proveedores y decidió abrir su propio stand en el mismo centro comercial, ella requiere el préstamo para viajar a traer un poco de mercadería luego lo seguirá haciendo con más frecuencia y con un poco más de capital, ella está muy emocionada por que podrá ser ahora su propia jefa y dará trabajo a otras personas que como ella comenzaron desde jovencita. La socia traerá un poco más de mercadería para jovencitas.

La  socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ms. Gloria belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" communal bank. The partner was born in the city of Cusco, she is 18 years old and single. She started working two years ago in the El Molino market with a woman who brings clothing from Bolivia. Our partner learned about the business to perfection and knows the suppliers so she decided to open her own stand in the same market. She requires the loan to travel and bring some merchandise and will continue doing this more frequently and with a little bit more capital. She is very excited because she will be able to become her own boss and will give work to other people that like her started since they were young. The partner will bring more clothing for young girls. She is grateful for being able to keep her business growing and is committed to fulfill the payment of her debt in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su propio negocio.

loans.name: Reyna Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa tiene 32 años de edad, se caso joven y procreo tres hijos el mayor tiene 11,8 y 4 años de edad, estudiantes de la primaria, su esposo de oficio mecánico pero también esta trabajando como guarda de seguridad en el barrio en las noches debido ala delincuencia que se ha incrementado y a si gana otro dinero extra y poder cubrir junto con su esposa los gastos. Doña Teresa se dedica ala venta de carne de res y de cerdo ella reside en un barrio de Santa Elena carretera norte, en donde le queda cerca el carnit que se le hace mas cerca para comprar la carne, mas barata y de buena calidad, tiene tres años de estar con sus ventas, las dificultades que se le presenta es cuando un niño se le enferma toma parte del capital con que trabaja y queda con poco, para comprar la carne. Y lo que mas desea es poder invertir en más para mejorar su inventario  y obtener mejores ganancias. Con este préstamo comprara mucho más carne, un cerdo y sacos de maíz para comenzar  a palmear tortilla ya que desea ahorrar para poder hacer su casa en mejores condiciones ya que es insegura y forrada de zinc con tabla, y de tierra lo cual espera pronto poder a mejorarla para una mejor comodidad como higiene de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa is 32 years old; she married young. She has three children of 11, 8 and 4 years of age, all students in elementary school. Her husband is a mechanic but is also working as a security guard in the neighborhood at night due to the increase in the crime rate; this way he earns some extra money to be able to cover the expenses with his wife. Ms. Teresa is dedicated to the sale of beef and pork. She lives in the Santa Elena neighborhood in the northern highway, where she lives close to a butcher where she buys good quality meat at lower prices. She has been selling for over 3 years. She has had to endure some hardship when a child gets ill and she uses up part of her capital and ends up having less funds to purchase meat. She wishes to be able to invest in inventory and earn more money. With this loan she will purchase more meat, a pig and sacks of corn to be able to make tortillas since she wishes to save some money to be able to improve the quality of her home since it is not safe, just covered in zinc, planks and earth, so she is hoping that she will be able to live more comfortably and to improve the hygiene of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase meat, a pig and sacks of corn

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena D. sells shoes and slippers at Abura market in Cape coast. Philomena has received senior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an assistant driver. Philomena has been selling shoes and slippers for the past four years. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy shoes and sandals for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest back into her business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy shoes and sandals for sale.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora INES, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 64 años de edad es casada, la socia tiene 6 hijos (40, 36, 27, 25, 20, 6) alterna sus labores en el hogar con el comercio, la socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa y ella misma lo administra y atiende desde hace muchos años, nuestra socia suele comprar mercadería al por mayor y abastecer su tienda, ella compra y vende arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, harinas, aceite, entre otros productos ahora solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería y de este modo seguir trabajando

La socia  agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is Ms. Ines, she belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" communal bank. The partner was born in the city of Cusco; she is 64 years old and has 6 sons and daughters aged 40, 36, 27, 25, 20 and 6 years old. She alternates her work at home with commerce. The partner has a small produce store in her own home that she manages and takes care of herself. Our partner is used to buying merchandise in bulk to be able to stock her store. She sells rice, sugar, milk, noodles, flour, and oil among other products. She is asking for a loan to purchase products and in this way be able to keep working. The partner is very grateful and expresses the satisfaction to be able to keep her business growing and is committed to fulfill the payment of the loan in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Haydde

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora HAYDEE, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 68 años de edad es casada, la socia tiene 4 hijos la menor de sus hijas tiene 38 años de edad, ella alterna sus labores en el hogar con el comercio, nuestra socia tiene un pequeño stand de venta de verduras y productos remojados en el mercado de Tupac Amarú, en el área de verduras, la socia trabaja arduamente lo cual le permite ayudar a sus nietos con lo que ella gana, ella tiene este stand desde hace 4 años y ya es su negocio formal, ella solicita el préstamo para seguir apoyando a su familia e todo los pendientes que se puedan de este modo ella invertirá el dinero en la adquisición de un más productos para su venta.

La socia  agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is Miss Haydee, she belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas' communal bank. The partner was born in the city of Cusco. Our partner is 68 years old and is married with 4 children. Her youngest daughter is 38 years old. She alternates her chores at home with commerce; our partner has a small produce stand in the in the vegetable area of the Tupac Amaru market. The partner works arduously which allows her to help her grandchildren with what she earns. She has had this stand for 4 years and now it is her formal business. She is requesting the loan to keep supporting her family; she will invest the money in the purchase of more produce to sell. The partner is grateful and expresses her satisfaction to be able to keep her own business growing and is committed to fulfill the payment of the debt in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables for her produce stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase CDs and accessories

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati U. I. is married and has two children. She has received junior high education. Fati sells baking ingredients such as margarine, sugar, baking powder, flavors for cake and other items behind Sahasa at Abura in Cape Coast. She has been selling items like this for the past six years. Her husband is a driver. Fati uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Fati will use the loan to purchase more margarine, sugar and other items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fati plans to save to further expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more margarine, sugar and other items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: David

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es el señor DAVID, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, el socio es  natural de la provincia de Sicuani ubicado en el departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 40 años de edad es casado, tiene 4 hijos (18, 14, 12, 5) años de edad, el socio trabaja hace 11 años como guardián en el área de educación y hace 4 años decidió abrir su propio taller de carpintería, nuestro socio realizó su sueño de apertura su taller y lo fue haciendo poco a poco con las herramientas justas pero es tan bueno e su trabajo que ahora le dan trabajaos mas laboriosos para lo cual el socio necesita de algunas maquinarías para hacer su trabajo eficiente, ahora nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar su maquinaría.

El socio  agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is Mr. David, he belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" communal bank. The partner was born in the Sicuani province located in the Cusco department. Our partner is 40 years old and is married with 4 children aged 18, 14, 12 and 5 years old. He has been working for over 11 years as a guard in the education industry and 4 years ago decided to open his own carpentry shop. Our partner fulfilled his dream of opening the woodshop and was able to do it slowly with the right tools, but he is so good at what he does that now he gets more laborious jobs for which he needs some machinery to make his work more efficient. Our partner is now requesting the loan to be able to purchase the machinery. The partner is grateful and expresses his satisfaction to be able to continue growing his own business and is committed to fulfill the payment of the debt in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of carpentry machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: improve her restaurant

loans.name: Josefa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Josefa tiene el negocio de verduras en el Mercado la estación en el departamento de León donde vente los diferentes perecederos tales como tomate, lechugas, ajo entre otros. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más verduras para ofrecerles a sus clientes que a diario la visitan en el mercado.
Es importante destacar que es madre soltera de 4 hijos a los cuales mantiene y están en edad escolar, el crédito le servirá para mejorar su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Miss Josefa has a vegetable stand in the market in the station of the department of Leon where she sells different perishables such as tomato, lettuce, and garlic among others. She is requesting a credit to purchase more vegetables so that she can offer them to her clients who visit her daily in the market. It is important to point out that she is a single mother that takes care of her four children who are still in school. The loan will help her improve her quality of life and that of her children whom she loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of banana, potatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es el señor WILFREDO, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, el socio vive en el departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 30 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo 9 años de edad, el socio trabaja hace 5 años en transporte, el tiene su carrito y lo puso  atrabajar en transporte urbano cubriendo la ruta de Cusco hacia la provincia de Anta- Iscuchaka, nuestro socio maneja todos los días de la ciudad del Cusco a Iscuchaka un promedio de 1 hora ida y vuelta llevando y trayendo pasajeros, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder hacerle un mantenimiento general a su auto y así tenerlo en optimas condiciones para su normal desempeño.

El socio  agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is Mr. Wilfredo, who belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" communal bank. The partner lives in the Cusco department. Our partner is 30 years old and lives with his partner and 9 year old son. The partner has been working in transport for 5 years, he has his own car and has been servicing the urban transport route from Cusco to the Anta Iscuchaka province. Our partner drives his car every day from Cusco to Iscuchaka for an average of an hour round trip, transporting passengers. Our partner is requesting a loan for the general maintenance on his car, so that it can perform in optimal condition. The partner is grateful and expresses his satisfaction to be able to keep growing with his own business and is committed to fulfill the payment of his debt in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Soukaly Kom-Kom Group

texts.en:
The development of petty commerce and, particularly, retail commerce experienced great growth in the currency devaluation of the 1980s in Senegal. This structural crisis was marked by a significant reduction in purchasing power for Senegalese people and especially those from the least privileged social classes. Entire families failed to meet their food and healthcare needs. It was this desire to find a way to increase their purchasing power that has encouraged these women to start producing and selling cakes that are very much in demand by the local population.

Putting in place these ovens gives women better access to baking facilities with reduced production costs and will allow them to maximize their profits in this business. The oven will be open to all women who bake cakes and production will take place in town. The women hope to take orders to make cakes for ceremonies and other special occasions. 

This text was translated from the original French, below:

Le développement du petit commerce surtout du commerce de détail a connu une effervescence à partir de la dévaluation monétaire des années 1980 survenu au Sénégal. Cette crise structurelle est marquée par une forte baisse du pouvoir d’achat des sénégalais et surtout des couches sociales les plus défavorisées. Des familles entières n’arrivaient pas à satisfaire leur besoin alimentaire mais aussi sanitaire. C’est dans le souci d’une recherche quotidienne de l’accroissement de leur pouvoir d’achat que ces femmes s’adonnent à la production et à la commercialisation de gâteaux très sollicités par les populations. 

La mise en place de ces four participera à la facilitation d’accès des femmes au four à la réduction des charges de production pour maximiser leurs bénéfices dans la mise en ouvre de ce commerce.
Le four sera ouvert à toutes les femmes productrices de gâteaux et la production sera écoulée dans la ville. Les commandes de gâteaux pour les cérémonies et autres fêtes seront exploitées par ces femmes.

loans.use: To purchase an oven to bake cakes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama San Luis porque a si se llama la comunidad.  Las UDES son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunirse semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.  Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de San Luis estado de VeraC.  El grupo está conformado por  once integrantes.  

El representante del grupo se llama Juana R. A. es casada, tiene 38 años, estudió hasta el 3° año y tiene en total tres hijos 1 mujeres y 2 varones.  Ella se dedica a venta de antojitos y necesita el préstamo para comprar lo que le haga falta como carne, masa, verduras, utensilios de cocina.  Sus clientes dicen que guisa muy rico y que tiene buen sazón. Aunque solo sea los fines de semana es muy aseada en su negocio. Doña Juana desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para invertirla a su venta de antojitos y poder así sacar mas ganancias y poder tener mejor vida para ella y sus hijos.

Emilia O. González es parte del comité de este grupo, San Luis.Ella tiene 46 años, estudió hasta el 6°primaria y tiene un total de 3 hijos 1 mujer y 2 varones.  Ella se dedica a venta de abarrotes  y necesita el préstamo para surtir su negocio, comprara arroz, aceite, frijol, sopas, refrescos dulces y galletas.  Sus clientes dicen que es muy amable, responsable y habré muy temprano su tienda. En un futuro desea agrandarlo mas ya que esta algo pequeño. Doña Emilia desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para seguir invirtiendo y tener bien surtido y en un futuro agrandar su tienda.

Los otros nueve integrantes se llaman Hilda P. O., Elia R. Vázquez, Esperanza C. M., Susana B. R., Lucila S. R., Verónica M., Karla Patricia R. O., Edith Araceli E. U. y Grisel O. González y quieren el préstamo para venta de joyería, antojitos, abarrotes, venta de ropa y venta de pollo.
texts.en:
The name of this economic development unit is San Luis because that’s the name of the community. Economic Development Units are groups of 10 people that have a bank account and that meet weekly or bi-weekly to make their payments. The unit has a representative and a governing board. This group is in the San Luis community in the state of VeraC.. It has 11 members. The group representative is Juana R. A., 38, who is married and has three children, 1 girl and 2 boys; she finished third grade. She sells snacks and needs funding to buy the ingredients she needs like: meat, masa (dough for tortillas), vegetables, and kitchen utensils. Her customers say that she cooks delicious, well-seasoned dishes. Even though she opens only on week-ends, her establishment is very clean. Juana wants this loan so that her business will grow, to earn profits to reinvest in her snack sales, and to earn higher profits so that she and her children can have a better standard of living. Emilia O. González, 46, is on the governing board of this group. She finished 6th grade and has 3 children, one girl and 2 boys. She sells groceries and needs funding to stock her store. She will buy rice, cooking oil, beans, soups, sweet beverages and cookies. Her customers say that she is very kind and responsible and she opens for business very early. In the future, she would like to enlarge her store because it is a bit small. Emilia wants this loan to enlarge her business, to earn better profits to reinvest to have a better-stocked store and, in the future, to enlarge her store. The other nine members are: Hilda P. O., Elia R. Vázquez, Esperanza C. M., Susana B. R., Lucila S. R., Verónica M., Karla Patricia R. O., Edith Araceli E. U. and Grisel O. González, who need funding for their various business enterprises, such as: sale of jewelry, snacks, groceries, clothing, and chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, beans, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sewing notions

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ramona del Carmen L. H., tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y ellos habitan en el Barrio conocido como Pablo Calero, un barrio en donde sus habitantes son personas de escasos recursos, que luchan día  a día para poder tener el sustento diario, ellos tiene 3 hijos de 28, 25 y 19 años todos sus hijos ya están casados y se mantiene de forma independiente. La señora Ramona trabaja como afanadora   tiene 10 años de trabajar de esta manera y por la baja entrada de dinero no ha podría realizar los cambios que desea para su vivienda, pero con la ayuda que se le proporcione, ella conseguirá repellar las paredes de su casa y mejorar el piso de su hogar con este crédito se comprara los materiales h utilizar tales como cemento, bloque arena y hierro, con estos cambio podrá la familia L. tener  mejores comodidades para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Ramona del Carmen L. H. is 54 and married. They live in the neighborhood known as Pablo Calero. People in this neighborhood have scarce resources, and they fight day to day for their daily support. They have three children; 28, 25, and 19. All of their children are married and independent. Ramona has worked as a janitor for ten years. With the low amount of money she receives, she has not been able to make the changes to her house that she wants to make. With the help that is provided, she will replaster the walls of her house and improve the floor to her home. She will use this loan to buy materials like cement, blocks, sand, and iron. With these changes the L. family will be able to have more comforts in order to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida tiene 58 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores que viven la capital del Perú (Lima), en busca D. un futuro mejor y una adecuada educación. 
DesD. muy joven ha trabajado duro, es por eso que su cuerpo se acostumbró a los horarios y actividades pesadas menciona. Actualmente se levanta muy temprano y acompañada D. la música que le gusta e inicia sus actividades domésticas, luego atienD. a su esposo y ambos se dirigen al pequeño restaurante D. comidas típicas D. la selva que tienen. Los platillos que elaboran son bastante demandados en su zona porque es el único establecimiento cerca; con las ganancias que obtienen pueD. educar a sus hijos, mantener los gastos D. la casa e incluso ir ampliando el local D. su negocio, pues para el futuro desea que funcione en las noches como un video pub para obtener mayores ingresos.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que pagará sus cuotas puntualmente, como siempre, para no perder la confianza que deposita la institución y su grupo en ella. También menciona que está feliz D. ser parte D. un banco comunal porque sus compañeras cumplen las normas y eso logra que estén muy unidas. Alida tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra D. juguetes para venderlos, aprovechando las fiestas D. fin año.
texts.en:
Alida, 58, lives in her own house with her husband. They have three grown children who live in the capital of Perú (Lima) and looking for a better future and an adequate education. She has worked hard since she was very young. That is why her body became accustomed to the heavy schedules and the activities she mentions. She currently gets up very early and, accompanied by the music she likes, she starts her domestic chores. She then takes care of her husband, and they both head to their small restaurant, which sells typical food of the jungle. The dishes they make are popular in her area because it is the only establishment nearby. With the earnings they get they are able to educate their children, pay the household expenses, and even expand their place of business. In the future she wants to operate as a video pub in the evenings in order to get more income. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is sure that she will make her payments punctually, as always, in order to not lose the confidence that the institution and her group has placed in her. She also mentions that she is happy to be part of a communal bank because her colleagues follow the rules, and this makes them very united. Alida plans to use the money she is requesting to buy toys to sell, taking advantage of the end of the year parties.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba H. is a widow and has three children. She received no formal education. Aba sells cooked rice and tomato sauce with a variety of fish and meat in Abura in the Cape Coast. She has been doing this business for the past eight years. 

Aba uses her income for the payment of school fees and other utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more raw rice and other foodstuffs to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more raw rice and other foodstuffs to cook for sale

loans.name: Cristina Gregoria

texts.es:
LA SRA CRISTINA VIVE EN LA CALLE YACUMA, ELLA Y EL ESPOSO SON PROPIETARIOS DE CASA DONDE ESTAN VIVIENDO ACTUALMENTE. INDICAR QUE SUS NEGOCIOS FUNCIONAN EN EL MISMO DOMICILIO. 

LA SRA CRISTINA, INGRESA A LA INSTITUCION EL 20/09/2004 ,QUIEN DESDE ESA FECHA TRABAJA CON PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS, ADEMAS MENCIONAR QUE LA SRA CON SU ESFUERZO Y DEDICACION SUSTENTA A SUS TRES HIJOS Y DOS SOBRINAS, A LOS CUALES ASISTE ECONOMICAMENTE PARA VERLOS PROFESIONALES EN EL FUTURO. MENCIONAR QUE LA SRA ES MUY EMPRENDEDORA , YA QUE  DIVERSIFICO SUS ACTIVIDADES EN VARIOS RUBROS.(KIOSKO DE AMBURGUESAS, PENSION, BAZAR LIBRERIA, ACOMODA PRODUCTOS EN ABARROTES.

LA SRA. CRISTINA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y CON KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO
texts.en:
Sra. Cristina lives on Yacuma Street. She and her husband own the home where they are currently living. They also run their businesses from the same location.

Sra. Cristina joined Emprender on September 20, 2004. Since then, she has made her payments on time. We should also mention that Cristina works hard and with great dedication to support her three children and two nieces. She supports them financially so that they can become professional in the future. Cristina is also a very enterprising woman, since she manages a variety of businesses including a hamburger stand, a boarding house, bookstore, bazaar, and grocery store.

She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es una mujer emprendedora y amable de 41 años, vive con su esposo Ángel, de 44 años, y con 2 de sus 6 hijos; ellos son: Karen de 11 y Jacqueline de 4 años. Su casa es alquilada pero muy acogedora.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de frutas oriundas de la selva central peruana, pero en las mañanas vende alimentos en un paradero de autos. Los fines de semana, vende discos de música en las diferentes ferias de su localidad, con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo, quien dice que aprendió a trabajar sin miedo, ni vergüenza a las actividades a las que se dedica junto a Florentina. 
Ambos relatan que antes no tenían ni qué comer y se sentían impotentes de ver llorar de hambre a sus hijos e incluso por un plato de comida llegaron a vender los pocos artículos domésticos que habían obtenido; “recordar esas cosas me ayudan para salir adelante” manifiesta ella, a la vez que se dice “con Dios a mi lado ya nada me falta, al contrario tengo para compartir con los demás”. 
Ahora sus oficios son rentables y le permiten ahorrar, por lo que para el futuro se proyecta a implementar una tienda de discos de música y videos cristianos para hacer llegar la palabra de Dios a sus semejantes, y también desea ampliar su negocio de venta de frutas. 

Este es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y cuenta que se ganó la confianza de la entidad por ser muy responsable y cumplida en sus pagos; además le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal y está muy agradecida porque debido a estos créditos tiene un próspero negocio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más discos para venderlos en las ferias como comerciante ambulante, por ahora, hasta tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Florentina is a kind and enterprising 41 year old woman. She lives with her 44 year old husband, Ángel, and with two of their six children. They are Karen, 11, and Jaqueline, 4. Her house is rented but very cozy. For 15 years she has been selling fruit that is native to the central Peruvian jungle. But, in the mornings she sells food at a parking lot. On the week ends she sells musical discs at the different fairs in her area. She has her husband’s unconditional help. He says that he learned to do the same work with Florentina without fear or shame. They both say that before they did not even have anything to eat, and they felt helpless seeing their children cry from hunger. They even sold the few domestic goods they had for one plate of food. “Remember that these things help me to get ahead,” is what she says. She also says, “With God at my side, I do not need anything. To the contrary, I have enough to share with the rest.” Now her jobs are profitable, and they allow her to save. In the future she plans to set up a store with musical discs and Christian videos to bring the word of God to others. She also hopes to expand her fruit selling business. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She explains that she won the confidence of the institution by being very responsible and making her payments. Also, she likes to work with her communal bank. She is very grateful because she has a prosperous business due to these loans. She will use the money she is now requesting to buy more discs to sell at the fairs. She will work as a traveling salesperson until she gets her own location.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase condiments for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of seafood for transformation and resale

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco es un joven trabajador de 23 años, soltero,  vive con su madre Valentina de 63 años, y con 2 de sus 4 cuatro. Ellos son Marcos de 25 y Elizabeth de 20 años, su casa es alquilada y está ubicada en un apacible pueblo lejos de la ciudad, en la sierra peruana. 

Él es agricultor desde hace 5 años, siembra papa, maíz, arveja y diferentes colores de flores de gladiolo. Sus terrenos son propios, por lo que los cuida con bastante sacrificio y esmero para obtener una buena producción. Marco también compra siembras de choclo (maíz) y flores listos para cosechar y comercializar al mercado; quienes siempre lo ayudan son sus hermanos Marcos y Elizabeth porque ellos también desean darle una vejez tranquila a su madre.
Además, ellos tienen pensado formar su propia familia, por eso luchan para salir adelante; lo que más le gusta a Marco de su trabajo es comercializar los productos que cosecha, porque obtiene buenas ganancias económicas: “ser agricultor lo tengo en la sangre, en los recuerdos, en aquel tiempo cuando mi padre me enseñaba amar los cultivos” refiere.
En el futuro, le gustaría aperturar una tienda de flores en sus distintas variedades y colores, en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad, donde vendería a diario.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, pues está muy agradecido por la confianza deposita en él. Además quiere ahorrar para cumplir sus planes, porque para entonces tendrá su propia familia, dice. Con el dinero que solicita comprará extensiones de terrenos de maíz y flores listos para cosechar y vender en el mercado de su ciudad y en la capital del país.
texts.en:
Marco, 23, is single. He lives with his mother, Valentina, 63, and with 2 of his 4 siblings: Marcos, 25 and Elizabeth, 20. They rent their house, which is in a pleasant town far from the city in the Peruvian mountains. He has been a farmer for the past 5 years; he grows potato, corn, peas and gladioli in several different colors. He owns his fields so he cares for them with much dedication and sacrifice in order to obtain good crops. Marco also buys about-to-be-harvested choclo (corn) crops and flowers to sell at market. His siblings Marcos and Elizabeth are his always-reliable helpers because they, too, want to provide their mother with a peaceful old-age. In addition, they plan to form their own families so they work hard to get ahead. What Marco likes best about his work is selling the products he grows because they produce good profits. As he, himself, states: “I have farming in my blood and in my memories, from that past time when my father taught me to love crops.” In the future, he would like to open a flower shop in a centrally-located place in the city to sell flowers daily in all their various varieties and colors. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to repay on time because he is grateful for the trust placed in him. Besides, he wants to have savings in order to reach his goals because by then he will have his own family. With the money requested, he will buy fields-worth of about-to-be harvested corn and flowers to sell in his city’s and the capital’s markets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy about-to-be harvested corn and flowers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther D. sells ready-made ladies tops and skirts as well as secondhand bed sheets in Abura, a suburb of Cape Coast, near the bus stop. She is single and has received junior high education. She has been in business for the past seven years. Esther uses her income to pay for food and clothing as well as to pay the electricity bills and rent. Esther will use her loan to purchase bales of bed sheets, jeans trousers and ladies tops to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to save for future eventualities.

loans.use: To purchase bales of bed sheets, jeans trousers and ladies tops

loans.name: Marta Maria

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo la señora Marta M. imparte clases en la escuela Rubén Darío ella empezó a trabajar con Ceprodel siempre para la mejora de su casa iniciando con ahorros y el aporte de su esposo. Hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito el cual será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, piedrín, cemento entre otros, con el propósito de continuar mejorando su vivienda y así garantizarle un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo, Sra. Marta M. teaches classes at the Rubén Darío School. She began working with CEPRODEL in order to make improvements to her home, begin saving money, and help her husband in providing financial support. Today she is requesting a new loan in order to purchase construction materials such as sand, gravel, cement, and other items. She plans to continue making improvements to her home by providing a proper roof for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Donato Mareano

texts.es: El Sr. C. G. Donato Mareano de 42 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 9 años. Vive al lado de su conviviente, cuenta con  casa propia de material noble recien construida en  el Distritito de San Antonio. Ambos trabajan como obreros de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 10 años de experiencia. Es una persona luchadora, responzable. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda que esta en plena contrucción que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007 pero gracias a su esfuerzo lograron reconstruir parte de su vivienda como también comprar sus artefactos. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Donato Mareano C. G. is 42 years old and has a nine year old child. He and his common law wife live in a well-constructed house in the District of San Antonio. They both have been working as farm laborers for an agricultural business for the past ten years. Donato is a strong-willed, responsible person. He is requesting a loan to finish building his house since it was in the middle of construction when the earthquake of 2007 occurred. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to rebuild part of his home and purchase a few appliances. He dreams of having his entire house built so that he can have a better quality of life. He is grateful for the support being provided through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of his house

loans.name: Ninda

texts.es:
Ninda tiene 51 años, vive felizmente casada con su esposo Alejo, de 56 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos que ya no viven con ellos, pues se mudaron a la capital en busca de un futuro mejor y una buena educación. La vivienda en la que ella vive es propia.

El oficio que desempeña todos los días es el comercio de comestibles, productos de primera necesidad y perfumería. Paralelamente y desde hace 15 años cultiva plátanos, palta, cítricos oriundos de la selva peruana, actividades que realiza sola, porque según cuenta le gusta todo de sus labores y ya está acostumbrada a despertarse a tempranas horas de la madrugada para atender a su amado esposo y a los clientes madrugadores que van a su tienda principalmente en busca de pan, leche, chocolate para el desayuno.
Por las noches se va a descansar muy tarde pues en la zona donde vive no hay tiendas y pese a que su establecimiento esté cerrado los vecinos tocan la puerta para ser atendidos, “yo no me molesto, porque sino los atiendo a dónde irían a comprar los pobres”, refiere Ninda, a la vez que enfatiza que con las ganancias de su tienda educa a sus hijos y cubre la manutención de su casa, por lo que considera muy rentables sus actividades.
Como es una mujer emprendedora tiene planeado implementar otra tienda de abarrotes o ferretería al otro lado de su domicilio, además ya concluyó de construir el segundo piso de su casa y piensa convertirlo en un hospedaje turístico.

Esta es la quinta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida porque considera que desde que trabaja con su banco comunal su situación económica ha mejorado y ahora tiene aspiraciones porque sabe que la institución la ayudará, respondiendo con puntualidad y cumplimiento de sus pagos. Ninda tiene pensando invertir el dinero que solicita en comprar bastante mercadería aprovechando las festividades.
texts.en:
Ninda is 51 years old and lives happily with her husband Alejo, who is 56. They have four children who no longer live with them since they have moved to the capital in search of a better future and a good education. Ninda and her husband live in their own home.

She works every day selling food, basic necessities, and toiletries. At the same time, for the past 15 years, Ninda has been growing bananas, avocados, and citrus fruits native to the Peruvian jungle. She manages her businesses by herself and enjoys her work. Ninda is already accustomed to waking up early so that she can tend to her beloved husband and the early-rising customers who come to her general store to buy bread, milk, and chocolate for breakfast.

In the evenings, she takes a rest. Since there are no stores that are open late, she has neighbors who come by to her establishment when it is closed and knock on her door requesting to be served. “It does not bother me because the poor have no other place to shop,” says Ninda. She considers her business to be very profitable and emphasizes that her earnings have enabled her to educate her children and cover the household expenses.

As an entrepreneur, she has plans to open another grocery store or hardware store across from her home. In addition, she wants to finish construction of the second floor of her house and turn it into a tourist lodge.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Ninda is very grateful because she believes working with her Communal Bank has helped improve her economic situation. She now has aspirations because she knows the Institution will support her. In return, Ninda has been responsible in completing her payments on time. She plans to use the money she requested to buy enough merchandise in order to take advantage of the upcoming festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosas De Apaña Group

texts.es:
ROSAS DE APAÑA es un banco de emprendimiento formado por 10 integrantes de las zonas de Ovejuyo y Apaña, son personas que se dedican al comercio informal y otras actividades como el transporte, sus representantes fueron elegidos por voto en asamblea siendo elegida como presidenta la Sra Angelica que se dedica a la venta de comida, La tesorera Salome vende cosmeticos en distintas zonas, como secretario el Sr Oscar Que trabaja como transportista.
