Forman parte de la base la Sra Elena Quien vende verduras, el Sr Victor es transportista, Eugenia  Vende Comida en su Kiosko, La Sra Evarista se dedica a la venta de verduras, y el Sr. Antonio es transportista, la Sra Carmen Basilia trabaja con el minibus de su esposo y la Sra Claudia que vende cosmeticos por catalogo. estas son las actividades que ellos desarrollan dia a dia para sostener a sus familias y usaran el prestamo par extender sus negocios y en otros casos empezar uno.						
						
Todos los integrantes estan agradecidos con Emprender  y  Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rosas de Apaña” was started by ten members from the districts of Ovejuyo and Apaña. They engage in informal trade and other activities, such as providing transportation services. They voted in an assembly and elected Sra. Angelica as their president. She sells food. Salome is the treasurer and sells cosmetics in different areas. Sr. Oscar serves as the secretary and works as a transportation driver.

The other members of the group are: Sra. Elena – sells vegetables Sr. Victor – provides transportation services Eugenia – sells food from her kiosk Sra. Evarista – sells vegetables Sr. Antonio – provides transportation services Sra. Carmen Basilia – operates a minibus with her husband Sra. Claudia – sells cosmetics by catalog

These activities help them to develop day after day so that they can support their families. The members will use their loans to either expand existing businesses or start new ones. All of them are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase their operating capital

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una amable mujer de 41 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su único hijo Jack de 18 años. Ella siempre ha sido independiente, es por eso no le afectó mucho la separación de su esposo, ya su propósito siempre fue salir adelante.

Desde hace 22 años es servidora pública (trabajadora en una entidad gubernamental) en una provincia bastante amplia geográficamente. A ella le gusta estar en permanente contacto con las personas, por lo que desde hace 5 años vende productos de belleza, así como algunos productos alimenticios. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, tiene plantaciones de plátanos, palta y maíz, y para esta actividad recibe la ayuda de sus padres, quienes consideran a Sonia una persona “mil oficios” porque es muy activa. 
A su edad siente que el trabajo de oficina la absorbe y hasta le incomoda por la presión y exigencia que recibe; por ello, su mayor anhelo es vivir en el campo, ya que los cultivos le transmiten la tranquilidad que requiere. Las actividades a las que se dedica son bastante rentables, y con ellos logra cubrir las necesidades prioritarias de su familia. 
Para el futuro, planea ser una vendedora estrella de la marca de productos que ofrece y consume, además de aumentar su producción agrícola.

Esta es la cuarta vez que accede a un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta, además menciona que le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son exigentes, responsables y cumplen a cabalidad las reglas internas, como debe de ser, siempre guardando el respeto por los demás. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y alimenticios que se encuentren a precios de promoción.
texts.en:
Sonia, 41, is a pleasant woman, who lives in her own home with her son, Jack, 18. She has always been independent so she wasn’t much bothered by her separation from her husband; her aim in life has always been to get ahead. She has been a public servant for the last 22 years (she works for a government entity) in a very large province. She likes to be in permanent contact with people so, for the last 5 years, she has sold beauty products as well as some food items. Besides, she’s also a farmer; she has banana, avocado and corn crops. For this last activity, she gets help from her parents who consider Sonia a “Jack-of-all-trades” because she is so active. At her age, she feels that her office work is all-consuming and the pressure and demands made on her sometimes are uncomfortable. Because of this, her greatest wish is to be able to live in the countryside since farming provides her with the tranquility she needs. Her activities are quite profitable and, thanks to them, she is able to meet her family’s main needs. For the future, she would like to be a star saleswoman of the products she offers and consumes as well as increasing her farming output. This is her fourth loan request to MFP and she is very happy. She also states that she enjoys working with her communal bank because the members are exacting, responsible, and follow the by-laws well, as it should be, always respectful of others. The funding she is requesting now will be used to buy beauty and nutritional products that are currently offered at discounted prices.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and nutritional food items.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné F. est une femme de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de chaussures et divers produits. Son objectif est d’augmenter son capital afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Ngoné F. is a 51-year old married woman, the mother of six children. She runs a small business selling shoes and various products. Her goal is to increase her working capital in order to better meet her family's needs.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Run a small business selling various products

loans.name: Ngaïdo

texts.fr: Ngaïdo F. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce d’habillement, de parfum et d’encens. Elle aimerait augmenter son capital et contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ngaïdo F., age 52, is married and mother to four children. She is in the business of selling clothing, perfume, and incense. She would like to increase her working capital and help support her family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small business selling clothing, perfume, and incense

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora U. a sus 32 años posee un negocio de Venta de Verduras, en el Mercado Santos Barcenas de León, en donde ofrece: tomate, plátano, frijoles, piña y otros, ella tiene 9 años de estar con este negocio, el cual le ha ayudado para llevarle el sustento a sus cinco hijos que viven con ella de los cuales se encuentran estudiando.
Solicita el crédito de Ceprodel para la compra de tomate, repollo, plátano, quequisque y otros, al obtener el crédito le ayudara para realizar más compra a sus proveedores y de esta forma obtener un poco mas de ingresos para poder suplir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
At 32, Mrs. U. has her own business selling vegetables in the Santos Barcenas Market in Leon where she sells tomatoes, bananas, beans, pineapple, and other produce. She has had this business for nine years, which has helped her support her five children who live with her and her in school. She is asking for a loan from Ceprodel to buy tomatoes, cabbage, banana, malanga, and other produce. Obtaining the loan will help her make more sales, and this way, allow her to make a little more income to provide for her household needs.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying produce

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Francisco J. B. es un agricultor del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo quien se dedica a la producción de hortalizas como tomates, papas, chiltoma y pepinos, etc.  El solicita un crédito en la agencia de Ceprodel para la asistencia técnica de sus cultivos como es la compra de abonos foliares y fungicidas para obtener un mejor rendimientos en estos.

El Sr. Juan J. se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida y a adquirido mucha experiencia lo que le a ayudado a seguir trabajando en esto y creciendo en la producción. El espera que con el crédito asista bien sus cultivos de chiltoma que tiene y obtener mejores ganancias y de alguna manera mejorar su situación familiar. 

El es casado y no tiene hijos, su esposa es maestra y da clase en una escuela de primaria en la misma comunidad donde ambos viven.

Este es el crédito numero 4 que Don Juan J. solicita en un periodo de de 2 años y dijo  que estos créditos le han ayudado a mejora sus producciones y con las ganancia ha logrado adquirir mas terreno aptos para la producciones agrícolas y así aumentar su negocioy por ende su consiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco J. B. is a farmer in Pueblo Nuevo; he grows tomatoes, potatoes, peppers, cucumbers, etc. He is requesting funding from Ceprodel for technical assistance for his crops in the form of leaf fertilizers and fungicides to improve his crop yields. Juan J. has been a farmer all his life and has much experience, which has helped him to continue to work and to have his production grow. He hopes the funding will help his pepper crops particularly so that his profits will increase and thus his family's standard of living will also increase. He is married and had no children. His wife is a teacher at a local elementary school. This is his 4th loan in a 2-year period and he stated that the loans have helped him improve his crops and the profits have allowed him to buy more farmland in order to enlarge his business and, thus, improve his living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers and fungicides.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora de 37 años, vive en su casa propia con sus 3 hijos: Samy de 20, Yorsi de 16 y Max de 6 años. Ella está casada, pero no vive con su esposo debido a que el tiene que trabajar en otra ciudad.

Desde hace 8 años se dedica a los trabajos de construcción, demostrando que no le tiene miedo a las actividades pesadas y de sexo débil no tiene nada. Paralelamente, con la ayuda de sus hijos, cultiva plátanos, café y cítricos en sus terrenos fértiles. 
La rutina diaria de Yeni inicia a las 4 de la mañana con la preparación de los alimentos para que sus hijos puedan desayunar y almorzar durante el día y tranquilamente poder estudiar, luego asea su casa y se alista para ir a remover tierra con la pala (lampa) en mano.
A Yeni le gusta todo de su trabajo, pues desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron a no tenerle miedo a los trabajos pesados y que las mujeres como los hombres tiene las mismas capacidades; es por ello que en su trabajo como obrera es muy respetada y admirada porque nunca dice “no puedo”, sino por el contrario ayuda a sus compañeros.
Su labor es muy rentable porque percibe un jornal con el cual cubre sus necesidades y les brinda una adecuada calidad de vida  a sus hijos y como es una mujer emprendedora tiene pensado comprar largas extensiones de terrenos para sembrar en mayor cantidad, también desea implementar una tienda de comestibles en la ciudad.

Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y como siempre pagará puntualmente sus cuotas para acceder a otros prestamos en el futuro, pues par ella estos créditos son una oportunidad para crecer económicamente y vivir tranquilamente. El dinero que ahora solicita le será muy útil, pues lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción con los cuales terminará de construir su casa y darle acabos que le brinden comodidad, además de invertir en sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Yeni, 37, is a hard-working, enterprising woman, who lives in her own home with her three children: Samy, 20, Yorsi, 16 and Max, 6. She is married but does not live with her husband because he has to work in another city. For the last 8 years she has been in construction work, demonstrating that she is not afraid to heavy lifting and she is in no way a member of the “weaker” sex. In addition, with her sons’ help, she farms bananas, coffee, and citrus fruits in her fertile farmlands. Yeni’s daily routine starts at 4am preparing the meals that her children will have for breakfast and lunch so that they can concentrate on studying in peace. Then, she cleans her house and gets ready to head to the fields to turn the soil with her hand shovel. Yeni enjoys every aspect of her work because, since she was a little girl, her parents taught her not to fear heavy work and that women have the same capabilities as men. For this reason, her work as a laborer is very respected and admired because she never says: “I can’t;” on the contrary, she helps her fellow workers. Her work is very profitable because she earns a wage that is enough for her basic needs and provides an adequate quality of life for her children. As she is an enterprising woman, she is thinking of buying large plots of farmland to plant larger amounts; she also would like to set up a grocery store in the city. This is her sixth loan with MFP and, as usual, she will repay it on time so that she can have access to future loans because these loans represent for her an opportunity to grow economically and live in peace. The funds she is requesting now will be used to buy building supplies with which to finish her house and give it the finishing touches that represent comfort; she will also invest in her farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements and to improve her crop yields.

loans.name: Johana

texts.fr: Johana S. est une femme mariée de 56 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait du commerce en détail d’huile de palme et de miel. Ce prêt lui permettra de maintenir son capital et de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de scolarité et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Johana S. is a 56-year old married woman, the mother of three children. She runs a retail business selling palm oil and honey. This loan would allow her to maintain her working capital and help better the living conditions, schooling, and health of her family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in palm oil and honey

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Doña Maura es una mujer trabajadora,de 55 años de edad,  madre de familia de cinco hijos, vive en Villa Reconciliación, en donde tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano, compra las pacas en donde vende variedad de ropa para todas las edades, aparte de suéteres, sabanas y también vende refrescos para ayudarse más. Lleva once años vendiendo el cual ha logrado captar clientes, y le ha ido mejor con la venta de ropa que con la pulpería que tenia hace varios años, también ha logrado mejorar su casa con las ganancias y ayuda de sus hijos, ya que tiene varios años de estar sola. Con este préstamo va a comprar pacas  para seguir ofreciendo ropa bonita y accesible de costos para todo gusto. Ella desea poner una venta de comida en su casa, son los proyectos que tiene para este año a corto plazo el cual espera poder lograrlo con el apoyo de la institución el cual junto con ellos ha incrementado sus ventas.
texts.en:
Doña Maura is a hard working 55 year old woman. She is the mother of five sons and lives in Villa Reconciliacion, where she has her own used clothes business. She buys them in bulk and sells clothing for all ages, as well as sweaters, sheets and also some sodas to help with sales. She has been selling for over 11 years now, and has been able to get steady customers. She has done better with the sale of clothing than with a store she had several years ago, and she was also able to improve her home with the earnings and the help of her children, since she has been living alone for some time. With this loan she will purchase clothing to be able to offer nice and accessible clothing for every taste. She also wishes to be able to sell food from home. This are the projects that she has for this year and she hopes to be able to fulfill them with the support of the institution which has helped her increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr: Fatou Bintou F. est une femme mariée de 43ans, mère de 8 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce d’habits et de fruits locaux de saison comme les oranges, les pastèques. Ce prêt lui servira à augmenter son capital pour mieux contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou Bintou F. is a married woman who is 43 years old and has eight children. She is active in the trading of clothes and local seasonal fruits such as oranges and watermelons. This loan will be used to increase her capital so that she can contribute more to her family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trading of clothes and local seasonal fruits

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Somotillo reside el Señor José Francisco M. B., quien trabaja en el Centro de Salud de esa localidad, el es esfuerza diariamente con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda con sus hijos en edad escolar.
Actualmente esta solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción como: ladrillos, piedrín, arena y cemento para llevar a cabo la obra de construcción y así ver realizados sus sueños de brindarle un techo digno en donde vivan sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Francisco M. B. lives in the Somotillo neighborhood and works at a local health center. He works hard, day in and day out, to improve the house he shares with his school-aged children. He is applying for a loan from Ceprodel so that he can buy construction materials--bricks, gravel, sand and cement--to carry out the construction work and fulfill his dream of providing a decent place for his children to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for improving housing.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta S. est une mariée de 26 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Son activité consiste à commercialiser divers produits tels que colas, café, poisson fumé et huile de palme. Son objectif est de renforcer son capital pour mieux subvenir à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anta S. is a 26-year old married woman who has five children. Her business consists of the buying and selling of various products such as colas, coffee, smoked fish and palm oil. Her aim is to strengthen her capital in order to contribute more to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.fr: Victoria P. est mariée, 54 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de crème glace et de jus de fruit local. Son objectif est d’augmenter son capital et de participer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Victoria PEIRA is married, 54 years old and has five children. She is active in the sale of ice-cream and juice made up of local fruits. Her aim is to increase her capital and contribute to the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of ice-cream and juice made from local fruits

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is a single mom. She raises her 9-year-old daughter, Dominika, all by herself. She works hard to ensure a decent living for her small family and readily works long hours to make a little extra income. Monika sells women’s clothing and footwear in one of the local marketplaces in her hometown of Beregovo. She has been in this trade for only a year and a half. Presently, she has about 20,000 grivnyas worth of inventory. She makes 4,500 grivnyas in profit each month.  

Monika is requesting a 6,000 grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise wholesale for retail sale in her vending kiosk. She tries to re-stock her merchandise on a regular basis which helps keep her loyal customers and attracts potential new ones. Monika has proven to be a trustworthy borrower as she has repaid previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi owns a greenhouse and grows different vegetables, e.g., tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes, etc. He is married with two grown children. His family lives in Kamenka. His house is located right next to a big highway which makes it a favorable location for wholesale trade. Vitalyi started his venture 26 years ago. Currently, he has about 10,000 grivnyas invested in his business. He spends over 5,000 grivnyas on seeds and clear polyethylene film every year. 

Vitalyi is seeking a 10,000 grivnya loan to construct a new arch greenhouse to grow more vegetables. Vitalyi is very hardworking. He is anticipating further growth of his venture and is willing to invest in its development. This business has good prospects in his region and Vitalyi is hoping to keep it running and growing into the future.

loans.use: To construct a new greenhouse

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León, la señora Reyna H. se ha dedicado con mucho esfuerzo a su actividad de crianza de ganado y trabajos agrícolas habiéndose dedicado a estas actividades desde hace mas de 20 años habiendo alcanzado gran experiencia en ello.
Ella es madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que debe de brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de cuatro vaquillas para proceder con su crianza y luego extraerle la leche para comercializarla y es por esta razón que espera confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado y así comprará dichas vaquillas para continuar en su actividad de ganadería y sacarles el máximo provecho.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna H., who lives in the town of El Sauce in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Leon, makes a living raising cattle and doing other farm-related jobs, work she has been doing for more than 20 years. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are still in school, and she owes it to them to create the conditions they need to thrive. She is applying for a loan to buy four heifers that she will raise for a milking business. She hopes to get the loan so that can buy the heifers, continue her livestock business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy four heifers for livestock business.

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
La señora Sandra R. vive en el municipio El Sauce donde trabaja fuertemente en la actividad agropecuaria dedicándose a esta desde hace varios años y habiendo adquirido vasta experiencia en ello. 
Ella conoce mucho del cómo criar los animales y por todo este tiempo, esta actividad ha sido la que le permite llevar el bienestar a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su familia. El crédito lo está solicitando para invertirlo directamente en la compra de una vaquilla para dar lugar a su crianza  y así extraerle la leche para comercializarla y continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra R. lives in the town of El Sauce where, day in and day out, she makes a living at farming, work that she has done for several years and for which she has much experience. She knows a lot about raising animals and the work has allowed her to provide for her family over many years. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy a heifer that she will raise for a milking business, the earnings of which will allow her to continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a heifer for a milking business.

loans.name: Cony

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica del departamento de León, la señora Cony Q. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y hoy en día ha iniciado en el mejoramiento de su vivienda por medio de su reconstrucción ya que así lo necesitaba porque dicha vivienda ha estado en malas condiciones.
Ella ha buscado la manera de cómo brindarles a sus tres hijos un techo digno donde habitar y para ello trabaja con el propósito de realizar esta obra. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, piedrín para repellar las paredes y de esta manera contribuir al mejoramiento del nivel de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Leon, Sra. Cony Quinonez is known for how hard she works. She has just started making improvements to her house which is in such bad condition that it will have to be rebuilt. She wants to provide a decent place for her three children to live and she has worked hard to make it happen. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy construction materials--cement, wall plaster, etc.--that will help her to improve how her children live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica en el departamento de León la señora María Cristina M. se dedica a atender su propia pulpería que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado desarrollar en su propia casa de habitación. Ella ofrece todo tipo de productos principalmente los comestibles como huevos, pan dulce, pan simple, golosinas, entre otros. También vende productos varios como jabones, detergentes, mecates, pasta de dientes, entre otros.
Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los productos para la pulpería y de esta manera abastecerla y suplir las necesidades de sus clientes que le visitan a diario para obtener dichos productos.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Leon, Sra. Maria Cristina M. operates a small general store from her house, a business that she worked hard to build. She sells all kinds of products, mainly food--eggs, bread, candy, etc.--but also other miscellaneous products such as soap, detergent, rope, and toothpaste. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy products for the store and, in turn, supply the needs of the customers who shop there.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores S. es una dama que labora en su propia actividad de costurera en el municipio de Telica en León. Ella ha adquirido vasta experiencia en esta labor ya que es la que le permite llevar el sustento a su hija que se dedica a estudiar en la universidad. La señora María S. es madre soltera y hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez.
Su mayor satisfacción es que su hija corone su carrera universitaria y así que llegue a ser una gran profesional de éxito. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en el pago de la universidad de su hija y así contribuye a que se logren sus sueños de que su hija amada corone su carrear profesional.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores S. operates her own tailoring business in the town of Telica in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Leon. She has a lot of experience at this kind of work and it has allowed her to support her daughter who is now studying at the university. Sra. Maria S. is a single mother and has had to be both father and mother to her daughter. Her greatest satisfaction is that she has given her daughter a chance to study and have a professional career. She is applying for a loan that she will use to pay university fees and fulfill her dream that her beloved daughter go on to a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Martha Ines

texts.es: Doña ,Martha es madre de familia de cinco hijos, tiene 54 años de edad, su negocio que empezó hace siete años vendiendo ropa de segunda mano, luego comenzó a alquilar un cuarto para entradas económicas y cubrir parte de los gastos con el dinero del alquiler. Sus préstamos han sido para invertir mas en su negocio, y con las ganancias ir haciendo mejoras en su casa, que poco a poco ha venido mejorando con ayuda de sus hijos que trabajan, aun falta repellar las paredes y poner piso para un mejor bienestar como mejor higiene de su familia. Con este préstamo comprara paca de ropa el cual espera incrementar las ventas ya que cuando trae varias pacas nuevas sus clientes le compran varias piezas por buenas, y accesibles en costo, además tiene poco inventario por que esta esperando la aprobación del crédito para ir a comprar varias paca ya que solo tiene sabanas y fundas. Tiene dos hijos  aun estudiando el cual espera apoyarlos para que terminen su ciclo de estudios con el propósito que encuentren un mejor por venir a futuro.
texts.en:
Martha, 54, has five children and seven years ago she began to sell used clothing. Afterwards, she rented out a room to earn additional income to partially cover household expenses. Her loans have been used to invest in her business and the profits therefrom have been used to make some home improvements which, with help from her employed children, she has been able to accomplish little by little. She still needs to replaster the walls and to install flooring for better hygiene and well-being of her family. With this latest loan she intends to buy bundles of clothing so that she can increase her sales because when she brings new bundles of clothes her customers buy several articles because they are still good and at reasonable prices; besides, she has little inventory available because she's waiting for the loan to be approved to go buy several bundles; currently all she has left in stock are sheets and pillow cases. She has two children that are still in school and she hopes to be able to support them until they finish their schooling so that they can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy several bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta D. est une femme de 33 ans elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE EST depuis huit ans et a bénéficié successivement de seize prêts qu'elle bien gérés et remboursés. Son crédit lui permet de faire un petit commerce de boubous teintés. Elle achète sa marchandise en gros et le revend au détail dans son quartier. Elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fanta D. is a 33-year old woman who is married with five children. She has been a member of the village bank in BOUCOTTE EST for eight years and has had 16 consecutive loans which she has managed well and repaid. Her loan will allow her to have a small business selling dyed "boubous" (traditional gowns worn in West Africa). She buys her goods wholesale and retails them in her neighborhood. She helps out with the daily responsibilities of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her trading activity

loans.name: Las Delicias Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento LAS DELICIAS fue fundado el abril del 2009 a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir en su negocio. Se encuentra situado en el B/ 7 de Julio compuesto por 13 personas.

Como Presidenta tenemos a la señora Elda, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta de bijouteria, comida, costura y sastreria, promotoras de cosmeticos, venta de pastillas y refresco de mocochinchi, venta de helados, venta de horneados y panaderia; las reuniones se llevan a cabo los dias viernes a las 15:30 en el domicilio de la Sra Elda.

La Sra. Wilma es una de las fundadoras del grupo, ella se dedica a la sastreria, vive en casa de su hermana que vive en España, ella desea poder implementar más maquinas de costura en su taller para poder brindarles mejores oportunidades a su familia. 

La Sra. Eusebia sale todos los dias a vender helados en su carrito y cuando el clima esta un poco frio  ella vende pipocas, no dejando de trabajar, ella y su esposo trabajan muy duro para poder comprar una casita para criar a su familia, ademas ella es una persona muy responable y puntual con el grupo. 

La Sra. Ana es nueva en el Banco pero es una persona muy dinamica que tiene en su casa su venta de abarrotes y ademas por las noches vende hamburguesas y pollo frito, vive en casa propia, su familia esta muy orgullosa de ella ya que es una persona trabajadora.

Todos los integrantes estan agradecidos con Emprender  y  Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Delicias” (The Delightful Ones) was founded in April 2009 by a group of women who wanted to grow their small businesses. They are from the July 7th District and consist of thirteen members.

Sra. Elda serves as the group president. The women in this group engage in the sale of costume jewelry, food, handmade clothing, cosmetics, medicine, beverages, ice cream, and baked goods. Their meetings are held on Fridays at 3:30pm at the home of Sr. Elda.

Sra. Wilma is one of the founders of this group. She provides tailoring services out of the home of her sister, who currently lives in Spain. Wilma wants to acquire more sewing machines for her workshop so that she can provide better opportunities for her family.

Every day, Sra. Eusebia sells ice cream from her cart. When the weather is a bit cold, she sells popcorn. Eusebia and her husband always work very hard so that they can buy a house where they can raise their family. She is a responsible person and one of the more punctual members of the group.

Sra. Ana is new to the Communal Bank, but she is a dynamic person who sells groceries out of her own home. In the evenings, she sells hamburgers and fried chicken. Her family is very proud of her because she is a hard worker.

All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Loma de la Cruz esta formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan un mejor futuro para sus familias, y con el trabajo diario lo están consiguiendo poco a poco sintiéndose orgullosas por sus logros, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta es una ciudad que guarda los encantos de su centro histórico y también su combinación de tres culturas ricas en simbolismos, tradición y arte: Cañari, Inca y Española.

La Sra. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, por el sector de Miraflores, tiene 64 años de edad y se encuentra divorciado hace 15 años siendo los motivos que su esposo le planteo el divorcio pensando que le iba a quitar una herencias que tenia que recibir y como se encontraba fuera del país se divorciaron, en su unión conyugal procrearon 4 hijos, sus tres hijos se encuentran casados y viven independientemente fuera de su hogar, solo su hijo soltero de 27 años vive en su casa y es quien le ayuda en su negocio, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Blanca tiene una tienda hace 10 años en la cual labora de 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. trabaja de domingo a domingo y nunca cierra, por que cuenta con su fiel clientela, y si le va bien ya que tiene un gran surtido de mercadería, tiene un gran vinculo de amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación y le han beneficiado para surtir un poco mas su negocio, y nos comenta que fue incentiva a ingresar al banco por su amiga Marlene quien socia, con el nuevo préstamo que recibe de la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda como es arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc., ya que todos los productos se encuentran caros y necesita para surtir su negocio, su mayor sueño seria el de poder conservar su salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The communal bank Loma de la Cruz is made up of a group of women who seek a better future for their families and with their daily work, they are little by little managing to feel proud of their achievements. They live in the city of Cuenca. This is a city, known for the charming historic center and also it has a combination of three cultures rich in symbolism, tradition and art: Cañari, Inca y Spanish. Ms. Blanca is a member of the communal bank Loma de la Cruz. She lives in the city of Cuenca, in the Miraflores area. She is 64 years old and she has been divorced for 15 years. The reasons were that the husband stood for the divorce thinking that the inheritance would be taken and since he was abroad, they divorced. During the marriage, they had 4 children. Three of her children are married and live independently, away from home. Only her single, 27 year old son lives at home and he helps with her business. He does not have his own house because he is renting. Blanca has had a store for 10 years. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p. m., working from Sunday to Sunday and never closing because she has a faithful clientele. If things go well now that she has a large selection of merchandise, she will have a good bond of friendship with all of her communal bank partners. She is in her second cycle of working with the loans from the foundation and it has been beneficial for stocking her business a little more. She tells us that she was influenced to join the bank by her friend Marlene, who is a member. With the new loan that she receives from the foundation, she is going to invest in the purchase of products for her store like rice, sugar, noodles etc. Since all of the products are expensive and she needs to stock her store. Her biggest dream would be to keep her health, so she can continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies, rice, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Alcibiares

texts.es:
El Sr. Alcibíares es casado con la señora Jesusa tienen 5 hijos, son oriundos de Cochabamba la ciudad jardin denominada asi por que existen muchas flores, el cliente nació el 30 de Junio de 1976 aproximadamente 10 años que viven en la comunidad Paso del Chivo, se dedica a la agricultura están ya esta dos Años trabajando con la institución.
Los señores actualmente están sembrando maíz, papa y poroto y están agradecidos con la institución por el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Alcibíares is married to Sra. Jesusa. They have five children and live in the city of Cochabamba, an area known for its gardens that produce many flowers. Alcibíares was born on June 30, 1976, and has been living the community of Paso del Chivo for the past ten years. He is engaged in agriculture and has been a client of Emprender for two years.

Alcibíares is currently growing corn, potatoes, and beans. He is grateful to Emprender for providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Mazahir

texts.en:
Mazahir D. is a market vendor. He is 42 years old, married and has one son. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for 10 years. With all these years of experience, Mazahir has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruits and vegetables so that they keep in marketable condition and do not lose taste and useful properties. 

Mazahir buys vegetables and fruits from the local farmers. He rents a place in the central bazaar of Imishli city. In the market, he is known among the people for his attractive prices and friendliness. Mazahir’s business generates stable and considerable income for his family. This season, Mazahir wants to purchase more products to sell. Mazahir thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: To restock and diversify products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
La señora  Olga Bautista es socia del banco comunal La Estancia, este banco se enecuentra en el cantón Paute formado por mujeres emprendedoras en busca de un mejor presente y futuro para su familia.  En este hermoso sector del Ecuador la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la floricultura y a sembrar futas como  manzanas, claudias, duraznos, etc.

 Olga es socia del banco comunal hace cinco ciclos, tiene 35 años y esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo es operador de máquinas agrarias y ella se dedica a la cria de pollos, tiene 200 aves al momento que las vende en una comunidad campesina,  con el trabajo de los dos lograron construir su vivienda propia, ademas ella  piensa ponerse un negocio de venta de ropa y ya cuenta con mercadería para iniciar el mismo.

Ella nos comenta que una amiga la incentivo a formar parte del banco comunal y desde entonces ha trabajado con los creditos  recibidos y  con el prestamo que la fundacion  le entregue va a comprar pollos, maíz y vitaminas para su crianza.

Su gran sueño dar a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Olga Bautista is a member of the communal bank "La Estancia." This bank, located in the canton of Paute, is made up of entrepreneurial women in search of a better present and future for their families. In this beautiful part of Ecuador, most people work cultivating flowers or fruits such as apples, plums, peaches, etc. Olga has been a member of the communal bank for five loan cycles. She is 35 years old and married with four children. Her husband is an agricultural machine operator, and she works raising chickens. She currently has 200 birds, which she sells in a rural community. Thanks to both of their work, they have been able to build their own house. In addition, Olga is planning to start a business selling clothing, and she already has merchandise for that purpose. Olga tells us that a friend encouraged her to join the communal bank, and since that time, she has worked with the loans she has received. With the current loan provided to her by the foundation, she will purchase chickens as well as corn and vitamins for her poultry farm. Her greatest dream is to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chickens, corn and vitamins

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat H. is a 33-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Matanat is a farmer. She has land and plants seasonal fruits. As a rule, Matanat and her son (who also works on the farm) grow sufficient crops for the consumption of the family and for selling. 

Matanat is hoping for a rich yield that she will sell in the market at prices attractive to the population. She is planning to purchase seeds and fertilizer and for this purpose she applied for a loan of 1600 Azerbaijani manats.

Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength in life.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es:
El Sr. Gerónimo es casado con la señora Toribia tienen tres hijos ellos son oriundos de Sucre la capital de Bolivia tambien denominada la ciudad de los cuatro nombre porque tiene cuatro nombres, actualmente viven en la comunidad Paso del Chivo Municipio de El Torno Santa Cruz, aproximadamente 4 años que están trabajando en la agricultura en su propio terreno, ellos siembran maíz para luego comercializar sus productos en el mercado de su zona.

Los señores están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Gerónimo is married to Sra. Toribia. They have three children and are originally from Sucre, the capital of Bolivia. Sucre was also called “the City of Four Names” because it had four names. They currently live in the community of Paso del Chivo, which is part of the city of El Tomo Santa Cruz. Gerónimo has been working in agriculture for approximately four years and has his own land. He grows corn that he will sell at the local market.

Gerónimo is grateful to Emprender for providing its support.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase special fertilizers and new garden tools

loans.name: Gladys Esperanza

texts.es:
Gladys R. tiene 27 años es otra  socia del banco comunal La Estancia, vive  en la comunidad del mismo nombre con sus dos hijos de 8 y 1 año  en casa de su padre  porque es madre soltera y los niños no son reconocidos  por su progenitor, por lo que debe  contribuir con los gastos  de la casa a mas de la mantención de sus niños.

 Nuestra socia nos comenta que éste sector es muy agrícola por lo que la mayoria de su poblacion se dedica al cultivo de flores y frutas como manzanas, duraznos, claudias y a la crianza de animales y es por eso que Gladys se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos  que son vendidos en el mercado de Gualaceo

Motivada por unas amigas formó parte de éste banco y desde hace seis ciclos trabaja con la Fundación, los créditos obtenidos le han permitido sacar adelante su negocio y a sus hijos y nos comenta que el nuevo préstamo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales como hierba, maíz y vitaminas.

Su meta es incrementar su negocio poco a poco para la mantención de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys R. is 27 years old and a member of “La Estancia” Communal Bank. She lives in the community also named La Estancia and has two children, ages 8 and 1. Gladys lives at home with her father because she is a single mother. Her children are not acknowledged by their biological father, who should be contributing toward child support and household expenses.

Gladys tells us she lives in a highly agricultural area where most of the population grows flowers and fruits, such as apples, peaches, and plums, as well as engages in animal husbandry. She decided to raise guinea pigs and chickens to sell at the Gualaceo Market.

Motivated by her friends, Gladys joined the Communal Bank and has now participated in six loan cycles with the Foundation. The loans have allowed her to succeed in her business and help her children get ahead. With this new loan, Gladys says she will purchase feed for her animals such as grasses, corn, and vitamins. Her goal is to grow her business over time so that she can continue supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy additional food to increase the variety of his goods

loans.name: Vista Al Mar Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, Vista al Mar (View of the Ocean), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the Samana PeninsuL., a lush but rugged area of the Dominican Republic, where there is a nascent tourist economy and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a widow with her daughter.

Ana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing sales business by purchasing pants, skirts, blouses and underwear to sell. She will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing a computer, books, pencils and notebooks for her daughter, as well as paying for her transport to school. Additionally, she would like to purchase a pig to raise in her yard. Her long-term goal is to improve her home little by little and to see her daughter go to the university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase pants, skirts, blouses and underwear for resale

loans.name: Julia Leonor

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Estancia está formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan un mejor presente y futuro para sus familias  y con su trabajo diario lo están consiguiendo poco a poco, la Estancia es una comunidad del cantón Paute éste lugar se caracteriza por su gran productividad de flores y frutas como  manzanas, duraznos, claudias, etc. y su belleza sin igual. 

 Julia R. es socia del banco comunal La Estancia  incentivada por sus compañeras formó parte del banco, ella es madre soltera de cinco hijos, su hijos mayores trabajan y aportan para los gastos de la casa, a sus 42 años se siente tranquila porque tienen su casa propia.

Ella se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos pero también a  criar pollos y cuyes que los vende en la organización campesina una comunidad de su sector.

 Este es su quinto ciclo en la fundación y los prestamos le han beneficiado para incrementar su negocio poco a poco y con el crédito que estan por entregarle va a  comprar más  cuyes y hierba para alimentarlos.

Su sueño es superarse cada día  más  junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Estancia” was formed by a group of women who seek both a better present and future for their families. They work daily to reach this goal a little bit at a time. The community of La Estancia is in the Paute region and is known for its high production of flowers and fruits, such as apples, peaches, and plums, as well as its natural beauty.

Julia R. is a member “La Estancia” Communal Bank and was convinced by the other members to join. She is a single mother with five children. Her older children work and contribute toward the household expenses. At 42 years of age, Julia feels at peace because she has her own home.

Julia engages in her household chores, but she also raises chickens and guinea pigs to sell at a farming cooperative in her community. This is her fifth loan cycle with the Foundation. Her previous loans have helped her to gradually grow her business. She will use this loan to purchase more guinea pigs and the grasses needed to feed them. Her dream is to improve each day along with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs and feed

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es:
Venta de prendas de vestir (calcetines, chompas, buzos), venta de cocinas, elaboración de camas, trenzado de mantas, servicio de muellería y venta de pantuflas. Son los diversos negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Rosas Blancas que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani, se agruparon hace poco por la necesidad de acceder al préstamo e invertir en sus negocios, así por ejemplo, Julia Ahuayo de 34 años hace mantas hace dos años en su domicilio y entrega a diferentes tiendas, Virginia M. de 21 años costura prendas de vestir en su domicilio.
Todas necesitan comprar mercadería, materia prima  e insumos para sus negocios y ofrecer productos buenos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of the “Rosas Blancas” (White Roses) Group are engaged in various businesses selling clothing (socks, sweaters, and sweatshirts), prepared foods, beds, braided rugs, and slippers. One member provides auto body services. They are all part of the Collpani Community Center and recently joined together so they could access a loan to invest in their businesses. For example, Julia Ahuayo is 34 years old and has been making blankets at home for two years and delivering them to different stores. Virginia M. is 21 years old and sews garments from her home. They all need to buy merchandise, materials, and supplies for their businesses so that they can offer high-quality products to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & materials

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: Julia Del Carmen tiene 43 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. Ella se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Ella tenía muchas dificultades y decido sacar a sus hijos y su familia adelante, y decide realizar la compra de ciertos productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar  debido a que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para sustentar a su hogar. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar entre otros productos. Ella tiene le deseo de establecer una tienda de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julia Del Carmen is 43 years old and a single mother. She has three children in school. Julia has been operating a grocery store for more than eleven years. She has had many difficulties in providing for her children and helping them get ahead. Julia decided to sell certain products such as rice, beans, and sugar, but her earnings were not enough to sustain her household. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to purchase rice, corn, beans, sugar, and other products. She hopes to establish a clothing store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, corn, beans, sugar, and other products

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 7 Group

texts.en:
Lenel is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres en Desarrollo (Women in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their six children.

Lenel is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown in her business and her loan amount. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of running a "colmado" (small corner store), by purchasing rice, sugar, cooking oil and other supplies. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing school supplies and to save toward her long-term goal of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil and other supplies

loans.name: Taina

texts.es:
Taina, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 25 años, es madre de un hijo, menor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de Juanes y bebidas, ambas actividades las realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es chofer de un motocarro. Taina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de bebidas.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será invertido una parte en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de su motocarro y la otra parte será invertido en la compra de venta de. La meta de Taina es tener un restaurante bien implementado y tener otro motocarro.
texts.en:
Taina is an enterprising woman who lives in the District of Callería in the Ucayali Region. She is 25 years old and the mother of a dependent child. She sells “juanes” (chicken & rice steamed in a banana leaf) and soft drinks out of her home. Taina has the support of her husband, who is a motorcycle taxi driver.

She joined the Communal Bank “Amigas por Siempre” (Friends Forever) three years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used to purchase beverages to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 2000 soles. Part of the money will be used to buy spare parts to repair her motorcycle taxi. The rest will be used to buy soft drinks. Taina’s goals are to open a restaurant and acquire another motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts & soft drinks

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia, es una mujer muy puntual en sus reuniones, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 33 años, es madre de una hija menor de edad, ella se dedica al alquiler de su Shindaiwa (maquina utilizada en la agricultura), esta actividad la realiza desde su casa, es soltera. Patricia forma parte del Banco comunal “Las Doncellas”, desde hace cinco años.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en el mantenimiento de su máquina, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, que será invertido en la renovación y construcción de su casa. La meta de Patricia, es comprar dos maquinarias más.
texts.en:
Patricia is a woman who is always on time to her meetings. She lives in the District of Callería in the Ucayali Region. Patricia is 33 years old and a single mother with a young daughter. She rents out her Shindaiwa machine (used for pruning trees and trimming hedges) and manages her business from home.

Patricia joined the Communal Bank “Las Doncellas” (The Maidens) five years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used to pay for equipment maintenance. She is now requesting a loan of 3000 soles in order to pay for renovations to her house. Patricia’s goal is to buy two more machines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for home renovations

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca, es una mujer honrada y muy querida por sus compañeras, vive en el distrito D. Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 54 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos, todos mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas refrescantes. Paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, ambas actividades las realiza en su casa, no cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo ya que éste dejó D. trabajar por encontrarse delicado D. salud. 
Blanca forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Sabias”, desD. hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que fue invertido en bebidas, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 300 soles, que será utilizado en la compra más bebidas. La meta D. Blanca es llegar a tener su Distribuidora D. gaseosas.
texts.en:
Blanca is an honest woman who is well-liked by her friends. She lives in the District of Manantay in Ucayali Region. Blanca is 54 years old and the mother of four adult children. She sells soft drinks and clothing. Both businesses are managed from her home. Her husband does not proviD. financial support because he had to stop working because of poor health.

Blanca joined the Communal Bank “Las Mujeres Sabias” (The Wise Women) one year ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used to buy soft drinks. She is requesting another loan of 300 soles in order to purchase more soft drinks. Her goal is to open a soft drink distribution center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Flamencos Group

texts.es:
Venta de CDs, trenzado de mantas, venta de plantas medicinales, venta de verduras,  fabricación de calzados y atención de tienda de barrio. Son los diversos negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Flamencos que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani. Esta será para muchas su primera experiencia de crédito y están  motivadas y con optimismo de mejorar y hacer crecer sus negocios. Así por ejemplo Elena Q. de 25 años vende Cds en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto  y desea hacer crecer su negocio, Feliza M. de 29 años trenza mantas hace 3 años en su domicilio y quiere fortalecer se negocio.
Todas necesitan comprar mercadería, materia prima  e insumos para sus negocios y ofrecer productos buenos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of the Flamencos Group are involved in a variety of retail businesses selling CDs, braided rugs, medicinal plants, vegetables, footwear, and groceries. They are part of the Collpani Community Center. For many of the members, this will be their first experience working with credit. They are motivated and optimistic about improving and expanding their businesses. For example, Elena Q. is 25 years old and sells CDs at different fairs in the city of El Alto. She desires to grow her business. Feliza M. is 29 years old and has been manufacturing rugs out of her home. She wants to make her business stronger.

All of the members need to buy merchandise, materials, and supplies for their businesses so they can provide good products to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & materials

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es: El grupo “Paraíso” esta representado por la señora María Jaqueline y conformada por 10 miembros los cuales se conocen muy bien ya que no es la primera vez que trabajan bajo esta modalidad D. créditos solidarios como grupo. La gran mayoría D. las socias se dedica al comercio D. productos como ropa para niños, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos D. forma ambulante o por medio D. catálogos, servicio D. peluquería, entre los varones se dedican muchos se dedican al transporte D. público, servicio D. pintura D. viviendas y la atención D. café Internet. El mercado en el que trabajan es bastante competitivo por lo que los socios continuamente van mejorando sus productos y mejorando sus servicios para no dejarse sorprender por la competencia. La mayoría D. los socios destinará el crédito al mejoramiento D. sus negocios así como a la compra D. insumos, materiales y a mejorar sus herramientas D. trabajo, como pintura nueva para sus vehículos, compra D. materiales al por mayor como abarrotes y mayor material para la venta D. ropa. Dentro D. la institución los socios van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando pagos puntuales y ganas D. sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Paraíso” (Paradise) Group is led by Sra. María Jaqueline and consists of ten members who know each other very well. This is not the first time they have participated together in a solidarity group loan. Most of the members have retail businesses selling products such as children’s clothing, groceries, cosmetics through catalog orders and on-demand, and hairstyling services. The male group members are primarily involved in public transportation, residential house painting, and management of an Internet café. The markets in which they work are very competitive, so the members are continually improving their products and services so that they won’t be surprised by their business rivals.

Most of the members will use their loans to improve their business by paying for supplies, materials, and improvements to their equipment, such as repainting their vehicles. Others will buy inventory in bulk to sell such as groceries and clothing. The members are starting their third loan cycle with the Institution. They have demonstrated that they are capable of completing their payments on time and becoming successful on behalf of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Seke Group

texts.es:
Elaboración de mantas, venta de refrescos, gelatina, camas, diversas frutas, pescado, pasankalla (pipoca de maíz) y alimento seco. Son los diversos negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Seke que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani, se agruparon hace 5 años aproximadamente. Una de las integrantes es Alicia Q. de 26 años se dedica al trenzado de mantas hace 3 años. Otra integrante es Angélica M. de 23 años, también trenza mantas hace mucho tiempo. Silveria C. de 43 años vende comida en la feria 16 de Julio.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería en casos de negocios de comercio, materia prima (fleco) en los negocios de producción como el trenzado de mantas.
texts.en:
The members of the Seke Group are involved in various businesses selling blankets, soft drinks, gelatin, beds, various fruits, fish, popcorn, and dry goods. They are part of the Collpani Community Center. The members came together as a group five years ago. One of them is Alicia Q., who is 26 years old and has been manufacturing rugs for three years. Another member is Angélica M., who is 23 years old and has also been making braided rugs for quite some time. Silveria C. is 43 years old and sells food at the July 16th Fair.

They all need a loan in order to buy merchandise and raw materials (such as fringe) for their businesses producing braided rugs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & materials

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Diamantes” esta representado por L. señora Dilian y conformada por 11 miembros  de socios que en general se conocen de tiempo ya que residen en el mismo barrio. Una gran mayoría de las socias se dedican a L. actividad comercial como por ejemplo L. presidenta se dedica a L. venta de abarrotes, otras se dedican a L. venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de pan, venta de zapatos, leche y yogur. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias afirman que el nivel competitivo es alto pero que saben como salir adelante ya que tienen experiencia en su rubro y saben como salir adelante ya que de ello depende el sustento de su familia. El crédito será destinado a L. ampliación de sus negocios con al adquisición de mercadería insumos y herramientas que faciliten su trabajo. En cuanto a L. experiencia crediticia de los miembros del grupo una  gran parte  ya trabajo bajo L. modalidad de créditos individuales y solidarios por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento sobre el manejo de los fondos otorgados, saben invertir en sus negocios y cumplir con sus obligaciones de forma que puedan obtener una ganancia que les ayude a mejorar L. calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Diamantes” (Diamonds) Group is led by Sra. Dilian and consists of eleven members who know each other because they live in the same neighborhood. A majority of the members are engaged in commercial businesses. For example, the group president sells groceries. Others sell food, clothing, cosmetics, bread, shoes, milk, and yogurt. Regarding the competitive environment, the members argue that the level of competition is high but they know how to deal with it because they have expertise in their specific fields and know their families’ livelihoods depend on them.

This loan will be used to expand their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to facilitate their work. As for their previous credit experience, the members have participated in both individual and solidarity group loans, so they have extensive knowledge of how to manage their funds, invest in their businesses, and complete their obligations. They hope this opportunity will guarantee a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operatng capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: La señora Pastora E. G., tiene 46 años, vive en el Barrio Laureles sur, Barrio conocido por la inseguridad social y la humiladad de sus habitantes, ella y su pareja viven juntos y él es jubilado, le apoya en los gastos de la casa. Doña Pastora tiene 4 hijos uno de 25 años de edad, que vive de manera independente los otros tres, tienen las edades de 12, 15 y 17 años, los cuales estudian la escuela secundaria, el mayor anhelo de la señora E. sería el tener las posibilidades económicas para preparar a sus hijos a las mejopres condiciones profesionales, asi como poder brindarles un hogar comodo y seguro donde habitar. Desde hace 10 ños tiene un negocio de costura al cual le desearía inyectar capital, con este prestamo podria comprar telas y elaborar uniformes, todo esto con el objetivo de aprovechar la temporada escolar que se avesina en nuestro páis y obtener mejores condiciones económicas y ofrecer a sus hijos un nuevo estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Pastora E. G. is 46 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood, an area known for its instability and the poverty of its residents. Since her husband is retired, she must work in order to cover the household expenses. They have four children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and lives independently. The other three are 17, 15, and 12 years of age and attend high school. Pastora’s greatest wish is to have economic opportunities so that she can prepare her children to become professionals as well as provide them with a comfortable and safe place to live.

For the past ten years, she has operated a sewing business into which she wants to inject capital. With this loan, Pastora will buy fabric for making uniforms. Her objective is to take advantage of the upcoming school season so that she can improve her financial situation and provide her children with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making uniforms

loans.name: Zafiro Group

texts.es: El grupo “Zafiro” esta representado por la señora Florinda y conformado por 11 miembros los cuales son personas muy alegres y entusiastas todos residen en el mismo barrio por los que son unidas y bien organizadas. Todos los miembros son personas muy trabajadoras como lo demuestran en sus puestos D. venta D. comida, venta D. ropa, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. hamburguesas, libros y material escolar. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias aseguran que saben manejar a sus cometidotes gracias a su experiencia a sus ganas D. salir adelante. El crédito será destinado a la ampliación, refacción y mejoramiento D. sus puestos D. trabajo así como a la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y materiales para mejorar sus ingresos que se traducirá en una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia D. los miembros del grupo ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad D. créditos individuales y solidaR. por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento sobre el manejo D. los fondos otorgados, saben invertir en sus negocios y cumplir con sus obligaciones D. forma puntual.
texts.en:
The “Zafiro” (Sapphire) Group is led by Sra. Florinda and consists of eleven members who are all cheerful and full of enthusiasm. Since they all live in the same neighborhood, they are well-organized and get along well with each other. All of the members are hardworking people who have demonstrated this quality through their businesses selling food, clothing, cosmetics, bread, groceries, hamburgers, books, and school supplies. Regarding the competitive environment, the members say they know how to manage the competition because of their experience and desire to succeed.

This loan will be used to expand, renovate, and improve their businesses through the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, and materials that will help improve their incomes and quality of life for their families. Regarding their previous credit experience, the members have worked with both individual and solidarity group loans and have extensive knowledge of how to manage their funds, invest in the businesses, and meet their obligations on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Monica Catalina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Buscando el Éxito esta formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan  cada día las mejores oportunidades para salir  adelante y tratar de darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias, viven en  Cuenca,  ciudad que tiene una riqueza arquitectónica y obras artísticas que le hicieron merecedora del nombramiento como Patrimonio Cultural del la Humanidad. 

 Mónica A. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, ella vive en el Sector de la Empresa Electrica de la Ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 24 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos niñas  7 y 2 años de edad, sus hijas son reconocidas por su padre pero no reciben ninguna ayuda por parte de el por lo que vive en  casa de sus padres.

Ella es comerciante trabaja en la abacería de sus padres ubicada en el mercado 12 de Abril, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo de 7 a.m. a 7 p.m., además se dedica a la venta de ropa americana y productos YANBAL  vendiendo principalemte a sus amigos y familiares a quienes les vista en sus casas o le vienen a ver para realizar los pedidos.

 Lleva 3 años 6 meses trabajando con el banco comunal y fue su mamá la que la incentivó para formar parte de este grupo y nos comenta que los préstamos le han beneficiado mucho para incrementar  su capital de trabajo y con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de ropa americana como pantalones, sacos, blusas, etc.

 Su gran sueño es acabar sus estudios de parvularia para dar clases en una guardería y ser una profesional para no depender de nadie.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Buscando el Éxito” (Seeking Success) was formed by a group of women who search each day for the best opportunities to get ahead and provide their families a better quality of life. The live in Cuenca, a city that has rich architectural and artistic works that have enabled it to become a World Heritage Site.

Mónica A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Buscando el Éxito”. She lives in the Utility District of the city of Cuenca. She is 24 years old and a single mother of two daughters, ages 7 and 2. Her children are acknowledged by their father, but he does not provide support. For this reason, Mónica and her children live with her parents.

She works as a vendor at her parents’ grocery store in the April 12th Market. Mónica works Monday through Sunday from 7am to 7pm. In addition, she sells American clothes and Yanbal beauty products to friends and relatives. She visits them in their homes so that they can view the products and place orders.

Mónica has been working with the Communal Bank for 3½ years after her mother convinced her to join the group. She says the loans have helped to increase her operating capital. This current loan from Fundación ESPOIR will be used to buy American clothes such as pants, coats, blouses, etc. Her greatest dream is to finish her studies so that she can become a professional teacher at a preschool and not depend on anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase American clothing to sell

loans.name: Las Tulipanes Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Tulipanes” están representados por las señora María Rosario y conformada por 13 miembros D. los cuales residen en la zona del parque industrial, todas las socias van cursando mas D. un ciclo con la institución demostrando siempre puntualidad en sus pagos y unidad en el grupo, En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias aseguran que saben manejar a sus cometidotes gracias a su experiencia a sus ganas D. salir adelante. El crédito será destinado a la ampliación, refacción y mejoramiento D. sus puestos D. trabajo así como a la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y materiales para mejorar sus ingresos que se traducirá en una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia D. los miembros del grupo ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad D. créditos individuales y solidarios por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento sobre el manejo D. los fondos otorgados, saben invertir en sus negocios y cumplir con sus obligaciones D. forma puntual.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Tulipanes” (The Tulips) is led by Sra. María Rosario and consists of 13 members who live in the district of Industrial Park. All of the members have participated in more than one loan cycle with the Institution. They have always completed their payments on time and worked together as a cohesive group. In dealing with the competition, the members are confident in managing their duties because of their experience and desire to succeed.

This loan will be used to expand, renovate, and improve their businesses. They plan to acquire merchandise, supplies, and materials to help them improve their earnings, which will result in a better quality of life for their families. Regarding their previous credit experience, the members have participated in both individual and solidarity group loans and have extensive knowledge of how to manage their funds. In addition, they know how to invest in their businesses and complete their obligations on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” desde hace 1 año, vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y  venta de ropa.

Jacinta nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y comprar mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir.

Ella requiere un nuevo crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar ropa al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros,la puntualidad y las charlas que imparte la promotora.
texts.en:
Jacinta has been a member of the community bank "Alto Alianza" for one year. She lives in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno. She is 38 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. She completed her primary education, and she sells and buys clothing. Jacinta told us that with the first loan she received from Movimiento Maneula Ramos, which was for 300 soles, she increased her business capital and bought a greater quantity of clothes. She requests a new loan of 2,000 soles ($725) with which she will buy clothes in bulk. Her dream for the future is to grow her business and in this way move herself and her family forward. The things she likes most about the community bank are the savings, the punctuality, and the talks that the organizer gives.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Maria Eugenia tiene más de 3 años de trabajar con créditos, mostrando un buen record crediticio, su actividad económica se basa en la comercialización de telas y accesorios para costura y la confección de prendas de vestir, entre lo que se destacan uniformes escolares, pantalones azules cortos para escolares. Que es su mayor fuente de ingresos ella siempre se ha propuesto salir adelante ya que no tiene suficiente ingresos para su familia. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima. Ella sueña con mantener siempre el negocio estable ya que tiene muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Eugenia has been a loan recipient for more than three years and has demonstrated a good credit record. She sells fabrics, sewing accessories, and apparel. Maria mainly produces school uniforms, blue trousers, and shorts for students. These items generate her largest source of income. She is always looking to get ahead, but she does not make enough money for her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase raw materials. Maria’s dream is to always maintain a stable business since she has many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Máxima es socia del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos” desde hace 7 años, vive en el distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria.  Ella cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes.
