Máxima nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y compró diversos productos para su tienda.

Con este crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles podrá comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, huevos, etc. al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es trabajar mejor y hacer crecer su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad que tienen las socias para cada reunión.
texts.en:
Máxima has been a member of the community bank "Manuela Ramos" for seven years. She lives in the district of Santa Rosa, in the province of El Collao and the the department of Puno. She is forty years old, is married, and has two children. She studied until the 5th grade of secondary school. She has a grocery store.

Máxima told us that with the first loan she had from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was for 300 soles, she was able to increase her capital and buy various products for her store.

With this loan of 1,000 ($375) soles she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc, in bulk.

Her dream for the future is to work better and grow her business.

The thing she likes most about he communal bank is that the members are punctual at every meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta G. est âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis trois ans et demi et a eu sept expériences avec le crédit. Elle vend des tissus teintés, des draps de lit et des chaussures. Participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fanta G., age 42, is married and the mother of three children. She's been a member of the Village Bank for three and a half years and obtained seven loans. She sells dyed fabrics, bed sheets, and shoes. She helps supporting her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her ability to autofinance

loans.name: Laura Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Buscando el Éxito esta formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan que cada las mejores oportunidades para salir adelante y tratar de darles una mejor  calidad de vida a sus familias, viven Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una riqueza arquitectónica y obras artísticas que le hicieron merecedora del nombramiento como Patrimonio Cultural del la Humanidad. 

Laura Q. vive en el Sector de Totoracocha en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 46 años de edad, se encuentra casada pero no convive con su esposo desde hace 15 años su separación se dio  por falta de comprensión en el hogar, juntos procrearon 5 hijos, que ya son mayores trabajan y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos del hogar,  aún no posee casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Nuestra socia es vendedora ambulante de confites, colas, cervezas, lleva 15 años en este oficio tiene un puesto en el estadio de fútbol, y también se dedica a vender en espectáculos públicos, además se dedica a  reciclar papel, plástico, vidrio y más en esta actividad  lleva 25 años, estos oficios le han permitido  sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia.

Lleva 4  años trabajando con su banco comunal y con los créditos recibidos ha ido incrementando poco a poco su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que  reciba va a comprar confites, aguas, colas, cervezas, etc. para abastecer su puesto.

Su gran sueño es comprarse una casita.
texts.en:
The Buscando el Éxito Communal Bank is comprised of a group of women who look for the best opportunities to get ahead. They try to give their families a better quality of life. They live in Cuenca, a city that has rich architecture and works of arts that make it deserving of being named a Cultural Heritage Site. Laura Q. lives in the Totoracocha area in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. She is 46 and married. She and her husband have been separated for 15 years and do not live together because of lack of understanding in the home. They have five children, who are now grown. They work and help her with the household expenses. She still does not have her own house, so she rents where she lives. She is a traveling salesperson, and she sells sweets, sodas, and beer. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has a stand in the soccer stadium. She also sells entertainment guides and recycles paper, plastic, glass, and more. She has been doing this for 25 years. These jobs have allowed her to survive and get her family ahead. She has been working in her communal bank for four years. With the loans she has received she has been increasing her business little by little. With the new loan she will buy sweets, water, soda, and beer, etc. to stock her stand. Her big dream is to buy a small house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets, water, soda, and beer, etc.

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es: LLeny, es una mujer muy solidaria y puntual, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 40 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos y motocarros, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien la apoya en el mismo negocio. LLeny forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra y posterior venta de repuestos de motos y motocarros, ahora ella necesita 500 soles, que utilizará en la compra y venta de repuestos.	El anhelo de LLeny es implementar mejor su negocio y así  mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lleny is a very supportive and punctual woman. She lives in the district of Callería, in the Ucayali region. She is forty years old, and is the mother of three children, who are all young. She sells parts for motorbikes and three-wheelers. She has the support of her husband, who helps her in her store. Lleny has been part of the community bank "Las Orquídeas" for a year. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, and this was used to buy and later sell parts for motorbikes and three-wheelers. At this moment, she needs 500 soles ($200) that she will use to buy and sell parts. Lleny's wish is to better run her business and so to improve their income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy and sell spare parts for motorbikes and three-wheelers

loans.name: Arely De Fatima

texts.es: La señora Arely Del Carmen ella tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos que mantener. La señora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace  3 años, debido a que quería brindar un mayor sustento a su familia. Ya que su esposo laboraba  pero no ganaba lo suficiente. Desde ese tiempo ella ha sabido manejar sus inventarios, de forma que ahora tiene un negocio bien establecido. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de cosméticos, ya que actualmente tiene buenos pedidos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una buena tienda en el mercado municipal que le brinde estabilidad económica a ella y a su familia en general.
texts.en:
Arely Del Carmen is 36, married, and has two children to support. She sells cosmetics. She started this business three years ago because she wanted to give her family more support. Her husband worked, but he did not earn enough. From the start she has known how to manage her inventory in such a way that now her business is well established. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics because she currently has good orders. Her dream is to have a good store in the municipal market that will offer economic stability to her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe es una mujer muy querida por sus compañeras, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 59 años, madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad y semiindependientes, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería (por campaña), al alquiler de su carro y a la administración de un taller de mecánica donde trabaja su hijo, la venta  de mercadería la desempeña saliendo a ofrecer a amigos y amistades, es madre soltera. Lupe forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Almendras”, desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra y posterior venta de mercadería para campaña escolar.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será invertido en la reparación de su carro para alquilarlo y a la venta de mercadería para atender la campaña escolar. La meta de Lupe es seguir aumentando el negocio que tiene y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lupe is a woman who is well loved by her friends. She lives in the district of Callería in the Ucayali region. She is 59 years old and the mother of three children all of whom are grown-up and semi-independent. She sells goods by the season, rents out her car, and manages a mechanics shop where her son works. She sells the goods to her friends and acquaintances. She is a single mother. Lupe has been part of the community bank "Las Almendras" for three years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which was invested in buying and later selling goods for the school shopping season. At this moment, she needs a loan of 2,000 soles ($725), which she will invest in repairing her car so that she can rent it out and in selling goods for the school shopping season. Lupe's goal is to continue increasing her business and to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to repair her car to rent it out and in selling goods for the school season

loans.name: Hugo Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo de  43 años ,  es conviviente tiene 3 hijos dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y el ultimo tiene 10 años, el cuenta con casa propia de material noble compartida con una de sus hermanas, casa herencia de sus padres, su conyugue cuenta con el ingreso de un negocio reciente de cabinas de internet en su mismo domicilio, El Sr. hugo se dedica como maestro de construccion hace 15 años,se inicio como ayudante desde muy joven,  el Sr. hugo tiene muchos sueños y metas uno de ellos es poder tener su maquinaria completa, con el dinero que solicita invertira en mas maderas.
texts.en:
Hugo, 43, is in a common law marriage and has three children. Two of the children are grown, and one is ten years old. He has his own house made from sturdy material. He shares the house with one of his sisters; the house is an inheritance from his parents. His life partner has income from a recent business, an internet café in their home. Hugo has been a construction foreman for 15 years. He started as a helper when he was very young. Hugo has a lot of dreams and goals. One of those is to be able to have all of his machinery. He will use the money he is requesting to buy more lumber.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lumber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Puca Puca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Puca Puca que significa Rojo Rojo, inicia su tercer ciclo con 18 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, cereales, abarrotes en general, ropa, leña, verduras, animales menores, cosméticos y carpintería.

Como es el caso D. la señora Epifania es casada, tiene 70 años y 4 hijos, Epifania se dedica a la venta D. comida por las tardes frente del puesto D. salud D. su barrio, además viaja a las ferias en donD. compra quesos y cereales que venD. a intermediarios.

Mientras que Jesusa es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Jesusa junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería y también alquilan sus maquinas a obras. Además Jesusa compra y venD. madera.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 450 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 14,050 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. cereales, quesos, ajo, madera, cosméticos, ropa, verduras, leña.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, mejorar su negocio y comprar otra maquina.
texts.en:
The Puca Puca(which means Red Red )Communal bank is starting its third cycle with 18 members. The members have different businesses like the selling food, grains, general groceries, clothing, firewood, vegetables, small animals, cosmetics and carpentry. Like the case of Ms. Epifania, who is married, is 70 years old and has 4 children. She sells food in the afternoons in front of her neighborhood’s health clinic. She also travels to markets to buy cheeses and grains that she sells to middlemen. While Jesusa has a live-in partner, is 39 years old and has 5 children. Jesusa along with her husband have a carpentry workshop and they also rent their machines to construction projects. In addition, Jesusa buys and sells wood. The members need different amounts for their loans like 450 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles which is a total amount of 14,050 soles in loans in the Communal Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of grains, cheese, garlic, wood, cosmetics, clothing, vegetables and firewood. The dreams of the members are to build their houses, improve their businesses and buy other machines.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy grains, cheese, garlic, wood, cosmetics, clothing, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Reyna Carolina

texts.es: Reyna tiene 45 años de edad, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de un salón de belleza, hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio. Ella inicio como aprendiz en un salón de belleza de una amiga, pero ella es muy inteligente pues le gustaba mucho y disfrutaba realizar cada tarea de esta actividad además tenía a sus 2 hijos a su cargo que alimentar diariamente poco a poco fue progresando hasta establecer su propio local. Ella enfrento desafíos como lo fue el a pagar el alquiler del local de su negocio porque la dueña aumenta el pago del alquiler cada año, pero cada día ofrece lo mejor de sus servicios para obtener más clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, tintes, agua oxigenada, acondicionadores, tratamientos para el cabello y shampoo que son los productos que utiliza. Su deseo es seguir adelante y obtener la fama de muy buena calidad y ofrecer un excelente servicio.
texts.en:
Reyna is 45 years old. She works offering the beauty salon services. She has worked on this humble business for more than 8 years. She started as an apprentice in a friend's beauty shop, but she is very smart because she enjoyed the work very much and enjoyed each task of this activity. In addition she had her two children under her responsibility whom she had to feed every day. Little by little she progressed until she established her own beauty shop. She faced challenges such as paying the rent of her business' locale because the owner increases the rent every year, but each day she offers the best of her services in order to gain more customers. The loan she requests is to be used as working capital to buy perfumes, lotions, dyes, peroxide, conditioners, shampoo and hair treatments which are the products she uses the most. Her hope is to keep moving forward and become known for offering and excellent service and very good quality.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen Rosa G. vive en casa propia D. adobe revestido junto a su esposo, dos hijas menores en edad escolar y una mayor que realiza estudios superiores en el distrito D. Santiago - Ica. Actualmente labora como obrera D. planta en una empresa Agroexportadora, y su esposo como supervisor D. campo en un fundo agrícola D. la zona. Sus excedentes son derivados en inversión para construcción D. su casa D. adobe y educación para sus hijas. Poseen bienes que han adquirido con sus ahorros. Requieren financiamiento para realizar construcción D. adobe en terreno que tienen anexo a su domicilio. Su mayor sueño  es lograr que sus hijas sean profesionales y lograr una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Rosa G. lives in her own home maD. of adobe together with her husband, two school age daughters, and a grown daughter who is in college in the Santiago - Ica district. She currently works as a laborer in an agro-exporting company and her husband works as a supervisor in the field of an agricultural estate in the area. The money left is invested in the construction of their adobe house and in their daughters' education. They own property they have acquired through their savings. The require financing to build in the plot they have by their home. Their greatest dream is to ensure that their daughters become professionals and achieve a better quality of life for their family. They both thank the support we can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving their house

loans.name: Pureza Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pureza, inicia su segundo ciclo con 18 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comida, cereales, leña, abarrotes en general, ropa, combustibles, flores, animales menores, verduras restaurante.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Martha es casada, tiene 41 años y 7 hijos, Martha viaja a las diferentes ferias D. L. región en donD. compra cereales y venD. en los mercados D. L. ciudad, además en épocas D. cosecha hace papa seca.

Mientras que Hermelinda es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Hermelinda tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. chicha, además los Días domingos venD. golosinas y chicha en el recreo D. su papá.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 300 soles, 600soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. azúcar, arroz, carne, golosinas, cereales, ropa, leña y flores.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, sus hijos salgan adelante y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Pureza (purity) begins its second cycle with 18 members. The members work in different businesses such as selling food, cereal, wood, general necessity products, clothing, fuel, flowers, small animals vegetables and a restaurant. Such is the case of Mrs. Martha who is married, 41 years old and has 7 children. Martha travels to the different fairs in the region where she buys cereals to sell in the city markets. In addition, during the time of harvest she makes dried potato. On her part, Hermelinda lives with her partner, is 35 years old and has two children. Hermelinda has a stand in the market F. Vivanco where she sells chicha (drink maD. of fermented maize). In addition, on Sundays she sells snacks and chicha in her dad's recreation park. The members need different amounts of loans, like 200 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, adding up to a total of 10,200 soles in loans in the Communal Bank. Their loans will be invested in buying sugar, rice, meat, candy, cereal, clothing, wood, and flowers. The members dream with owning a home, ensuring their children succeed and improving their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying sugar, rice, meat, candy, cereal, clothing, wood, and flowers

loans.name: Rosa Hortencia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Porvenir está conformado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan la manera de adelante y brindarles  una vida mejor a sus familias, todas  viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad que  se caracteriza por ser la tercera  más importante del país y por la hermosura de su paisaje andino.

Rosa tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras de la banco comunal, tiene 20 ciclos trabajando con los prestamos que la fundación le ha entregado y éstos le han permitido elaborar sus manualidades y artesanias, fue una amiga quien le incentivo para que integre el banco y reciba los beneficios que la institución ofrece.

 Ella elabora bordados, velas y  adornos decorativos, aprendió esta labor y ya lleva  8 años  cuenta con un local en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, labora de 9 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. de lunes a sábado.

Rosa vive en el en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 34 años de edad y se encuentra casada, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 años, su esposo también es artesano y tiene un pequeño taller de hierro forjado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá pero en forma independiente,.

Con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la fundación va  a invertir en su negocio en la compra de materiales para realizar sus manualidades como pintura, cerámica, hilos  etc..

Su meta es seguir trabajando y ahorrar para seguir creciendo con su  negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank Porvenir is made up of a group of women who are looking to get ahead and provide a better life for their families. They all live in the city of Cuenca, a town portrayed as being the third most important in the country for the beauty of its Andean landscape.

Rosa has a great friendship with all of her partners in the community bank. She has worked through 20 loan cycles that the foundation has given her and these loans have allowed her to make her handicrafts. It was one of her friends who motivated her to join the bank and receive the benefits that the institution offers. She makes embroidered goods, candles, and decorative ornaments. She learned how to do this work and has been doing it for 8 years in downtown Cuenca. She works from 9 a.m. until 6 p.m., Monday to Saturday.

Rosa lives in the urban part of the city of Cuenca. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children who are 8 and 6 years old. Her husband is also an artisan and he has a small iron-forging shop. They don’t have their own home so they live independently in her mother’s house.With the new loan from the foundation, she is going to invest in the purchase of materials to do her work such as paint, ceramics, thread, etc. Her goal is to continue working and save in order to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint, ceramics, thread, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Porvenir está conformado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan la manera de adelante y brindarles  una vida mejor a sus familias, todas  viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad que  se caracteriza por ser la tercera  más importante del país y por la hermosura de su paisaje andino.

Rosa Guamán es socia del banco comunal Porvenir, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sector del cementerio, tiene 61 años de edad y es casada, su esposo es jubilado de la empresa eléctrica, junto a él han procreado 2 hijos que se encuentran de 30 y 28 años de edad, son solteros y le ayudan económicamente en su hogar, con  en el esfuerzo conyugal de muchos años  están logrando terminar su casa pero aun les hace falta las ventanas y algunas cosas más.

Rosa trabaja en su  restaurant desde  hace 9 años y nos comenta que le va bien ya que su puesto tiene en su casa y no tiene que pagar arriendo, su horario es 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. y fue una tía quien le enseño a  preparar sus productos y también a prendió de libros y revistas de gastronomía y la experiencia.
 Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación, y fue su hermana quien le incentivo a que sea parte de este grupo muy alegre, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la fundación  va a comprar productos como arroz, aceite, azúcar, sal y muchos más productos que necesita para su restaurant.

Su meta es  incrementar su negocio y  tener más clientes.
texts.en:
The Porvenir communal bank is comprised of a group of women who are looking for a way to progress and provide a better life for their families. All of them live in Cuenca, a city which is the third most important in the country and known for the beauty of its Andean landscape. Rosa Guamán is a member of the Porvenir communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca near the cemetary. She is 61 years old and married. Her husband is retired from the electric company and together they have 2 children, 30 and 28 years old, who are single and who help the household financially. Through their efforts over the years, this couple is managing to finish building their house although they still need to do the windows and a few other things. Rosa has been working in her restaurant for the past 9 years and tells us that it is going well, as her she has it in her house and does not have to pay any rent. Her working hours are from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m.. One of her aunts taught her how to prepare her products and she also learned from books and cooking magazines as well as from experience. This is her second loan cycle with the foundation, and it was her sister who encouraged her to become part of this very happy group. With this new loan she is going to buy rice, oil, sugar, salt and many other goods that she needs for the restaurant. Her goal is to grow her business and to have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, salt, oil, etc.

loans.name: Qabil

texts.en: Qabil J. is 41 years old, and is married with three adorable children. Qabil has been breeding cows since he was a young boy. He likes animals and enjoys looking after them. He also has a purposeful and determined personality. Day by day, he waits for his cow to grow, because his profit depends on how many litres of milk his cow will provide after it has been raised. Qabil plans to improve the facilities of his farm and purchase more cows, so he is asking for a loan of 1600 AZN. Let’s support this friendly man, who is a fine example of strength. Your help is very important.

loans.use: purchase two cows and one calf

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
PameL. es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedora.
PameL. es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, PameL. culmino sus estudios D. Química Farmacéutica, PameL. venD. ropa variada a pedido, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito y contado. 
PameL. necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. pantalones.
El sueño D. PameL. son tener una farmacia.
texts.en:
PameL. is a partner of "Banco Comunal Emprendedora". She lives with her significant other, she is 25 years old and has a one-year-old son. PameL. finished her studies of Pharmaceutical Chemistry. PameL. sells a variety of clothes by order offering the products to her friends and relatives. Her sales are on credit or cash.

PameL. needs a loan of 600 soles to be invested in buying trousers. It is PameL.'s dream to own a drug store.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of trousers.

loans.name: Ndèye Mama

texts.fr: Ndèye Mama S. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de neuf enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE PEYRISSAC depuis neuf ans et demis et y a bénéficié de 17 prêts qu'elle bien gérés et remboursés. Son crédit lui permet de développer un petit restaurant et de faire le commerce de volaille. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Mama S., age 48, is married and the mother of nine children. She's been a member of the Village Bank BOUCOTTE PEYRISSAC for nine years and obtained 17 loans that she managed and repaid well. Her loan enables her to develop a small restaurant and to sell poultry. She contributes to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her ability to invest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Eda

texts.es:
Eda es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedora.
Eda es casada, tiene 48 años y 7 hijos, Eda vende choclo y alfalfa en el mercado Covadonga, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria, además Eda viaja a las ferias en donde vende panes y de allá compra cereales.
Eda necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de alfalfa y choclo.
Eda sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eda is a partner of "Banco Comunal Emprendedora". Eda is married, 48 years old and has 7 children. Eda sells corn cob and alfalfa as a peddlar on the market Covadonga . She also travels to local markets to sell bread and to buy cereal.

Eda needs a loan of 600 soles to be invested in buying alfalfa and corn cob. It is Eda´s dream to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa and corn cob.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim A. is 38 years old, and married with two children. His work as a cattle breeder enables him to provide for the needs of his family. Since Karim is a very ambitious man, he would like to buy more cattle, and build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of 1600 AZN in order to begin to realize his dream.

When his project is carried out, Karim will have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: purchase four baby calves

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedora.
Isabel es soltera, tiene 65 años y 4 hijos, Isabel tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones en su casa, Isabel confecciona ropa típica con la ayuda de sus hijas, sus ventas los realiza en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Isabel sueña con producir mas y que sus hijos tengan un trabajo seguro.
texts.en:
Isabel is a partner of "Banco Comunal Emprendedora". Isabel is single, 65 years old, and has 4 children. Isabel has a small dressmaking workshop at home. She makes typical garments with the help of her daughters and sells her products at different markets of the town.

Isabel needs a loan of 600 soles to be invested in buying material. Isabel dreams of increasing her production and of her children having a stable job.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Paula Imelda

texts.es:
Paula es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedora.
Paula es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Paula junto a sus hijas se dedican a tejer prendas de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga de sus cliente, como colchas, chompas, ropones. Además Paula vende ropas interiores a pedidos.
Paula necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana y como parte de pago de una maquina de tejer.
Los sueños de Paula son tener una empresa de tejidos e implementar un negocio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paula is a partner of "Banco Comunal Emprendedora. Paula lives with her significant other, is 48 years old, and has 2 children. Together with her daughters she knits garments according to orders from her customers such as blankets, sweaters and baptism robes and she sells lingerie by orders.

Paula needs a loan of 3000 soles to be invested in buying wool and pay off a knitting machine. Paula's dreams are to own an enterprise of knitted garments and set up a business for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and pay off a knitting machine.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
La Sra. Arminda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Breo”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 63 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.
Arminda, se dedica a la venta D. panes y dulces,  lleva 08 años ejerciendo este tipo D. actividad, se encuentra ubicada en su propia casa en un lugar muy bien acondicionado.  
Arminda, como le dicen D. cariño, poco a poco, fue ahorrando y haciéndose muy conocida por sus clientes, que hoy en día son clientes fijos en su puesto. 
Actualmente, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa, por el trabajo que realiza, su esposo le ayuda repartiendo los panes a los clientes, moradores y amigos.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará ingredientes e insumos como: harina, azúcar, manteca,  sal y saborizantes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. una nueva vitrina, para exhibir sus productos.
Arminda, agradece bastante, al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional y a otras mujeres como ella, que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Arminda belongs to the community bank "El Breo" in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the department of San Martín. She is married, 63 years old, and is the mother of three children who still depend on her.

Arminda sells breads and sweets. She has been in this business for 8 years and works from a well set-up location in her own house.

Arminda, as she is affectionately called, was saving money little by little and making herself very well know to her customers, so that today she has customers who are very loyal to her.

Currently, she is continuing with this same business and is very proud of her work. Her husband helps her deliver the bread to her customers, residents, and friends.

With this loan of 2,000 soles ($725), she will buy ingredients and supplies such as: flour, sugar, butter, salt and flavorings. She will also invest part of the money in buying a new counter to display her goods.

Arminda is thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the unconditional support they give to her and to other women like her who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread-making supplies

loans.name: Tania Felicitas

texts.es:
Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedora.
Tania es soltera, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, estudios cosmetología, Tania tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas y golosinas, además Tania vende ropa a pedido.
Tania necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa y cerveza.
Los sueños de Tania son tener un salón de belleza y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Tania is a partner of "Banco Comunal Emprendedora. Tania is single, 29 years old, and has 2 children. She studied cosmetology. Tania owns a store at home where she sells groceries, beverages and candy as well as chothes by order.

Tania needs a loan of 1050 soles to be invested in buying clothes and beer. It is Tania's dream to own a beauty parlor and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes and beer.

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr: Mame D. est âgée de 42 ans, elle mariée sans enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de CHÂTEAU D'EAU depuis quatre ans et demi et a eu de bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour l'avoir obtenu à neuf fois de suite. Elle développe un petit commerce de draps et de couvertures de lit. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de sa belle famille et de son foyer.
texts.en:
Mame D., aged 42, is married without children. She has been a member of the village bank "Château d'eau" (water tower) for four and a half years. She is experienced in the credit system, since she was granted nine loans in a row. She runs a small business of sheets and bed covers. Mame supports her husband in providing for their lovely family and their home.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Rafaela Carolina

texts.es:
La Señora Rafaela Carolina S. M., Labora como colectora de ruta en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, ella tiene una hija a su cargo, la que   se encuentran en edad escolar, es 
casada, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 4 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  ella es una cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: ladrillos, cemento, etc. El cual utilizara para el piso de su  casa de habitación, el que le Brindara mejores  condición de vida a sus hijos.
Rafaela dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rafaela Carolina S. M. works as a custodian at Managua's Wholesale Market. She is married and has one school-age daughter. She has been working with CEPRODEL for four years, during which time she's received four CEPRODEL loans and used them to improve her home. She is an excellent client. The loan requested will be used to purchase construction materials such as bricks, cement, etc., which she will use for the floor of her house. In this way she will be able to offer her children better living conditions. Rafaela says that CEPRODEL's loans have made it possible for her to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and expanding her home

loans.name: Maritsa

texts.es:
La señora Maritza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 48 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella y está estudiando.

Maritza, se dedica a la venta de Comidas y lleva 15 años en el negocio, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, en un puesto muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes día a día. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Maritza belongs to the Brigada Ramírez Communal Bank in the Lamas District of Lamas Province in the Department of San Martín. She is single, 48 years old and the mother of one son that is still dependent upon her and is a student.

Maritza is engaged in the sale of meals and has been in this business for 15 years. The business is located in the central market of her district in a very well equipped stall where she attends to her customers day by day. She tells us she has very good sales every day because the tasty flavor she gives her dishes is well known and has a very good response.

At present she is continuing the same business and is very happy with the work she accomplishes. She waits on her customers personally with characteristic charm and kindness.

With this loan of 2000 soles she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of her dishes such as kilos of rice, liters of oil, chickens in 12 kilo lots, vegetables and also some utensils in order to give better service to her customers.

She still feels full of life and the desire to get ahead. She has many dreams and goals in her life such as starting her own well-equipped grocery shop. At the same time, she is thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuel Ramos Movement) because of its contribution to the establishment of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Jeannette Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Jeannethe del Socorro O., Labora como  Colectora TPA en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo, uno de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines, para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarle mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeannette del Socorro O. works as a custodian in Managua's Wholesale Market. She is married and has two children, one of whom is of school age. She has worked with CEPRODEL for three years, during which time she's used three CEPRODEL loans to improve her home. She is an excellent client. The requested loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as zinc roofing and beams in order to repair the roof of her house and be able to provide her children better, safer living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Edilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Edilberta es viuda, tiene 56 años y 10 hijos, Edilberta vende golosinas en la puerta de un colegio, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo, actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado. Además Edilberta se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en su casa.
Edilberta necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, chocolates.
Los sueños de Edilberta son que su hija sea policía, criar mas animales y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Edilberta is a member of the Pura Vida village bank. Edilberta is a widow. She is 56 años and has 10 children. From Monday to Saturday every week, she sells sweets from a three-wheeled cart outside a school. She also raises small animals in her house. Edilberta needs a loan of 900 soles, which she will use to buy cookies, candies, and chocolates. Her dreams are for her daughter to become a police officer, to raise more animals, and to open a shop in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, candies, and chocolates

loans.name: Elvis Ricardo

texts.es: El Sr. Elvis A. T. vive en casa de sus suegros junto a su esposa en el caserío Santa Dominguita.Su esposa está embarazada, no tienen hijos. Cuentan con un pequeño terreno el cual han estado construyendo con mucho esfuerzo gracias a sus ahorros producto de su trabajo. Actualmente está laborando como obrero de planta en una empresa agroindustrial de la zona. Su esposa estuvo laborando pero por motivo de riesgo en su embarazo ha dejado de laborar. Sus suegros los apoyan con sus gastos ya que son jóvenes muy trabajadores. Su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda en la cual han invertido gran parte de sus ahorros. No cuentan con endeudamiento en ninguna institución financiera. La joven familia A. Carhuayo agradece el apoyo que les podamos brindar para lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sr. Elvis A. T. lives with his wife in the home of his in-laws, which is in the village of Santa Dominguita. They do not have any children at the moment, but his wife is pregnant. Elvis has a small plot of land on which he is painstakingly building his house after saving some of his earnings from his job. He works as a factory worker for an agricultural business in the area. His wife was working, but she decided to stop in order to minimize any risk related to her pregnancy. The in-laws help them with the expenses because they are still young workers.

Elvis says his greatest dream is to finish the construction of his house into which he invested much of his savings. He does not have any current debts with any other financial institution. The A. family is grateful for the support to enable them to fulfill their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of a house

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Diana es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hija, Diana tiene un puesto en el mercado de Carmen Alto en donde vende artículos de ferretería, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Diana vende ropa a pedido.
Diana necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tubos, cementos, pegamentos.
Diana sueña con tener una ferretería grande y vender al por mayor, comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the Pura Vida village bank. Diana lives with her partner. She is 26 years old and has one daughter. She has a stall in the Carmen Alto market, where she works every day selling hardware. She also sells clothing on request. Diana needs a loan of 3000 soles, which she will use to buy pipes, cement, and glues. She dreams of having a large hardware store and selling wholesale, and of buying land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pipes, cement, glues.

loans.name: Leonel Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor Leonel Ernesto M. Chavarría, tiene la edad de 26 años, labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado  Iván  Montenegro de Managua.
El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, uno se encuentra  en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 6 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de cemento para la construcción de una pared ya que era lo único que le hacia falta para construir, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Leonel Ernesto M. Chavarría is 26 years old and works as a custodian in the Iván Montenegro market in Managua. He cares for his two children, one of whom is school aged. He is married, and has worked with Kiva partner CEPRODEL loans over the last five years. In this time he has received six loans to invest in the house in which he lives, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The requested loan is to purchase cement for the construction of the last wall needed in Leonel's house. The wall will afford better security and living conditions to his children and wife.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement.

loans.name: Gloria Bernice

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Bernice, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 45 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Gloria Bernice, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, lleva 08 años en el negocio. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 6:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en el cumplimiento de sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Gloria Bernice belongs to the communal bank "Brigada Ramírez in the Lamas district of the Lamas province, in the department of San Martín. She is married, 45 years old, and has two children who are dependent on her.

Gloria Bernice decided to sell prepared meals from her own home, which is well set-up for serving her customers. She has been in this business for 8 years. She tells us that she has good takings everyday, thanks to the delicious flavor of the food that she makes. Her main customers are residents of the city, passers-by, and regulars who know her well. She can count on a good reception.

Currently, she is continuing with this same business and is very happy with the work that she does from day to day, selling from 6:00am to 2:00pm. She attends to her customers herself, with her characteristic charisma.

With this loan of 3,000 soles, she will buy supplies for the daily preparation of her foods, such as rice by the kilo, sugar, oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, crates of chickens, vegetables, and also some tools for running her business and giving better attention to her customers.

She wants to keep moving ahead, and she has many dreams and goals in her life such as running her own well equipped grocery store. At the same time she is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the realization of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy food preparation supplies

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Felipa es soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Felipa compra y vende neumáticos usados, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, además vende accesorios para neumáticos.
Felipa necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos usados.
Los sueños de Felipa son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una casa y tienda propia.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the Pura Vida ("Pure Life") communal bank. She is 37 years old and single, with two children. Felipa buys and sells used tires, which she acquires in the city of Lima. She also sells accessories related to tires. Felipa needs a loan of 1250 Peruvian soles; she will use these funds to purchase used tires. Felipa's dreams are to see her children become professionals and to have a house and a store of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing used tires

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Ana es casada, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, Ana viaja a la feria de la ciudad de Huanta en donde vende artículos de ferretería, además Ana se dedica al tejido de gorras y bordado de correas típicas, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana y bisagras.
Los sueños de Ana es ampliar su negocio y ahorrar para la educación de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Pura Vida ("Pure Life") communal bank. Ana is 44 years old and married, with four children. Ana travels to the market in the city of Huanta, where she sells hardware products. She also works making woven caps and traditional embroidered belts, which she sells in the city's markets. Ana needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles. She will invest these funds in purchasing hinges and wool. Ana's dreams are to expand her business and to save for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing hinges and wool

loans.name: Magna

texts.es:
Magna es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Magna es soltera, tiene 29 años y vive con sus padres, trabaja en una Municipalidad, Magna viaja a las ferias en donD. compra cereales y lo venD. en el mercado D. abastos, actividad que realiza los días sábados.
Magna necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. cereales.
Los sueños D. Magna son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Magna is a member of the Communal Bank “Pura Vida” (Pure Life). She is 29 years old, single, lives with her parents, and works in the city. Magna travels to the fairs where she sells grain at the food market. She engages in this business every Saturday.

Magna needs a loan of 900 soles in order to buy more grain. She dreams of purchasing a car for transporting her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El  Señor. Ramón Gutiérrez U., tiene la edad de 54 años, Labora como VIGILANTE  en el Mercado Oriental de Managua.
  El  tiene tres hijos a su cargo, estos se encuentran  en edad escolar, es Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 10 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El que utilizara para la remodelación y cambio del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darles mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y esposa.

Ramón dijo que los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que gracias a estos ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramón Gutiérrez U. is 54 years old and works as a security guard at the Eastern Market in Managua. He is married and has three dependent children who are in school. Ramón has worked with CEPRODEL for eight years and has received ten home improvement loans. He is an excellent client.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials. He plans to do some remodeling and replace the roof of his house. His objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his wife and children. Ramón thanks CEPRODEL for approving his loans so that he could make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Hilda Maurina

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Hilda es separada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Hilda vende comida típica en el recreo de su mama, actividad que realiza los días domingos, además Hilda viaja a las ferias en donde compra animales que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Hilda en los próximos días apertura su tienda de abarrotes.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, fideo.
Los sueños de Hilda son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, comprar un carro para su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Pura Vida” (Pure Life). She is 38 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four children. Hilda sells traditional food at her mother’s resort every Sunday. In addition, she travels to the fairs where she buys animals to sell in the city of Ayacucho. She plans to open a grocery store within the next few days.

Hilda needs a loan of 3000 soles to purchase milk, rice, and noodles. She dreams of seeing her children complete their studies and purchasing a car for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, rice, and noodles

loans.name: Marie Jovana

texts.es:
La Sra. Marie Jovana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años tiene 03 hijos ya  independientes.  

Marie Jovana, lleva 12 años en el negocio, es una mujer trabajadora y con su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Cosméticos de la línea Esika, y Oriflame, sin tener que tener un jefe y horario. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada, ella vende al contado y al crédito con pagos de manera diaria, semanal quincenal o mensual.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00, comprará productos de belleza como: colonias, esmaltes, bisutería como aretes, collares y anillos, así como perfumes para varón que salen en ofertas, quiere tener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Marie Jovana, sueña con crecer en este negocio y llegar a ser una vendedora estrella para ganar buenos premios. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Marie Jovana belongs to the community banking group "Brigada Ramirez" in the Lamas District, Lamas Province, and Department (State) of San Martin. She's a live-in partner who is 32 years old and has three grown children, who are living independently. Marie Jovana has worked in this business for 12 years. She's always been known as a hard-working woman with a fighting spirit and she has desires to get ahead through her own means. This has paid off and allowed her to start her own business of cosmetic sales, including the Esika and Oriflame lines, without having to have a boss and set hours. Little by little, she has become well-known among her cilents, and today she tells us that she is doing very well in this line of business. Nowadays, she has a loyal following. She takes cash and credit, accepting daily, weekly, bi-monthly or monthly payments. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy beauty products like: colognes and nail polish, costume jewelry like earrings, necklaces and rings, as well as colognes for men that go on sale. She wants to have a well-stocked business and provide good service to her clients so that they can find what they need. Maria Jovana dreams of growing this business and becoming a star saleswoman so she can win great prizes. She's grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for also helping many women who want to develop themselves personally and in business.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Esta clienta tiene a su cargo dos hijos, estos se  encuentran en edad escolar, esta casada, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante diez años, en ese lapso ha invertido  12 créditos en la mejora de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del Techo de su  vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Ella dijo que los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda segura.
texts.en:
This woman has two dependent children who are in school. She has worked with CEPRODEL for ten years and received twelve home improvement loans. She is an excellent client. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase materials needed to refurbish the roof of her house and pay for labor. This will provide better living conditions for her children. She says the loans from CEPRODEL have helped greatly in making her home more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for materials & labor to make roof repairs.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro. 
Rayda es casada, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos, Rayda tiene 2 mototaxis, con uno de ellos su esposo realiza transporte publico y el otro lo alquila. 
Rayda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de las mototaxis.
Los sueños de Rayda son brindar una buena educación y alimentación a sus hijos, salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Rayda is a member of the Communal Bank “Ccori Ayllu”, which means “Golden Family”. She is 47 years old, married, and has five children. She has two motorcycle taxis, one is used by her husband and the other is offered as a rental.

Rayda is requesting a loan of 1000 soles in order to pay for maintenance of both vehicles. She dreams of feeding and educating her children, as well as succeeding in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Silvia Juana

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Silvia es separada, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Silvia compra cereales en los mercados de la ciudad, productos que procesa en harinas, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados. Además Silvia compra y vende animales menores, en algunas oportunidades se dedica al engorde de animales.
Silvia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos para engorde.
Los sueños de Silvia son que su hijo sea profesional y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Communal Bank “Ccori Ayllu”, which means “Golden Family”. She is 40 years old, separated from her spouse, and has one child. Silvia buys grain at the city markets and processes it into flour. She then sells her products at the markets. Silvia also buys and sells small animals, and takes the opportunity to fatten them. Silvia needs a loan of 800 soles to purchase pigs for fattening. She dreams of seeing her child become a professional and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs for fattening

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Señor  Silvio Rodríguez C., Labora como  Oficial Mantenimiento en el Mercado Roberto Huembés,
 El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, los dos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 5 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción: ladrillo, cemento, etc. para la remodelación del piso de la vivienda en la que habita y el pago de la mano de obra, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
Silvio dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha venido mejorando
texts.en:
Silvio Rodríguez C. works as a maintenance officer in the Roberto Huembés market in Managua. He is married with two children, both of whom are school aged. He has acquired several loans through Kiva partner CEPRODEL over the last four years. In this time, he has applied the proceeds of five loans granted through CEPRODEL to home renovations for his residence. He is an excellent client. The requested loan will be used to purchase construction materials: bricks, cement, etc., to remodel the floor of the home in which he lives as well as to pay for manual labor. His objective is to provide better security and living conditions for his children. Silvio attests that, thanks to the loans granted through Kiva partner CEPRODEL, his home has continued to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home renovations.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es: El joven Diego M. G. tiene 21 años de edad, es casado y vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su menor hija de dos años. Su domicilio está ubicado en el sector Santa Petronila distrito de Santiago- Ica. Labora como obrero de campo en la empresa Agrícola La Venta ubicada en la misma zona. Su esposa se dedica a labores de campo en parcelas de sus padres. Son personas muy trabajadoras que fueron damnificados del terremoto y han construído su casa, una parte de material noble y otra de caña y adobe. No cuenta con endeudamiento en ninguna institución y requiere de financiamiento para terminar de construir parte de su vivienda ya que cuenta con algunos materiales de construcción en stock. Su sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa y brindar mejor calidad de vida  a su familia. El Sr. Diego M. G. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar para alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Diego M. G. is 21 years old, married, and living in his own house with his wife and their 2-year-old daughter. Their home is in the Santa Petronila district of Santiago. He is a field worker with the La Venta agricultural company, located in the same area. His wife works in the field, in land owned by parents. They are hard-working people, victims of the earthquake. They have built their house partly of concrete, partly cane and adobe. They have no debts outstanding with any institution, and need financing to finish building their house, using construction materials available. Their dream is to finish building their house and offer the family a higher standard of living. The M. G. family is grateful for the support we can offer to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 59 años y 6 hijos, Alejandrina tiene una fabrica de Yeso llamada Yesera Cocharcas, que esta ubicado en local alquilado, sus ventas los realiza a las ferreterías al por mayor.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de piedra y leña.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son que su negocio se amplíe y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the village bank Ccori Ayllu, which means "golden family." Alejandrina is 59 years old. She is married and has six children. She rents a space out of which she runs Yesera Cocharcas, which makes plaster. She sells wholesale to hardware stores. Alejandrina needs a loan of 2500 soles, which she will use to buy stone and firewood. Her dreams are for her business to grow and her children to find good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone and firewood

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Maria es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija, porque ella trabaja en un hostal.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jabón y detergentes.
Los sueños de Maria son terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos ingresen a la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Ccori Ayllu”, which means “Golden Family”. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children. Maria has a store in her home where she sells groceries and beverages. Her daughter helps with managing the store and also works at a hostel.

Maria needs a loan of 600 soles in order to buy soap and detergents. Her dreams are to finish building her house and see her children start college.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soap & detergents

loans.name: Angelica Felomina

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Angélica es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Angélica vende jaulas de aves, alimento de aves, actividad que realiza los días domingos en la feria de las Américas.
Angélica necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jaulas de diferentes tamaños.
El sueño de Angélica es tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the Ccori Ayllu communal bank which means Family of Gold. Angélica is married, she is 32 and has 3 children. Angélica sells bird cages and bird feed, which she does on Sundays at the Americas market. Angélica needs a loan of PEN 1000 which will be used for the purchase of different sized cages. Angélica's dream is to have an established store.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of different sized bird cages.

loans.name: Alfredo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Alfredo Jose Manzanares C., tiene la edad de 57 años, Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de sus hijos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 5 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alfredo Jose Manzanares C. is 57 years old and works as custodian of the Oriental de Managua market. He has 3 children, 2 of which are in school. He is married and has worked with CEPRODEL for 5 years. At this point in time, he has invested 5 loans in the improvement of his home, thanks to CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The requested loan will be used for payment of manual labor and the purchase of construction materials such as iron sheets, beams, etc., which will be used to change the roof of his house. This will provide better security and quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and expansion of home.
